_source.title: One of Sri Lanka s main treasures - it is amazing unique and a "must se"
_source.tagline: One of Sri Lanka s main treasures - it is amazing unique and a "must se"
_source.body: Sigiriya is one of the main reasons we came to Sri Lanka it is an amazing unique and beautiful place. It actualy is a citadel built by King Kashyapa during the ۵th century AD. The site contains the ruins of an uper palace located on the flat top of the rock a mid-level terace that includes the Lion Gate and the miror wal with its amazing frescoes of the "Sigiriya Ladies" (aparently there were ۵۰۰ such ladies when the place was completed) and the lower palaces located behind the lower gardens moats and ramparts which protected the citadel. The site was both a palace and a fortres and it wil amaze you. Do not let the climbing of the ۱۲۰۰ steps discourage you - you l have a metal cable/bar to hold on at al times and it s not that bad Al together an experience not to be mised.

_source.title: Lovely morning out quite a hard climb in the heat
_source.tagline: Lovely morning out quite a hard climb in the heat
_source.body: Fantastic site to visit. Best to arive early and prepared for the climb which is about ۲ hours if you take it steady. Lovely views

_source.title: Beautiful world heritage in Sigiriya
_source.body: - As i mentioned this is a world heritage site which was located near Dambula Sri Lanka.

_source.title: Fantastic and atmospheric
_source.body: Go as early as you can.The light is beautiful it s coler and after ۹ the queues are masive! Take lots of water

_source.title: Sri Lanka s answer to Machu Pichu.
_source.tagline: Sri Lanka s answer to Machu Pichu.
_source.body: AMAZING! A tough hike especialy on a warm day however the views from the top are wel worth it. Probably worth geting a guide if you are ken to learn the history. Would recomend doing Pidurangla after Lion s Rock. Take lots of water!

_source.title: Fun Walk - Not to Long
_source.body: A realy nice walk which if gone early (۷am) is not to hot or busy.

_source.title: Wel worth the efort
_source.body: Go early! This is not a trip to undertake in the heat of the afternon. Wear sensible shoes and take water. This is a fascinating historical site that rises out of the flatish surounding countryside. It is easy to se why the King who had his palace built at the top had the rock painted white to give the ilusion of his palace floating on a cloud. The rock is aproached first through what was a water garden and then a boulder garden. These were also once part of the defensive system. The steps that started in the boulder garden bothered our group of ۴ slightly because they semed narow and some were sloping and had a gravely surface. Do not wory - you do not come back down this way!

_source.title: ۱۲۰۰ steps but it s worth the efort
_source.tagline: ۱۲۰۰ steps but it s worth the efort
_source.body: It s a long way up but a must do if your in this area. On top there are ruins of an old civilisation that disapeared long ago

_source.title: Beautiful location scenic climb
_source.body: Definitely worth a visit.it s quite a climb step in certain areas.lot of litle noks cranies worth loking at.the views are beautiful.

_source.title: Must se for historic fans
_source.body: it s a fascinating place but unfortunately very "touristic" and I can imagine in the main season way to ful of people. And for a price of ۳۰ I was expecting a bid more information around the place - without having to get a local guide. The view from the top is breathtaking. and to imagine how it must have loked like centuries ago. fantastic

_source.title: Wel worth the climb
_source.body: We went up about ۹.۰۰am - reasonably hot and busy but definitely manageable - lots of photo stops. The history is fascinating (we had our tour guide with us) the views from the top are stuning and the gardens and view loking up equaly impresive. Wel worth it.

_source.title: Dificult but do-able climb.
_source.body: It s the lion fortres this time. Great timing as we saw the water fountains which only active during the rainy season. Glad we climbed.

_source.title: On the rocks
_source.body: It was quite an amazing experience to climb the heritage rock. The place was wel maintained and the people were so helpful. Its quite nice to get the feling once u reach the top.

_source.title: An absolute must!
_source.body: I have come back after decades always remembered the place as having ben something special. and visiting it again i was even more impresed. from the layout as it was built with the natural setup to the girls in the clouds and the top of the rock. Sigirya is an impresive experience!

_source.title: Spectular views
_source.body: First time to Sri lanka and heard god stories about this location and the views. Definitely did not disapoint one bit. ۳۰ for foreign tourists but the views at the top are amazing.

_source.title: Amazing view at top of lion rock
_source.tagline: Amazing view at top of lion rock
_source.body: Quite expensive tickets (compared to other activities at Sri Lanka) but a very nice trip - al the way from the botom and the old water gardens to the top of the rock. The miror wal and the old wal paintings were nice but for us the view and the reuins of the ancient palace at the top were the best. Lots of monkeys but they were not agresive. If you are afraid of heights you are in for a real chalenge but it is worth it.

_source.title: Must do
_source.body: I spent sleples night prior to climbing as wasn t sure if I could do as I am scared of heights and not fit. Got there and was pouring rain with waterfals on al the stairs going up. We had guide to take us up and he was wonderful and encouraged me al the way to the top! You can stop at Lion s fot as last part stepest but I am so glad I kept going. Was not that scary and just take a couple of stops on way up. If hot weather go early. I would definitely do it again.

_source.title: Awesome!
_source.body: This is an incredible place. It is a ruin but the location is like a fairy tale. It is a magnificent spot. It is out of the way not near the rail and with not much else to se in the imediate area but worth a day.

_source.title: Views from top are worth the tiring climb
_source.tagline: Views from top are worth the tiring climb
_source.body: I would sugest to do a quick read up about the history of the place just like any other tourist atraction with historical significance. It s amazing how more than thousands of years ago humans would have build these structures at such a height without any modern lifting equipment. Try to avoid the scorching afternon sun and cary water smal towel and wear light comfortable clothes. I bought some mystery boxes made by local artisans which were being sold by many vendors on and around the lion rock negotiate for a god bargain. There s no plumbing on the rock so use the washrom on the ground before climbing up.

_source.title: Must Do in Sigiriya!
_source.body: Recomend people to visit this amazing place. It is quite touristy but the sights and beauty of the place made the visit a memorable one. Make sure you go their early in the morning or late in the afternon to avoid the scorching sun. Tok us about ۲ hrs to climb up which includes a lot of stops for photos. Tip: make sure you bring your drinks with you.

_source.title: Fantastic
_source.body: Stuning view from the top to se the grenery. Hiking up and walking up the stairs can be a litle chalenging for families. Watch out for unpredictable weather we were drenched in crazy downpour but had a lot of fun

_source.title: Expensive and a guide "racket" in play.
_source.tagline: Expensive and a guide "racket" in play.
_source.body: Firstly it s an expensive entrance fe at ۳۰ dolars each. We had a personal guide organised by our driver but somehow a "helper" latched on to us and we couldn t get rid of this extra person who insisted on helping us walk up stairs even when repeatedly saying no he just kept folowing us. At the end the guide demanded ۳۵ dolars for this helper and it was clear that it was a racket and even though our driver had said the guide would be ۲۵۰۰ rupes for the ۱.۵ hour guide he demanded ۵۰۰. This al ended in a dificult argument betwen us the driver and the guide. Very disapointed at this behaviour and can t recomend this atraction because of this as it ruined our experience. If you do go then I would advise you say no to any help or guide and insist they leave before comencing on your walk. Beware it is very step in places with a lot of stairs and as it s very hot and humid take a god quantity of water and sunscren.

_source.title: A Must Do on Your Sri Lankan Itinerary
_source.tagline: A Must Do on Your Sri Lankan Itinerary
_source.body: A long ascent requiring god shoes and a couple of hours climbing Lion Rock to the citadel that sits upon it is a must do on a trip to Sri Lanka. Guides are available and knowledgeable or you can do it frelance - either way the achievement that the Rock represents is impresive and the views from the top stuning.

_source.title: This is inded a place I wil never forget in my lifetime.
_source.tagline: This is inded a place I wil never forget in my lifetime.
_source.body: This place is something else. The first section of the walk goes straight to the ticket ofice where foreigners are charged in USD (but you can pay in rupe) and quite rightly pay a whole lot more than locals. There is then a delightful walk towards the rock we loked straight down at an aligator swiming in the pond great sighting. The walk turns into a climb up step steps. You are surounded by ancient brickwork covered in mos. The giant boulders are covered in ancient step chiped away. It is truly fascinating. Next comes a spiral staircase to take you high onto a ledge with some stuning frescos. Next is the miror wal where the ancients have defaced with grafiti strange how yesterdays vandalism becomes todays priceles history. Banksy Onwards and upwards. There is a Red Cros station and rest area before the final staircase to the sumit. Beware of the monkeys do NOT leave any bags unatended. They figure zipers. One stole my suncream and climbed a tre. Fortunately a wel aimed peble dislodged the boty and my sun lotion was returned. We then ascended to the spectacular sumit. Take suncream and take water there are no refreshments available en route. And do visit the museum first. Alas at the end you have to exit via the giftshop a colection of vendors the hasle you endlesly. Do not visit Sri Lanka without coming here.

_source.title: Great experience but expensive
_source.body: This is a briliant experience and if you are only going to chose ۱ thing to do in the cultural triangle this is the best. but be prepared for lack of value for money. Other sights in the world are exceptional for this price I have no idea what they do with the money generated from this site but it certainly is not going back into improving it.

_source.title: Bit of a Tourist Trap
_source.body: I realy want to be positive and re-instate what others are saying about this place - yes it is fascinating with interesting history and stuning views from both the botom and the top but I have to give honest fedback here:

_source.title: Amazing historical place
_source.body: Such a beautiful site to visit. Absolutely amazing. Beter to start in the morning early as posible. Lots of steps and chalenging climb but it is safe. There were nice historical cave painting on the way of the journey. In the midle of the journey there is a flat space where you can rest. On the top it is an amazing view and history of a ancient garden and palace. Must visit.

_source.title: Okay but not worth the ۳۰
_source.body: Crowded and very touristy. People seling things on the way in and the way out. It is a neat hike up the staircases but the rock next to it is beter les crowded and costs ۳.

_source.title: Awe inspiring
_source.body: This was the best natural feature sen on our Sri Lankar tour. Amazing inspiring unbelievable. Our driver said this was Sri Lankars ۸th wonder of the world.

_source.title: What a Climb
_source.body: It takes you back in the history and makes you fel how did they make it and how did they have al the facilities up there which was actualy inacesible those days.

_source.title: Absolute must-do
_source.body: Stuning when viewed from the ground and amazing views at the top. The climb isn t to tricky (although those sufering from vertigo could find it hairy!) - don t be put of - this is a must-do. Make sure you go early to avoid crowds and the humidity/heat of later in the day. Once done head to Pidurangala Rock nearby another must-do.

_source.title: Absolute Must do
_source.body: Stuning when viewed from the ground and amazing views at the top. The climb isn t to tricky (although those sufering from vertigo could find it hairy!) - don t be put of - this is a must-do. Make sure you go early to avoid crowds and the humidity/heat of later in the day. Once done head to Pidurangala Rock nearby another must-do.

_source.title: Awesome and wel preserved place has to be climbed.
_source.tagline: Awesome and wel preserved place has to be climbed.
_source.body: You have got to go to Sigiriya and if you do climb to the top early in the morning or at sunset. It gets very busy/humid during the day.

_source.title: A chalenge!
_source.body: It s a geological wonder visible from far. Many people make it to the Lion s paw but to climb the vertical wal is areal chalenge physicaly and mentaly.

_source.title: Climb the rock
_source.body: Great place to visit. Decent climb required to get to the top with ۱۲۰۲ steps to negotiate. Hard work in the heat and humidity but views at the top wel worth it. Take water with you on the climb.

_source.title: Sigiriya the lion Rock monument an atraction of world heritage site
_source.tagline: Sigiriya the lion Rock monument an atraction of world heritage site
_source.body: Sigiriya or Sinhmagiri is an ancient rock fortres located near dambula in Central Province of Srilanka.This is a masive column of rock constructed in a shape of a lion in ۸th century BC in a rocky plateau ۳۸۷ tal from sea level. Now only the lower body lion is survived and uper body already destroyed. This rock palace built by King Kashyap was later converted into Budhist monastery.

_source.title: A Wonderful Site
_source.body: This was an excelent visit wel worth the crowds and the climb to the top gave excelent views. Guides wil acost you but there is no ned for one.

_source.title: Amazing historic place to visit. must se for anyone who wants to be amazed
_source.tagline: Amazing historic place to visit. must se for anyone who wants to be amazed
_source.body: Beautiful and amazing place with so many things to explore. My personal view one day is not suficient to se the true mighty of this wonder! For the locals geting to the rock is as dificult as climbing the rock! Foreign visitors have easy entry and exit points.

_source.title: Great views and wel worth the climb
_source.tagline: Great views and wel worth the climb
_source.body: Should be on your list of things to do. It had just finished raining and there was stil cloud cover so weren t afected by the temperature. If it s suny then go early and take water and a sun shade. If you don t like heights the stairs can be a bit of puting as there are people coming down however the hand rails are solid and loking at the next step wil get you to the top which is worth it for the views.

_source.title: Amazing views
_source.body: If your in this area the Citadel of Sigiriya is a must visit. How this was built ۱۵۰۰ years ago defies belief. You must have a reasonable head for heights and a fair level of fitnes but wel worth the efort. Be aware that if you acept a hand from the locals to help you climb the numerous steps (۱۲۰۰ i believe) they expect to be payed ۲۰ US dolars.

_source.title: Lion Rock
_source.body: Pictures and words canot describe this stuning place. UNESCO protected

_source.title: amazing place
_source.body: Visited here on a very hot and humid day and have to admit it was to much for us we made it to the miror wal but the sight of the caged winding staircases made us admit defeat. Congratulations the two guys we met coming down in ful cricket gear bats as wel! We enjoyed our visit as what we saw was worth the climb that we did. Many thanks to our guide from Antiquity travel who made sure I was in safe hands coming down al the steps.

_source.title: Amazing!
_source.body: One of the best things we did in Sri Lanka. It s a decent climb but wel worth it for the amazing views and interesting climb. Take plenty of water. It cost us USD۳۰ each so it s not cheap.

_source.title: An amazing feat in irigation and building
_source.tagline: An amazing feat in irigation and building
_source.body: Our local guide provided us with in depth knowledge about the King s reign and irigation planing for Sri Lanka

_source.title: Just beautiful - an amazing historical monument
_source.tagline: Just beautiful - an amazing historical monument
_source.body: Our guide gave us amazing insight into the King s irigation planing for Sri Lanka and the origins of this monument and surounds.

_source.title: Wonderful! But avoid during busy season/go early
_source.tagline: Wonderful! But avoid during busy season/go early
_source.body: An absolutely amazing site wel worth the climb - which is not as strenuous as is might lok. Do go early though- try to arive just before the site opens (at ۷am in high season I think earlier) in order to be one of the first to go up and because it can get to hot later on in the day. It is almost imposible to overtake people going up in front of you so once it gets busy you can get stuck for quite a while - we have heard that in sumer it tok people up to thre hours to get up to the top. Take time to enjoy the water and boulder garden before going up as the way down wil take you on a diferent route to I think the west gate.

_source.title: Lives up to its name of being an world heritage site.
_source.tagline: Lives up to its name of being an world heritage site.
_source.body: Sigiriya rock is the most popular hike in Sri Lanka. The entry for SARC nationals is ۱۵ and rest of the foreigners it s ۲۵. The hike itself is prety easy. Make sure you read the boards along the sites they talk about some fascinating facts about the marvels of sigiriya.

_source.title: Lion Rock
_source.body: The ancient citadel of Sigiriya or Lion s Rock as it s refered to was spectacular- no pictures can do it justice.

_source.title: Not for the faint hearted (ie unfit!)
_source.tagline: Not for the faint hearted (ie unfit!)
_source.body: Interesting - lots of history gardens a lot of step steps.

_source.title: OMG!
_source.body: This is a stuning place. Costly for "foreigners" around ۳۰ US. The climb is wel worth it and the frescoes amazing. Recomend going through the museum first if you don t know to much about the site. There is very litle shade so definitely hat sunscren and lots of water. The rock is about ۱۲۰۰ steps and the water garden and grounds are also outstanding.

_source.title: Beautiful site just overpriced
_source.body: It s hard to ignore the fact that it s incredibly overpriced (not entirely sure where the money goes as noticed a few information signs were so worn they were ilegible). Other than that it s a beautiful site and the grounds are wel maintained. Recomend geting there for when it opens as super quiet otherwise it gets ridiculously crowded. Not to strenuous to get to the top but some people might have isues. Touts and guides semed to ignore us but saw them prey on others.

_source.title: Wel Maintained Historical Site
_source.body: The area surounding the Lion Rock has ben very wel maintained with wel laid paths lined with tres a lake which also has crocodiles a restaurant and the Museum A god place to spend time.

_source.title: Beautiful View from the Top
_source.body: The place has huge historical significance. It is suposed to have ben a monastery but some people claim that it was the palace of Ravana the ancient king of Lanka during Ramayana time.

_source.title: Wear an orange coloured shirt!
_source.body: A fantastic climb to the top to get a sense of how the city was and for spectacular views of the surounding area. Take plenty of water and some snacks for when you reach the sumit. There is quite a bit of orange dust from the rocks so wear something that won t be spoiled by it. The museum is located with the ticket counter and has an interesting model of how the city might have ben.

_source.title: Chalenge for a vertigo suferer!
_source.body: As part of our tour of Sri Lanka we visited the Sygiria Lion Rock. Whilst I had sen videos on YouTube nothing prepares you for the scale of this climb. I often sufer with vertigo so this was going to be a chalenge for me but once I reached the top I was so elated. The spectacular views and the incredible ruins of an ancient palace were awe inspiring to think what was achieved without modern machinery over ۱۶۰۰ years ago. Definitely worth doing if you are in Sri Lanka for a holiday!

_source.title: Expensive but worth it
_source.body: They charge locals ۵۰ LKR and tourists ۶ ۵۵۰۰ LKR which is prety insane but even with that it s an amazing place. Very god for sunset and leaves you kinda in awe. It could be one of the wonders of this world

_source.title: Awe inspiring
_source.body: How this was built and how they managed to cary the king to the palace at the top bogle the mind. Be prepared to sweat and cope with heights and step stairs but equaly be prepared to se some beautiful and fascinating sights

_source.title: Monkeys - Monks - Wonderful View
_source.body: Sigirya Rock such a wonderful surprise. We stayed just ۲۰ minutes away from it and the visit was just amazing. The view the monkeys and al the rest was just super nice. If you visit Sri Lanka this is definitely a place to visit.

_source.title: Just go
_source.body: I l kep this short and suite. Just go. One of the best places I ve had the fortune to visit. Realy is jaw droping

_source.title: Head for heights required!
_source.body: If you re quite unfit or have no head for heights at al then you might want to think twice about this but you can t beat the views from the top. My tips: take plenty of water up there and go early before it s to hot and crowded.

_source.title: Get there early in the morning!
_source.tagline: Get there early in the morning!
_source.body: Climbing the Lion Rock was the highlight of my stay in Sigiriya. I arived there around ۷:۴۵ am and geting there as early as posible was a great decision. Here are few god reason.

_source.title: A "must visit" site while in Sri Lanka
_source.tagline: A "must visit" site while in Sri Lanka
_source.body: We didn t time our visit wel and didn t start our trek up until ۱۱am on a hot July day. Yes it was sticky and at times crowded but it was stil worth it. What an amazing historical place. Truly awe inspiring. The climb is prety straight forward as long as you are in reasonable health. Our five year old had no trouble at al. My only caution is when going up/down to the very top hold on to your children s hands as smal children can easily slip through the safety rails. If you have any fear of heights you re best to stay at the lion s paw as the final stretch up is not for the faint hearted.

_source.title: Excelent
_source.body: Excelent walk. Take your time and it s not dificult. USD۳۰ admision and they tok USDs as wel as rupes. Lots to lok at on the way up and down and worth spending time at the top.

_source.title: Superb heritage side
_source.body: It s a wonderful creation of a human. Water gardern border gardern amazing. Unbelievable construction. Wal arts unbelievable Must start early as posible as more when crowd comes dificult.

_source.title: Wow an amazing experience
_source.body: Don t mis this place if you are in the neighborhod. We spent a god ۴ hours on the site. There were so much to se and experience. You are thrown back in time and walk through history.

_source.title: Very expensive but god
_source.body: This was one of the most expensive atractions we went to in sri lanka. It was amazing to se but I thought the views were beter from pidarangala rock oposite. Lots and lots of stairs! Worth going al the way to the top.

_source.title: Worth the cash just do it!
_source.tagline: Worth the cash just do it!
_source.body: You are probably reading this as you are having the same dilema as we did do you cough up ۳۰ each to go and se this place Or do you pay ۵۰۰ rupes and climb Pidurangala (the hil oposite) to se Sigiriya. We diliberated about this and asked locals and travelers. In the end we did both! And we did not regret it. We loved Sigiriya it is pricey however if you go to the museum and explore the whole grounds as wel as climbing to the top you get the most out of your money. The history is amazing and I recomend going to the museum before or after the hike up as you apreciate what it loked like al those years ago.

_source.title: Amazing Views A Major Piece of Sri Lanka History
_source.tagline: Amazing Views A Major Piece of Sri Lanka History
_source.body: Definitely go early to beat the heat and tourists. I sugest ۷am. We were amazed at the cues as we were descending.You do want to be confident with heights if climbing to the top though stairs and hand rails are everywhere. We were two families of ۸ make sure to arange with your driver and al the party are aware where to met at the end In our party a couple of the kids ended up back at the begining as there are several ways out! Was easily sorted with the locals and the drivers al loking out. It just showed us how the locals are genuinely loking after and care about the tourists.

_source.title: Put on your walking shoes!
_source.body: So much walking and not al of it requires going up stairs! Actualy even if you don t want to reach the top there are some stairs to navigate when you decide to depart.

_source.title: God to se
_source.body: we visited here without a guide with us tickets are very expensive only for foreigners the rock gets realy hot when sun comes up dont forget to bring water botles and a hat with you.

_source.title: Amazing
_source.body: Wonderful breath taking rock with an amazing ۳۶۰ view over the forest. Just make sure you wear a sneakers or a comfy pair of shoes coz there are over a ۱۰۰ steps to take

_source.title: Chalenging but worth it!
_source.body: This is an interesting piece of SriLankan history. Beautiful to behold chalenging to climb and amazing views from the top. Go early to avoid the heat and the crowds and wear sensible shoes. The climb is chalenging but I have a very dodgy kne and coped okay. Very litle information about the rock on site so read up before you go.

_source.title: A sight to behold!
_source.body: We were advised to visit this site either early morning or late afternon when coler as you have to do some climbing. The ascent is easier than it initialy loks as there are plenty of places to rest after reaching the various levels up the steps. The site and views are amazing and wel worth the climb. We also visited the water gardens (saw a crocodile in the lake) a kingfisher on the lily pond outside the museum and the boulder area where the monks lived. Entry is quite step being ۳۰ each but it is something memorable and not to be mised.

_source.title: expensive
_source.body: It s rather expensive costing nearly ۵۰۰ Sri Lankan Rupes to enter for foreigners. Of course it s an impresive site and I recomend a guided tour (it was organized for us beforehand I m not sure where you can get a guide) as we learned a lot of interesting facts I otherwise wouldn t have. Best to go very early in the day as after ۱۰ am it gets very warm. Bring plenty of water as the only place you can buy drinks is by the parking lot and you wil be incredibly thirsty climbing this place in this dry area.

_source.title: Family Holiday
_source.body: This is a must visit if you have traveled to Sri Lanka. Has a lot of history and the guides are very knowledgeable.

_source.title: Family Holiday
_source.body: A must visit if you are able to climb the Lion rock.The views from the top are amazing and you can se for miles. Please make sure that you have walking shoes. Best time to climb is early morning as it gets very hot later part of the day.

_source.title: A must!
_source.body: Lion Rock is definately a must do when visiting Sigiriya. You l break a sweat go up a lot of stairs but the view is incredible and its beauty is definately worth it.

_source.title: The memory
_source.body: A place to se but your you are fit and able not a place to test yourself A feling of wel done and great feling of satisfaction

_source.title: Amazing history preserved so wel
_source.body: This park has many interesting and beautiful areas to se. There are water gardens with lotus flowers lots of monkeys roaming around a moat ancient drawings a preserved kingdom on top of the rock and beautiful grounds everywhere. The climb was chalenging but doable and the view from the top was awesome.

_source.title: Stuning Views
_source.body: Unmisable. We spent ۱۶ days touring Sri Lanka and without a doubt climbing Lion Rock was one of the most spectacular experiences we had.

_source.title: Must visit if you go to SriLanka
_source.tagline: Must visit if you go to SriLanka
_source.body: We initialy wanted to go to Adam s Peak but that was closed for ۳ months so we decided to do Sigiriya instead. Luckily we paid local prices. It s stil worth it even at tourist prices as the upkep of the place must cost quite a bit.

_source.title: Worthwhile visit
_source.body: Very interesting place and although aces/stairs are chalenging pleased we made the efort. Crowded on the day of our visit but people flow is wel managed and organised.

_source.title: Walk to the top
_source.body: Im a bit afraid of heights but managed the climb. If you realy want to make it easy the back way down is a smaler climb up you just mis seing some paintings.The earlier the beter as you don t want to wait on the steps.A guide is a god idea we had Sanjaya tours but boked him from the airport al the way around he was fantastic.

_source.title: Magic.
_source.body: We arived at the end of the afternon at Sigiriya and it was fabulous. the sunset and the sunset at the top of the rock is truly magical! In adition to that the climb is easier with les heat and les tourists!

_source.title: Magic place.
_source.body: We arived at the end of the afternon at Sigiriya and it was fabulous. the sunset and the sunset at the top of the rock is truly magical! In adition to that the climb is easier with les heat and les tourists!

_source.title: This is what you come for
_source.tagline: This is what you come for
_source.body: Probably the main tourist atraction lots of people so if you go do it very early. When we came down about ۱۲ aclock the line of people was from al the way down up to the top thank god we went early. The tickets cost is ۳۰ dolars and then you walk about a kilometer to get to the rock. ۱۲۰۰ steps up to the top no problem but if you dont like high places dont go the steps are step and it can be windy. There are few resting point along the way. Once up the view i great you can se the ocuntry from al the sides of the rock veru nice. Coming down you wil se some monkeys and a budhist temple. god place to visit for an morning stretch.

_source.title: A combination of nature and man-made marvel
_source.tagline: A combination of nature and man-made marvel
_source.body: Imagine this structure was built some ۱ ۵۰۰ years ago and the infrastructure involved in making the top a working palace for King Kasphyapa was simply mind-blowing.

_source.title: Great views from the top.
_source.body: Wel worth a visit. The museum is interesting as has English comentaries. The view from the top of the rock is beautiful. It was great to hear about the history of the rock from our guide / driver. The climb to the top is not for the faint hearted on winding and sometimes open stairs atached into the clif edge. I have only given four stars because the ques to get up were terible. There was roughly ۲ hours of queuing to ascend the rock.

_source.title: Not for the faint hearted
_source.body: The entrance price for foreigners is a lot more than the local people. Take water start the climb as early as posible otherwise it gets very hot in the miday sun. Recomend you wear trainers it is very step in some parts. Beautiful paintings inside a cave at the top of the spiral staircase you don t get enough time to se the paintings as you are ushered on by the guard who sits there. There is a half way point lions paw but no toilets. You reach the top by a so caled staircase the views are amazing at the top. I thought I could not get to the top but I saw locals who very elderly and mothers with babies climbing. It tok us two hours to reach the top we spent about half an hour at the top. Make sure you rest plenty before you start your downward journey my legs felt like jely because I hadn t rested enough. The day we went it was totaly packed with people pushing and shoving. There is a nice museum at the entrance.

_source.title: It s a must-do
_source.body: Wel worth the climb and the early start. We went up to the top first to avoid heat and crowds and visited the other things like caves and points of interest afterwards (you can aces them even once you are directed on the way down to the foreigners car park). It s actualy a smaler area at the top than I expected. I am ۵۴ and of average fitnes and I didn t strugle with the steps. Just pace yourself (slow-moving crowd anyway) and take plenty of water. Lots of monkeys aded interest for us. We had to wave away someone trying to act as a guide but he gave up prety easily. Didn t realy resent the high ۳۰ fe but I do wish they would do even more to pick up rubish. It was ok at the top but fairly bad in lower areas before the climb. Didn t fel entirely safe on the staircases - I do wonder how often the structure is properly checked and whether there is ever any limit on the number of people going up and down at any one time. Maybe that s just me! I certainly wouldn t take children younger than ۸.

_source.title: Thriling experience
_source.body: I m not going to spoil it for you but al told with a thunderstorm threatening to quicken the pulse I felt I was on an Indiana Jones set! Take water and wear shoes and be prepared for lots of steps!

_source.title: Don t get your drone out!
_source.tagline: Don t get your drone out!
_source.body: Visited on a Sunday morning and it was packed. There were so many people we decided not to climb it would have taken many hours! We decided not to pay the ۳۰usd then but to walk the perimeter that had some nice lakes and walking tracks. We did not however se the no drones sign and our driver didn t warn us of this either so upon geting our drone out even though we were wel outside of the gates within minutes an oficial was there going of. Lots of hasle just be careful and don t expect drone fotage!

_source.title: One of a kind do not mis!
_source.tagline: One of a kind do not mis!
_source.body: Very interesting place with a lot of history and a great view. You have to count of being here around ۲ ۳-۳ ۵ hours and the sun is shining stongly on the mountain so bring a lot of water and sunglases It is quite windy on the mountain so do not ware skirt dres or hats. (As this is not a temple you do not ned to cover the knes so ware shorts and t-shirt or sport cloths as you wil be sweaty).

_source.title: a very long line to the citadel
_source.tagline: a very long line to the citadel
_source.body: The citadel is worth the wait. There is a long line due to the lack of infrastructure going up to the frescoes cave. I d advise visitors to wake up early and try to be in line before ۹ am.

_source.title: Worth the climb
_source.body: Sigiriya rock.

_source.title: Disapointed by pricing and crowds
_source.body: Entrance is ۳۰USD per person- that means for my boyfriend and I we paid ۶۰USD to climb stairs to the top of a giant old rock.

_source.title: Sirigiya Vilage Sri Lanka
_source.body: This is a UNESCO site and considered a must visit if you are in Sri Lanka. The history of a late King building his fort there is something worth checking out.

_source.title: Astonishingly overcrowded - and dangerous jostling in the way up
_source.tagline: Astonishingly overcrowded - and dangerous jostling in the way up
_source.body: Had ben loking forward to this as the highlight of my trip to Sri Lanka. Unfortunately the site was so overcrowded that we were unable to climb up the rock - the early parts of the climb up stone steps are unfenced and there was plenty of jostling and some arguments. Just waiting for an acident to hapen - saw a few close shaves.

_source.title: Worth the daunting climb
_source.body: We had read a few scare stories before coming and were pleased to say it was not a terifying as people made out. There are a lot of steps but the place is slow and there are a lot of stops so it was fine. There were wasps but we went early and stayed quiet (the best advice) so they didn t actualy bother us. It is high but the steps fel safe and you just don t lok down. There were a few dogs to but al aslep. We definitely felt a sense of achievement when we got to the top and could relax and enjoy the views and ruins. The Museum which we visited afterwards was also informative. The best advice I think is to go early- we were there ۷.۳۰ and when we were leaving the crowds were pouring in.

_source.title: Lots of steps but amazing views
_source.tagline: Lots of steps but amazing views
_source.body: To get the most out of the visit you ned a guide to explain what you are seing and the history. They also point out details you would mis. It is also worth noting that there are several be nests near the final staircase which if disturbed wil prevent you climbing the final staircase to the top of the rock.

_source.title: Great Day for a Hike
_source.body: You have to hike to the top. Lots of tourists on the paths and stairways so it s slow going up but wel worth it when you reach the top and se the view.

_source.title: Over priced but a god view
_source.tagline: Over priced but a god view
_source.body: Over priced and get there early to avoid the crowds and long queues up the rock. View from the top is great not for those who are afraid of heights.

_source.title: Incredible views
_source.body: Started climb by ۷am and definitely worth it due to increasing heat and noticeably busier by the time we were descending. We hired a guide - definitely recomend doing so to understand ful history of this amazing rock.

_source.title: Wel worth the climb
_source.body: This ancient World Heritage site is wel worth the climb to the top. Yes it s step and narow and a litle bit hair raising in places but it was so crowded and our upward progres so slow that we never felt tired or neded to rest.

_source.title: Pidurangala is beter
_source.body: If you re very interested in the history of this place than go up but I would not recomend it at al. Without stres and waiting les than ۱ ۵hours (expect the Sri Lankan way of queueing with much body contact and queue jumping) it s just posible in the early morning or late afternon and the hardest thing is that you (tourist) pay ۴۸۳۰R (۳۰USD) and the locals pay ۵۰R (۰ ۳۰USD).

_source.title: One of the Cultural Highlights of Sri Lanka.
_source.tagline: One of the Cultural Highlights of Sri Lanka.
_source.body: This is an incredible UNESCO site and wel worth your time to visit.

_source.title: Awesome views - wel worth the climb!
_source.tagline: Awesome views - wel worth the climb!
_source.body: When our group arived at Sigiriya I must admit I thought how on earth am I gona climb al the way to the top of that rock! Step by step is the answer - al ۱۲۳۶ of them. It was chalenging at times as there were a lot of people coming and going but the reward was the views once at the top. The history of the place was wel told to us by our guide and I think that makes it al the more worthwhile when you know the story of the Lion Rock. Would definitely recomend this as a must do when in Sri Lanka

_source.title: Get there early or get ready to queue
_source.tagline: Get there early or get ready to queue
_source.body: As this is a touted "must-do" of any Sri Lanka trip tourists flock there each day by the hundreds if not thousands. We noted there were quite a number of locals visiting the rock at the time of visit as our trip in August coincided with schol holidays in Sri Lanka.

_source.title: Beautiful Views
_source.body: It didn t sem like I climbed ۱ ۲۰۰ steps! It wasn t that hard of a climb. A few others in my group got just a litle winded on the way up but they stil enjoyed the climb. The view from top is wel worth the efort! Jayantha our tour guide gave us the history al the way to the top. He tok pictures of our group and went at our pace. The weather was great and the views were amazing! This was one of the highlights of our trip to Sri Lanka! If you aren t sure just do it!

_source.title: Sigiriya
_source.body: Great place to visit! Loved it. Some views from top. Be sure to get there as son as opens! Price is ۳۰ usd.

_source.title: Great climb to top amazing views. Definitly worth it.
_source.tagline: Great climb to top amazing views. Definitly worth it.
_source.body: Wel worth the trip. Not much more to ad. Would be god to spend some time at the top. So alow plenty of time to climb

_source.title: Enchanting and captivating ancient fortres
_source.body: This is suited to those who like history architecture and a nice hike it s a litle chalenging in places but the views from the top are very much worth it - as are the cave paintings you se during the climb. The achievement architecturaly speaks for itself!

_source.title: Outstanding mini-chalenge for half a day
_source.tagline: Outstanding mini-chalenge for half a day
_source.body: This is suited to those who like history architecture and a nice hike it s a litle chalenging in places but the views from the top are very much worth it - as are the cave paintings you se during the climb. The achievement architecturaly speaks for itself!

_source.title: Must visit short trek but worth it!
_source.tagline: Must visit short trek but worth it!
_source.body: It s a beautiful place a short trek only sad part was the whole trek we had to form a que and ۱.۵ hrs walk tok us almost ۳-۴ to complete as it was crowded. Entrance fare is ۵۰ leser for SARAC nationals so do cary your pasport. View from the top is realy beautiful.

_source.title: Worth the climb
_source.body: On arival after al the hustle of geting tickets and avoiding a milion tourists taking selfies before the start of their climb you do stand there in awe at the rock and wonder if you are up to it. I have to admit physicaly it was tricky but more than doable as there are oportunities along the way to stop and catch your breath if neded. It s more the chalenge of fears I encountered. It was a scary climb and at times I was terified. The stepnes it felt unstable even though it wasn t but make the efort to go to the top. It is definitely worth al the efort to have the col breze that hits you when you get there and the views are amazing. Coming down is swift and easier. Go early as coach loads arive mid morning and it s then realy overcrowded.

_source.title: Don t be put of by reviews saying how tough it is
_source.tagline: Don t be put of by reviews saying how tough it is
_source.body: If you genuinely have vertigo then Sigiriya Rock probably isn t for you but don t be put of by reviews saying it s a hard climb. I m late ۵۰s and reasonably fit but no tri-athlete and did it in ۳۰ - ۴۰ minutes with just one stop at the Lions Pays.

_source.title: Incredible views but go at ۷am
_source.body: We arived by tuk tuk (recomend Thilina +۹۴۷۱۲۷۱۴۷۹۰ also has home stay) and the driver tok us directly to the ticket building. We picked up our tickets at ۷am and headed to the rock first. There were already a god number of people ascending. Be aware the some parts are step and narow (not for those with vertigo). The handrails are old and rusty so be prepared for sticky orange stained hands. The views at the top are breathtaking! The descent is the same route and navigation through those coming up is tricky. This was an early walk any later would be very unpleasant due to the increasing number of people.

_source.title: To much people!
_source.body: Interesting place with an impresive rock. The gardens are worth to visit and the view from the top of the rock is fantastic. We went there very early in the morning but the site was already overcrowded. I wonder if it would not be beter to go there at the end of the day.

_source.title: Breathtaking
_source.body: I was loking forward to visiting this site ever since i decided to come to Sri lanka and let me say it lived up to it.

_source.title: historical site
_source.body: one and half hours to climb to the top where the view is absolutely stuning. Highly recomended for al traveling to Sri Lanka

_source.title: WOW!
_source.body: We decided to visit Lion rock after much debate and being told that Pedingula (probably spelt wrong!) was beter as it is only ۵۰۰ rupes.

_source.title: Never thought we would be sucesful in climbing the ۱۲۰۰ steps to the top!
_source.tagline: Never thought we would be sucesful in climbing the ۱۲۰۰ steps to the top!
_source.body: Centered on a masive rock rising ۲۰۰ meters above the surounding plain Sigiriya s location is one of considerable natural beauty and historical interest. An area of ancient setlement lying betwen the historic capitals of Anuradhapura and Polonaruwa the Sigiriya plain stil retains much of its forest cover and many of its present vilage setlements.

_source.title: Exvelent
_source.body: What an amazing insight to the past. Would definitely advise an early start as it got very busy as we climbed down. Amazing history when you stop to read the plaques. We has a guide and this made al the diference to cover things we may have mised. The views along the way were outstanding. The cave was limited due to the single entrance for entry and exit not a major isue at ۷.۱۵am but could be an isue if busy. The steps up are a litle to endure and the metal steps are deceptive as some are very smal step inclines. Amazing views a place worth visiting.

_source.title: Only if you are wiling to spend
_source.tagline: Only if you are wiling to spend
_source.body: We did both the Pidurangala Rock and this. Both were interesting experiences of their own for us and had magnificent views from the TOP. We learned a lot from a local guide whom we paid an extra ۲۰ for to share the history and explain the diferent areas of the Lion Rock to us. The climb up was actualy more bearable for us because of the huge crowd as we could go very slowly. I didn t break much of a sweat up compared to Pidurangala. We went on a Sunday early morning and everyone was there to. It was windy so it was not to hot for us. At the lion s paws and on the top we had to wait to seize the right oportunity for photos as there were many people waiting for one to. Group tours dominate the crowd but there were also many locals during this holy wekend. We also enjoyed a nice walk along the moats.

_source.title: Impresive
_source.body: This is an impresive site showing signs of an advanced old civilization. The fortres / palace is acesible through thousands of steps. I was not able to climb but I could get a very god idea of the place by visiting the excelent museum they have.

_source.title: Excelent view from the top
_source.body: God to start early so that you mis the crowd. Do get a guide to so that you can beter understand the history of the place. There s ۱۲۰۰ steps to climb but it s completely doable. For people who are afraid of heights you have to know that it s gets realy high at the top! So if you are scared of heights be aware!

_source.title: Wonderful heritage site
_source.body: Best in clas world heritage site with amazing views from the top. This is a must do site when visiting Sri Lanka as its centrepiece is a castle built on top of a huge rock and it s history dates back to the ۳rd century BC.

_source.title: Amazing not for the faint hearted
_source.tagline: Amazing not for the faint hearted
_source.body: This place is incredible in terms of the scale of what was built and existed so long ago. The walk around the ruins and outer moats is lovely. We were there early afternon so it was hot but not crowded. Once you get to the main rock the steps and climb get quite step which was fine for us but neds god shoes. To climb the spiral staircase and the final step staircase on the front of the rock requires a god head for heights. If that is not for you there is a nice flat open shady area at the base to watch the other climbers and monkeys. Definitely a must do in Sri Lanka once inside the paths are clear and signed so no ned to pay any extra for a guide

_source.title: A must!
_source.body: I was very sceptical about this place but it blew my mind!

_source.title: Self Exploration
_source.body: We used LocoMole a newly launched experiential ap by the Ministry of Tourism to explore Sigiriya by ourselves. The ap uses a combination of location-based technologies such as GPS AR Storyteling Sugested To-Dos and Gamified content to make exploration this amazing UNESCO World Heritage site both fun and engaging using one s own smartphone devices.

_source.title: Worth a visit
_source.body: Wel with a visit but get there early as it was so busy even at ۹am. We had to queue the whole way up with tok away from the experience slightly!

_source.title: Self-Guided Exploration
_source.body: We used LocoMole a newly launched experiential ap by the Ministry of Tourism to explore Sigiriya by ourselves. The ap uses a combination of location-based technologies such as GPS AR Storyteling Sugested To-Dos and Gamified content to make exploration this amazing UNESCO World Heritage site both fun and engaging using one s own smartphone devices.

_source.title: Why only ۲ Must be the price and the crowds.
_source.tagline: Why only ۲ Must be the price and the crowds.
_source.body: Once you get past the price and the crowds this is an amazing place. Even though it was never quite finished the skil and efort to control and manage water throughout the complex and the enable the plastering and painting over such large areas of exposed and often overhanding rock takes the breath away. On top of that no pun intended as you climb and when you reach to top the views are amazing. Your one chance to spend some time in relative peace is to aim to stay at the top until sunset when with luck the sun and cloud wil oblige you. Don t leave it to late to go to the top as there are cut of times for making the ascent around ۴.۳۰pm from memory but check when you are there. Alow time to explore the grounds visit the museum and explore the rock.

_source.title: Great view
_source.body: Something to do! Take a comfy shoes and a lot of water very windy on the top. Beter do it in the early morning when it s not to hot. From the top you can se the gren power of Sri Lanka.

_source.title: Wow
_source.body: This was an amazing visit. Loved the whole experience even though the there were alot of stairs involved!

_source.title: Impresive but expensive
_source.body: The whole area is realy impresive and at each corner you can find a big piece of history. The entrance fe ۴۵۰۰ rs on the other side semed to me prety high. The tuk tuk one way from Dambula costed ۱۰۰ rs. On the way back it was ۱۲۰۰ rs. The bus is much cheaper on the other goes much longer and with tuk tuk was posible to save in our case like ۵۰ minutes.

_source.title: Excelent. Start early
_source.body: Completely agre with everyone who says start early. I did to try and beat the heat but now realise you must to be there before the crowds.

_source.title: Amazing views and a piece of history
_source.tagline: Amazing views and a piece of history
_source.body: The price may sem a bit step but this UNESCO world heritage site is worth the efort as a major piece of Sri Lankan history. As others have said definitely go early- not just because of the heat but to avoid It geting to crowded. Even by the time we were coming down at ۱۰.۳۰ the crowds were building.

_source.title: Not nearly as chalenging as I thought!
_source.tagline: Not nearly as chalenging as I thought!
_source.body: Lots of steps - yes but realy it was over before we had begun.

_source.title: Chalenging climb but satisfying to conquer it!
_source.tagline: Chalenging climb but satisfying to conquer it!
_source.body: Step climb that requires moderate fitnes but wel worth the efort as view from top is god and the history is very interesting. Make sure to take plenty of sun protection and water. Some of the steps are scary for those afraid of heights or sufer from vertigo (particularly those which go to the frescoes but you can avoid those if you want to). Expensive entry price for foreigners because UNESCO location.

_source.title: Unique experience
_source.body: It s a shame that they make tourists pay an expensive fe while it s fre for local citizens and on the day there was a whole scholful of children visiting so the queue was so enormous we didn t make it to the top due to lack of time. Apart form this it s highly recomended to visit this Heritage Site.

_source.title: Average at best
_source.body: This would be a nice place to visit. Story is nice and historic and some amazing ancient structures. To many people for my liking though and it ruined the whole experience. Also ۳۰USD is a joke. There s one entrance for Sri Lankan s one for tourists. Also signposting very bad. We could not find the "exit" car park to find our driver. This neds to improve if you want to kep atracting people. I wil tel anyone not to bother with this. Not worth the time efort or money.

_source.title: Average at best
_source.body: I love history and its kind of a col story how the King fortified it and ruled from it from ۴۰۰AD but the crowds were insane. Literaly queuing the whole way up with horible people trying to push in and squeze their way through. Most people had no respect for personal space and would literaly squash you into a rock if it meant they could get in front of you. Ruined my whole experience. It was ok at the top but nothing breathtaking. Also if you ve ben to Rome or sen any of the ancient roman ruins this wil be below par for you. If you re gona go make sure you go as early as posible so the ignorant people don t ruin it for you.

_source.title: Go early morning
_source.body: Don t enjoy a long morning in your bed and go early! This wil make a huge diference. Couldn t imagine it would be so crowded! We were almost alone when we got up to the top. At the moment we started our descent I couldn t believe the stairs were al fuly packed with people waiting one behind the other to go up. The view is worth the efort. But the stairs can turn of a lot of people. No hight fear alowed.! It could be a chalenge when you se thru the stairs at this hight.

_source.title: amazing historic site we have every sen
_source.tagline: amazing historic site we have every sen
_source.body: no words to say. it is fantastic and realy interesting site its a must to se if you are in sri lanka have many water ways and kings palace was awesome

_source.title: You can climb it or.
_source.body: . you can take the softer option and tuk-tuk around the rock. We chose the soft option and it was god fun. The driver tok us to several great vantage points for photos. If your driver asks if you want to take the long detour to se the lake definitely do it. It is not a great road but you have great views acros to both Sigiriya and Pidurangala.

_source.title: Hard work but worth it
_source.body: Didn t think we could do it but we did. We arived early to beat the heat and crowds and it wasn t to bad. You can take your time so there s no rush. The views are amazing and beautiful. It isn t easy and the heat makes it worse so go early. There are spots along the way to rest and take pictures but otherwise it s single file in some areas. Bring water.it s esential! Wel worth doing!

_source.title: Arived around ۹am
_source.body: Despite being warned about big crowds and ariving at "peak hour" it realy wasn t that bad. When you get to the top there is a rewarding coling breze!

_source.title: An efort in the heat but worth it.
_source.tagline: An efort in the heat but worth it.
_source.body: We climbed the rock at opening to beat the crowds and heat.

_source.title: Amazing
_source.body: One of my best memory ever i wil remember it for tge rest of my life.amazing place it was a real advanter to reach the top with my wife and smal daughter.realy it worth and you must vist it if you head to sri lanka

_source.title: one of the best places we visited in srilanka
_source.tagline: one of the best places we visited in srilanka
_source.body: Quite a climb to the top but our young ۳-year-old daughter managed to make it to al but the last few steps before neding to be caried as she was so excited about al the interesting things on the way It probably not for those afraid of heights as the walkway is step and narow in parts. If you are physicaly chalenged it may be worth paying one of the guides to pul you up or cary your child note that they are very expensive and most of there tour is just writen on the self guide signs on the way up. Take plenty of water as it can be quite hot. I would not mis this site if you are in the area.

_source.title: Worth the climb.
_source.body: Wel worth the climb to imerse oneself in the heritage of Sri Lank was very busy the day we visited so it was a slow climb. The history is very interesting and the view is exceptional. Noticed that al levels of fitnes were undertaking the climb.

_source.title: Go first thing in the morning!
_source.tagline: Go first thing in the morning!
_source.body: We were there at ۷am and it wasnt to busy at al. Realy breathtaking views of beautiful scenery! Highly recomend!

_source.title: A sight not to be mised
_source.tagline: A sight not to be mised
_source.body: We went to Sigiriya on the first day of arival. And was there in the early morning when it was not as crowded. It is about ۱۲۰۰ steps and not for the faint heart. Some of the steps were step and slipery. It is a tick of the bucket list. God experience and great pics op.

_source.title: What an Amazing Place.
_source.body: If you lok at this place and try to imagine how dificult it would have ben to build hundreds of year ago. It is absolutely astounding. The view from the top is outstanding.

_source.title: Amazing place to visit
_source.body: Very interesting especialy with a guide. Interesting history. Great views. Rare falcon sited. Not for the unfit!

_source.title: Top of the world and with the world on a poya Sunday visit!
_source.tagline: Top of the world and with the world on a poya Sunday visit!
_source.body: Although we didn t know it our visit coincided with both a Sunday and a Poya day which meant that the site was absolutely packed and the climb to the top was via a continuous caterpilar of people!

_source.title: Absolute waste.
_source.body: Our family experience was terible to put nicely. The staf and security were highly discriminitive forcing foreigners to pay a higher price than locals to climb a rock unsafely without any toilet facilities or first aid.

_source.title: Fabulous Climbing Experience
_source.body: Top tip: Get a great guide to tel you the stories and show you the way up and the best way down! Ask at your hotel and they wil organise for a guide before you get there and your guide wil met you. We had Neil - I m sure he had a much nicer Sri Lankan name than that though!

_source.title: A must visit place!
_source.body: Beautiful beautiful sceneries!

_source.title: The view it amazing
_source.body: This rock is located in northern Matale district near Dambula town.Don t enjoy a long morning in your bed and go early! The view it amazing the crowds going up as we were going back down were huge.

_source.title: Stuning
_source.body: This is a must do item in Sri Lanka. The climb is not continuous but it is dificult and single file. The top is spread out so you can get away from people a bit and get some beautiful photos. Our hotel hired a guide for us which was helpful. Wear sneakers and nothing that could cause you to trip. If your location alows you to try and arive when they open for les crowds and waiting in line up the laders. We arived about ۹ and it was prety crowded but when we left around ۱۲ it was quiet so perhaps mid-day is god to. Please oh please do not bring children who canot climb it on their own or disabled people. It s truly not safe.

_source.title: overpacked
_source.body: try to go as early as posible to avoid crowds. walking the stairs up to be awarded with a view is worth it. Do get a local guide for cheap money for beter understanding of the history of Sigirya

_source.title: Beat the crowds.
_source.body: Try to be there on a wekday @ ۷am sharp and enjoy this amazing place in peace! Easier climb than neighbouring Pidurangala Rock؛ but mind-blowing how they managed to build al of this on top fo this mountain!

_source.title: A must se
_source.body: You ned to be fit and agile to get to the top. We got about half way but thought it was worthwhile. Lots of monkeys on the way.

_source.title: One of the best things I have sen anywhere!
_source.tagline: One of the best things I have sen anywhere!
_source.body: Simply a must - yes it s a lot of steps but make sure you start as close to ۷am as you can to beat the heat and crowds then you can stop and rest as many times as you ned on the way up and down. Al up we spent about ۸۰mins in total from botom to top and down again including at least ۲۵-۳۰mins at the top enjoying the view and diferent parts of the ruins. By no means were we racing. We tok our time as neded. Most parts the stairs are an easy to med climb.

_source.title: Definitely Worth Doing!
_source.body: We went as part of our tour of Sri Lanka and to be honest I felt it was a "must do" on the trip. We went fairly early in the morning and even then it was very crowded although having sen photos on Trip Advisor I realise it wasn t actualy to bad. Due to the number of people we were forced to climb at a fairly slow steady pace (luckily!) and it was only the heat that made it fel rather strenuous. There are plenty of places to stop and take a break if you do fel tired along the way. The final stage of the climb might be tricky if you fear heights but it is literaly climbing a metal stair-case with a hand-rail which means there is no ned to lok down if you would rather not. We sat for quite a while up the top under a shaded tre taking in the view. The trek down was lovely - we saw very few people and couldn t believe how quickly we made it down. Take plenty of water to drink along the way!

_source.title: Mr
_source.body: Great place to visit and se history of rich Sri Lankan culture. Must visit the museum before climbing the rock.

_source.title: One of the many highlights of Sri Lanka
_source.tagline: One of the many highlights of Sri Lanka
_source.body: For those of you who like me aren t to fond of heights fear not.it s not as scary as it loks. It s wel worth the efort to get to the top great views. It s a fairly long walk up but there are plenty of places to stop for a break again I didn t find the walk as tiring as I had feared. Try to go early we got there about ۹.۳۰ but it was already quite crowded. Guides are available but you don t realy ned one.

_source.title: Realy god
_source.body: A lot of history here in a spectacular location one of my favourite tourist sites in Sri Lanka. Visit the museum and gardens before you climb Sigiriya Rock for background information and artist impresions of how the palace and asociated buildings and landscaping might have apeared. The climb is step but not to hard as you re going up stairs at the pace of the slowest person in the crowd. Everyone is friendly and patient and you re there before you know it. There was a nice breze up on top so very pleasant exploring. It s suny and exposed you l ned to hold onto your hat.

_source.title: Worth the Climb but Don t Rush
_source.tagline: Worth the Climb but Don t Rush
_source.body: It is a step climb and of course it is likely to be hot. There are points where you can stop to rest but just take your time and water. Go early or later in the afternon when it is coler and there are likely to be fewer visitors. Take a guide to explain the history of the site. The fortres at the top is large and the views are panoramic. Hold onto your hat as it is refreshingly brezy at the top. It tok us just under two hours up and down.

_source.title: Entertaining hike and a must do
_source.tagline: Entertaining hike and a must do
_source.body: We cycled ۲۰km on back roads to get to the area yet the kids stil had no trouble to get up and down the ~۱۰۰ steps to get to the top. It was a hot day but manageable in smal portions. Young kids are likely to require carying to come prepared and bring al your snacks and drinks as once you are on the climb there is nothing. It s a wel worth hike with spectacular scenery with amazing views al around. The guides went into far to much detail for our family but they were pleasant and helped us al the way. I can se this hike being chalenging for the elderly but there are rest stops al the way up. We didn t realy find it a chalenge to make it up even carying a ۲yr old. We had god weather to do the hike which made the day.

_source.title: It s not just Climbing
_source.body: Some people says it s the ۸th wonder of the world.

_source.title: The views!
_source.body: Top tip: after you ve got your ticket from the museum (foreigners only) and you enter the citadel depending on the time of day you go you l hit a huge slow moving queue leading up the stairs. Take a right turn just as the stairs begin to ascend. You l come acros one alternative set of steps that the guides (slyly) have blocked of to bost their trade of queue jumping short cuts. But if you folow the path around further to the right you wil se another set of steps leading up that cuts out the vast majority of the queue. Lok out for wealthier travelers folowing a guide up this route and you l know you re on the right track. Take plenty of water as it gets hot. It l be worth it. The views are spectacular enjoy!

_source.title: Climb at your own risk
_source.body: The handrail and steps had shown some corosion and the place ned more signs to guide you to point of interest and how to exit some direction to guide tourist to explore wil be very helpful so you don t waste to much time and efort walking around and about.

_source.title: Amazing place but make sure to mis the crowds
_source.tagline: Amazing place but make sure to mis the crowds
_source.body: A UNESCO World Heritage site but our visit was spoilt by the large crowds on a wekend. To be fair we should have arived earlier posibly before ۹AM. Trust your Touareg guide and make sure you don t end up in the very long queue to se the frescoes. Als۹ be aware that this is a very expensive place to visit - ۳۰.

_source.title: Amazing View
_source.body: would recomend for everybody to talk the walk up and se the sights it is amazing there are a lot of people there but they get scatered around a big place so it should not bother you that much

_source.title: Just beautiful!
_source.body: This monument is beautiful. The view from the top of the Lion Rock is amazing. The climbing of steps is a litle bit tough for young childrens

_source.title: Worth it
_source.body: We decided to climb this instead of Pidurangala rock as we were told that this had beter views of Sigiriya and has stairs al the way to the top (aparently geting to the top of Pidurangala is like an obstacle course).

_source.title: Definitely worth doing!
_source.body: I was realy unsure about going due to the entrance cost being US ۳۰ but I read some reviews and went anyway and I have to say that it was such a great experience. I did get a guide which cost ۲۰ as it had ben recomended to do this from a Sri Lankan friend to understand the site in depth. I have to say he definitely also helped out with keping the monkeys and dogs away! The flight of stairs to the paintings are definitely not for the faint hearted but it al aded to the experience. The climb to the top of the mountain entering at the lion s fet was so interesting. It was very windy so wear something that wil not blow up with a gust of wind! Also I went around ۱۱am and it wasn t to to busy for those who are not able to make the early morning slot!

_source.title: Beautiful but busy!
_source.body: We arived at around ۹.۳۰am and the queues were already in place. Due to the volume of people we had to take it slow (neded anyway as a bit of a climb). The views are beautiful and I m glad we did it however the price is absurd (۳۰) and the crowds are a bit much. It would definitely be beter earlier or slightly of season-we have to travel during schol holidays which means places are always busier

_source.title: Persevere for the views at the end
_source.tagline: Persevere for the views at the end
_source.body: Amazing views from the top so even if you re lazy and unfit like myself the climb is definitely worth it. The downside was the unending mas of people moving at a constant steady pace but we went at about ۳pm - posibly the busiest time! If heights aren t your thing you might want to give this a mis. My boyfriend had to bow out when we got to the metal spiral staircase. Also the fear of awakening the swarms of bes and being atacked (as per the warning signs) wil kep you alert enough to save any boredom mid-climb.

_source.title: Wow a must-do while in Sri Lanka!
_source.tagline: Wow a must-do while in Sri Lanka!
_source.body: I am horibly afraid of heights and climbing a ۶۰۰ft rock was not at the top of my list for this holiday! However it was amazing and takes about ۱ hour to make the climb via some fantastic ancient rock art and it is certainly worth the climb to discover the ruins of the most amazing palace. I am stil afraid of heights but sometimes you just have to seize these oportunities.

_source.title: God climb great views but pricey
_source.tagline: God climb great views but pricey
_source.body: We expected this climb to be strenuous but were pleasantly surprised with how easy we found it. We also saw lots of monkeys which was a lovely treat.

_source.tagline: Disapointing and anoying people bypasing queue for ۲۰ USD

I don t particularly like heights and was a bit woried about it but I never felt uncomfortable. a must if you visit Sri Lanka!

_source.body: Exciting climb to the top. Nowhere near as hard as it loks. Amazing view along the way and at the top. The most fascinating thing is to consider how they managed to create what they did at the top of this rock al those years ago. A must-visit place. Definitely advisable to arive early though.

_source.title: A must se atraction in Sri Lanka
_source.tagline: A must se atraction in Sri Lanka
_source.body: One of the highlights of our trip to Sri Lanka. Amazing scenery and history. The climb is quiet step in parts but you can go at your own pace. The views are superb. The cave paintings are incredible. Be wary of the monkeys and be ready for the salesmen at the botom but at least atempt to climb as far as you body wil let you!

_source.title: Must se!
_source.body: This is a must-se! Was definitely one of the highlights of our trip! We went up at in the late afternon and saw the sunset. Simply amazing.

_source.title: A great excursion
_source.body: Nedles to say that this was a terific excursion the reason why people flock to Sigiriya. Highly recomend to start early in the morning at the time of opening (۷am) to avoid the crowd the afternon heat. Takes about ~۲ hours (+/- ۱۵ mins depending on your sped). While up on the rock spend god time to enjoy the view.

_source.title: A must se experience when going to Sri Lanka.
_source.tagline: A must se experience when going to Sri Lanka.
_source.body: Wonderful experience. We were at sigirya lions rock at ۷ am. That was a god decision as there are many stairs to climb. It is however worth every step you take. A breathtaking view when you reach the top and the ruins from the acient castle was wel preserved.

The heat does not help. So go in the morning or after ۴pm before the ticket counters close. We went at ۲pm and regret it. If you want to enjoy the grandeur of Sigiriya avoid the wrath of the sun.

_source.title: Worth traveling
_source.body: You have to walk a lot but ned to go and visit. Around ۱۰۰ steps. Tickets are a litle high Take sports shoes.

_source.title: Amazing!
_source.body: An Amazing climb up to the top of Sigiriya.

_source.body: This is a very historical site located in Central area of Sri Lanka and a true wonder of the world. _source.tagline: Not in this HOT and humid weather
_source.body: the weather was hot and humid when I visited sometimes in November and it s was a long walk from the entrance to the based of the stairs and such long climb.

_source.title: It was just amazing

We went here in the evening and we encountered such a beautiful sunset from the top. Which also resulted in delayed return to the base in the darknes.

_source.title: One for the list

_source.title: Pay the Fe and Go Se It

_source.title: Worth doing
_source.body: It gets very hot so you ned to have a very early start to get up the hundreds of steps to the top before it gets to hot.

_source.title: Was great
_source.body: Have ben there the place is great.recomend it as a must se atractions. Take a tour for ۲ hours and enjoy the ancients

_source.title: You must visit Sigiriya when come to Sri Lanka.
_source.tagline: You must visit Sigiriya when come to Sri Lanka.
_source.body: It is an ancient kingdom of Sri Lanka. King Kashapa ruled the country from his palace on Sigiriya. This is a UNESCO named world heritage center.

_source.body: climbing up there was a bit hard for me but when you get up there you can se the best view ever. i recomend that you get there befor sunrise.

_source.title: Go and conquer it.
_source.body: Sigiriya ROck is a UNESCO world heritage site. One lok at it and you can fel the jiters about how to climb it. But then don t think twice and go for it. Because if you mis the climb you wil surely regret it and some of the other time. My guide was quite god halfway I felt like giving up he pushed me to climb further. Divide the rock into ۴ stages in your head this wil make the climb easier. If you fear heights then would not sugest going for it. But the view from the top is worth the efort.

_source.title: The Locals are neglected

_source.title: Amazing historical site

_source.title: Worth the climb!
_source.body: It was SO hot but totaly worth the climb! We saw so much wildlife many caves rock formations and of course the frescoes. There is quite a bit to se at the top which I wasn t expecting. So many god memories 😁

_source.title: A fantastic atraction!
_source.body: This was wel worth the efort as the views from the top of Sigiriya Rock are incredible!

_source.title: Unesco site
_source.body: Wel worth the efort to walk the stairs. Wel designed and made acesible to many aged travelers. You ned to be prepared for walking the equivalent of a ۷۰ story building. Many oportunities to rest and recover. Bring water.

_source.body: I visited with a tutktuk aranged by the guest house in Dambula (about ۲۰km away). It tok me to the rock waited for me and also tok me to several other places of interest in the vicinity for briefer stops. Paid ۲ ۰۰ rupes for about ۶ hours of tuktuk time.

_source.title: Wow!
_source.body: Absolutely amazing. Sure it s hard work geting up there but is al worth it. The view is amazing but what blows your mind is how it was actualy created al those years ago. It makes you wonder how everything was built. The enginering and building was way before it s time.

_source.title: Exciting!
_source.body: ۴۶۵۰ rupi is to much Climb is nice and makes you think how it was Milenia ago Heard stories about ۲ hour waiting to go up and ۱ hour to even get the ticket. Recomended

_source.title: Incredible experience
_source.body: I was at the begining of April at this beautiful stone fortres a rock wich has on his top the remains of one of the early midle age capitals of the Sri Lankan state. To go on the top is an exhausting but nice experience in which you have to climb a lot of stairs. On the first level on the vertical wal you wil find the famous maiden frescoes from the harem of the e emperor. You wil climb again helicoidal stairs and you wil arive on the fet of the lion! There you can rest a bit and after the last asault to the top of the Rock to the ruins of the ancient capital Sigiriya. It s a breathles image!

_source.title: Go Early
_source.body: We visited at ۷am when the park opens. Already very hot when we got to the top. Not for those with a fear of heights or not fit enough for the climb. The usual ۲۱st century ned for instagramable shots by thoughtles iritating visitors at the top is sadly the norm - but the views and history are very interesting. Take water.

_source.title: Stuning historical site panoramic views
_source.body: The ۲۰۰ m rock loms in a beautiful seting of what must have ben exquisite gardens and palace complexes. There are aparently ۱۵۰۰ stairs to climb with diferent intervals to stop catch your breath and admire the scenery. This is a must visit site in Sri Lanka. The entry fes are a litle step for foreigners moderate for nationals from SARC countries. Ensure that you cary your pasport if you are not a Sri Lankan. Best time to visit would be betwen ۸-۱۰ am or from ۱۵:۳۰ hours onwards. The sun and heat would be very high during the day. Ensure botled water hydration and god hats/umbrelas walking/hiking shoes and lose comfortable wear preferably with long trouser/leg covering. The site is the ruins of a fabled palace complex built by King Kashyap in the ۵th/۶th Century

_source.title: Incredible!
_source.body: I loved this experience. The views from the top made the walk up worthwhile. If you make the trek up you won t be disapointed.

_source.title: Lets go climbing
