_source.body: Fantastic architecture gardens and the fortres rock with ۱۲۰۰ steps to the top i unfortunately had to decline the ascent but it loked fantastic the other went and it was great it was very crowded as it was a Sunday but stil a great experience not to be mised

_source.title: Awesome!
_source.body: The Lion Rock - Citadel of Sigiriya has a realy special shape which dominates the skyline once you re in the centre of Matale. It s nearly ۲۰۰ meters high ۱۲۰۲ to be exact steps to get up to the top with the view you wil never forget. The name of Lion Rock comes from the giant lion claws that function as an entry gate about halfway up the rock.

_source.title: Astounding
_source.body: An unbelievable place saturated in history and beautiful. I was realy woried about the climb as I don t do heights but it goes up in levels so although it s a bit of a kicker for your ticker (a chance to work of the Lion ber) it doesn t sem to hard at al. You l be surprised at how high you get without realising it. The final climb after the lions entrance is the one I woried about. Have to be honest it did make me nervous going up but coming down was surprisingly easier (I thought down would be the problem for me). Once you re at the top it s very big so you don t wory about the height but just enjoy the panoramic stuning amazing views. Don t mis the chance to experience this beautiful world heritage site. Tip: take water and wear trainers the guides were skiping up in flip flops like gazeles but you wil want to fel a god grip. The wild monkeys are a bonus!

_source.title: The great Rock
_source.body: The most powerful fortres i have ever sen in my life. This fortres have a very powerful security system. The water gardens are most fascinating atraction of this trip

_source.title: Amazing
_source.body: If you go to one place in Sri Lanka as an atraction - go here for sure. It is a litle climb. Mainly stairs. There are people who ofer to help you - if you ned some suport - an elderly person on our tour acepted the help. As always negotiate the deal first. God walkers won t ned any help. The walk itself is never boring. First you have the awesome gardens and pols. Then the stairs leading up to the ancient paintings then you tackle the sumit - to an amazing gren outlok of ancient structures and a ۳۶۰ degre view. They even have an ancient pol on the rock. We did it on a wet day with moderate clouds - but was stil amazing. Definetly a highlight of the trip!

_source.title: So much history!
_source.body: Wel worth taking the efort and walking to the top. The fact that a palace was built on and into the rock is just incredible.

_source.title: .fabulous hike.
_source.body: I m very pleased we went on this trip.the route the history and the view at the top made it al very interesting.Take some water with you.

_source.title: Sigiriya yes but don t mis out on Pidurulanga
_source.tagline: Sigiriya yes but don t mis out on Pidurulanga
_source.body: Base was Habarana for both Sigiriya and Polonaruwa and Sigirya was about ۲۰mins drive. We got a great tip from another traveler to climb both Sigirya and Pidurulanga and so glad we did so. We started at ۱۰:۳۰am sure there a god few tourist but not to busy at al.

_source.title: Te vel touristen
_source.body: The view is great but its realy touristic. To many people walking the route and some are very rude (and dangerous) to get to the top before you. We climbed Pidurangala rock the day after and that was way beter. From that rock you can have a great view on Sigiriya rock. I recomend Pidurangala if you only want to do one.

_source.title: Sigiriya rock fortres
_source.body: Visited Sigiriya with friends an ancient city built on a rock that towers ۲۰۰meters. Sigiriya is most famous for the period begining in the ۵th century when it was transformed into a palace fortres and pleasure garden by king Kashyapa also known as lion Rock the name of the monument indicates the way in which visitors used to begin their final ascent to the top through the jaws throat of a lion as we started climbing up we came acros many rock shelters there were some breathtaking frescos and a miror wal with fine inscriptions it tok us around ۴۵ minutes to reach the top it was a very suny day with temperatures around ۳۲degres Celsius which was a litle tiring but the breathtaking views and col breze kept us going the descent was a lot

_source.title: Amazing Climb
_source.body: Significant history of Sri Lankan kingdom behind this place. One of the Capitals in ancient times during King Kashyapa s dynasty. Entry fes for SARC countries is les than other tourists. Worth Walk/climb.

_source.title: Amazing
_source.body: The lions rock site is a must se. The weather was cloudy with some ocasional rain so it was not crowded. Be careful and wear god shoes or sandals because the stairs might be slipery but the site is amazing so are the views over the landscape

_source.title: Very interesting place to visit!
_source.body: This area is extremely picturesque with beautiful tres grenery around. The main atraction is the rock paintings the ancient city on the huge rock. It is quite a climb and not posible for a lot of senior citizens. However there an excelent museum on the fot hils which gives a complete idea of the structures on the rock as wel as the beautiful murals painted on the rock.an exact replica is in the museum. On the surounding fields there elephant rides aranged for guests.

_source.title: It s ok but only ۴ stars
_source.tagline: It s ok but only ۴ stars
_source.body: Once upon a time there was a huge castle and building up on the rock. If it was stil there - wel that would be a sight!

_source.title: It s ok but only ۴ stars
_source.tagline: It s ok but only ۴ stars
_source.body: Once upon a time there was a huge castle and building up on the rock. If it was stil there - wel that would be a sight!

_source.title: Amazing
_source.body: We started our visit at ۷ in the morning before the croud was there. Unfortanely the weather was rainy and there was fog. But stil the Climb was worth it. The miror wal and fresco were realy beautiful. At the top it was incredible! Beautiful view!

_source.title: Wel worth the walk
_source.body: Beautiful place to work of breakfast and climb high to enjoy the views as wel as the history and heritage of Sri Lanka.

_source.title: Amazing view and landscape at the top
_source.tagline: Amazing view and landscape at the top
_source.body: Chalenging hike up al the steps and stairs.take your time.but once on the top it s totaly worth it. The view of the surounding is wondering and the landscape is fascinating. There s a lot of history to this place.enjoy.it s worth the hike.

_source.title: wonderful architectural site
_source.body: there is so much to se in the grounds around the rock which most people ignore which has so much amazing things and architectural wonders

_source.title: To touristic
_source.body: We fortunately went early morning as our guide was aware of the crowds we are going to met on our way back. Not sure why ladies climb the thing with their high hels on or why elderly people chose peak hours and put themselves under a risk however it realy influences the overal impresion. Next time we would chose a mountain right next to this one which is aparently not known and we would enjoy it beter.

_source.title: Astonishing
_source.body: It s a must se if you are in Sri Lanka. There are some recomendations to folow if you want to enjoy it:

_source.title: A tremendously gorgeous monument!
_source.body: Another must visit monument and historical location surounded by nature at its best the Lion Rock is impresive and gargantuan and expensive. The entry fe is US ۳۰ and worth every peny if you climb to the top or explore the base for a few hours. Hopefuly most of that money goes to the upkep and the salaries of the many people involved in keping this mountain safe and gorgeous. The view from the top is stuning and the history of Lion Rock is colorful and variable depending on research and time.

_source.title: View is worth the climb and monkey dodging!
_source.tagline: View is worth the climb and monkey dodging!
_source.body: Fantastic views. Go very early. ۷ -۷.۳۰ if you can to avoid lots of other visitors. This wil make your pictures beter but also make for a more comfortable climb on the couple of slightly hairy parts. Takes about ۲ hour round trip. Be careful not to cary fod as monkeys can be agresive and always a risk of rabies. A must do and the ruins at the top and view are incredible.

_source.title: Stuning.
_source.body: This is such an incredible place to visit when you are in Sri Lanka. It s not for people who may strugle with heights or even those who are les mobile. The best time go is early morning before the morning sun realy starts to become fierce. make sure you get a guide and they can realy ensure you se al the best things. have water with you and pace yourself climbing the steps are there are over ۱۵۰۰ of them. But when you are at the top it s worth everything. Simply stuning!

_source.title: A proud SriLankan legacy
_source.body: This was one of the best trips I ever had.It showed the ancient heritage of Sri Lanka. A must visit for everyone.

_source.title: What a view!
_source.body: Amazing natural and historic site! We visited the site in the late morning so it was very hot but stil definitely worth it. Wear comfortable shoes and be ready to walk. It is a quite easy walk with a lot of steps but no ned to climb. Honestly one of the most impresive historical sites I ve sen. There are many writen explanation along the path that explain very wel the diferent parts.

_source.title: Shame for Sri Lanka
_source.body: I have met so many nice amd friendly people in Sri Lanka. but at main atraction I fel as a human second clas.

_source.title: Have to se. Stuning historical place.
_source.tagline: Have to se. Stuning historical place.
_source.body: Amazing place. Very very big area. By walk or by bycycle. Take our schoes and hat some places. Don t go with short skirt. Or cowr with long scarf.

_source.title: Simply stuning and amazing view!
_source.body: Visited Sigiriya s Lion Rock as part of my visit to Sri Lanka in August. My experience can be sumarized below:

_source.title: Historic site with increbile views
_source.body: The walk wil come to life if you arange a guide to explain al of the features of Sigiriya otherwise known as Lion Rock. Our driver aranged a great guide (multilingual) who brought the ancient kingdom to life. Don t just listen to an electronic version of the history. The guides know this place and know lots of anecdotes PLUS you get to understand how important this area is to the island the political intrigues and way of life from centuries ago. Guides and helpers people who suport tourists with the climb is an important part of the fabric of the site.

_source.title: History
_source.body: We visited here quite early ۹am or so in order to mis the big crowds and the miday heat. Despite this there were quite significant numbers of people. I am scared of heights but this was a big chalenge for me as for most of the climb there are wals or obstructions that block your view down! We had our own guide but there were some men along the way trying to give us advice etc but they were not very pushy and left when we said we were not interested. The views from the top are spectacular and not to be mised. If you do not have a guide the information you get from guide boks would sufice and so a guide is not necesary.

_source.title: Exceded expectations!
_source.body: After loking at pictures for months before ariving in Sri Lanka it exceded our very excited expectations!we absolutely loved it! You ned to arive early ۷ am is the best time. Beautiful! I am slightly scared of heights but managed just fine. The walk is super easy and you can take your time with lots of places for pit stops. This is a must do!

_source.title: Over priced.
_source.body: I m sure if I had gone earlier and not sufered from the enormous trail of people climbing with me I may have tempered my view somewhat of it being expensive. It costs ۳۰ To enter the site it is undoubtedly a stuning site in its sher grandeur and seting but the price is quite surprisingly stif. I would not return for that reason and from speaking with several locals it is clear that these monies are siphoned of by politicians and do not get put back into preserving the beautiful site. When you return back to the car park the tranquil gren besides the car park is cordoned of to ensure that the visitors are coraled past the souvenir stals and do not venture onto the gren area with seats.tacky and unwaranted

_source.title: " Don t pay people to get to know about the area "
_source.tagline: " Don t pay people to get to know about the area "
_source.body: Beautiful place Advice: Don t pay people who don t know even about the area they teling lies and geting payed by especialy foreign travelers.

_source.title: " Don t pay any person to know about this site "
_source.tagline: " Don t pay any person to know about this site "
_source.body: I recomend this place for photographers it was a great view up there But as a local traveler I was shame about the people who bothering foreign travelers. Two guys were saying trash in our language and making themselves fun and they were trying to touch hands by force of an old foreign woman. I saw the same guy who doesn t even know about the area was teling some lies and made some money from foreigners. (if you re a foreign person don t give money for lies)

_source.title: world heritage site
_source.body: this is famous for ancient frescoes. This was a kingdom of King Kashyapa (he has hiden here). Lovely site

_source.title: What a rock! 🦁
_source.body: On aproach to the rock you are treated to the most incredible views. I could have stod there al day and loked at it! I wasn t sure if I would be able to climb the rock as it is fairly tough especialy in the hot weather. However after some grit and determination we made it to the top! However I am stil convinced the best view was from the botom so don t be disapointed if you fel unable to climb to the top. There was one major anoyance though and that was some people trying to help you climb to the top. Then I m asuming they would expect a payment. I didn t find them helpful though in fact they were more of a hinderance. I didn t se anyone gratefuly acepting their services.

_source.title: UNESCO World Heritage Site - must be sen
_source.tagline: UNESCO World Heritage Site - must be sen
_source.body: The climb to the top was quite slow and hard work for me - being one of the older generation. You have to take your time but with lots of rests on the climb you can do it - do not rush no-one minds they hapily sped pas you while you take a rest! Take water with you You l ned it! There are some step steps and quite a climb at the top section. The cave paintings (Frescoes) are marvelous to se. The view from the top is fantastic - sugest you go early before it gets to hot. Even if you can only make part way up - go for it the whole history and culture found here is not to be mised.

_source.title: Cash and energy required but worth it
_source.tagline: Cash and energy required but worth it
_source.body: Pricier than the average tourist stuf in Sri Lanka but it s a world heritage site so we wil asume the money is going to keping it nice! ۳۰ usd to get in per person for tourists I think locals get a speck rate for that you can aces the museum and the site itself. Guides are extra and I didn t get one but I did go to th museum and find out some information in advance. The climb is step some of it original stone steps some of it iron staircase not for those scared of heights I would say don t even try it. It tok about ۳۵-۴۰mins to go up and about ۲۰ to get down this was stoping to take photos and have a breathe at certain points. There are los at the botom entrance and exit car park like al Sri Lanka los though bring your own lo rol ladies! and also sensible shoes not flip flops. Worth the climb to the top a beautiful site and amazing views.

_source.title: Prety place alot of mistreated dogs!
_source.tagline: Prety place alot of mistreated dogs!
_source.body: The place it self is beautiful. The view from the top is awesome. Ok price to get in. There wil be guids waiting for you that wil say you ned a guide. They dont say any price - when you get to the top of the rock they say you must pay (!).

_source.title: Lion rock 🦁
_source.body: I had to come here! Many reasons but none more important than my nickname of Lion!

_source.title: Worth the climb
_source.body: It s quite a climb to go up but we managed even with our kids of ۵ and ۹ years to reach the top in les than ۱ hour. Beautiful views and was fun to relax and watch the other touristes taking pictures. Going down again the first part was a bit scary for the kids. Stairs are step. Worth the visit.

_source.title: Incredible!
_source.body: Go early before it gets to hot as this is quite a climb. Lovely grounds at the base with lots of monkeys and birds. Some very interesting rock formations and great views as you climb. I stoped half-way up by the lions paws as did not fancy climbing the metal staircase on the sher face to the top! Purely because I sufer from vertigo at times like this! My husband did and it loked amazing on the photos.

_source.title: Wel maintained
_source.body: lotsd of steps to get to the top of the rock so a physicaly fit person should atempt the climb. If not climbing then one can take a auto/tuk tuk around the place.

_source.title: Climbing the rock
_source.body: My Son and friends climbed the rock and got some amazing pic from the top they al enjoyed a hearty climb while I relaxed ground level be sure to take your time as there is plenty to se and yes there is the locals seling bits and bobs but we al have to earn money chat with them they have very interesting story if you our wiling to listen to them about the local area. it was a very wel spent morning and fun had by al the party.

_source.title: Tough climb but worth it when you get the ۳۶۰ view
_source.tagline: Tough climb but worth it when you get the ۳۶۰ view
_source.body: The climb up the Sigiriya Rock is quite tough for few people. There are locals along the way who wil help you climb up but be prepared to pay them once you re done.

_source.title: Realy interesting place to visit
_source.body: Try to avoid wekend and public holiday otherwise place is very crowded with local. Prepare face towel as you l get very sweaty. We were lucky because it was a cloudy day and got back just in time before rain.

_source.title: Amazing site and a chalenge to climb
_source.tagline: Amazing site and a chalenge to climb
_source.body: Amazing place and history behind it as important place in Sro Lanka history. Climb is dificult for those with any problems and takes a lot of efort. Views as you go up and at top fantastic.

_source.title: A must do! The highlight of our wek in Sri Lanka!
_source.tagline: A must do! The highlight of our wek in Sri Lanka!
_source.body: The site is amazing and the nature that surounds it is breath-taking! Go very early at the opening of the site to avoid the crowds and the heat. Leave the museum for the end of your visit. We went with ۲ kids aged ۹ and ۱۱ and they had no problem climbing al the way up just bring enough water. Beware of the hornets. Large noisy crowds get to iritate them and certain tourists simply ignore the instructions and warning posted everywhere creating a hasard for al present so if you can avoid such groups it wil be best. Yes there are a lot of stairs and yes it takes some efort to climb but none of us is particularly fit we don t exercise and we stil did it in les than an hour in each direction. While the metal stairs towards the end of the climb might be an isue for those with vertigo we actualy found the lower stone ones a bit more dificult as they are a bit high but overal everything is manageable.

_source.title: Spectacular view
_source.body: This is a must visit travel spot in Sri Lanka. It tok me about ۲ hours to walk up to the top of the rock. Slowly walking up and at the same time enjoying the spectacular view. I was there to have sunsets view.

_source.title: Amazing place with such rich history
_source.tagline: Amazing place with such rich history
_source.body: I went there early morning started from the hotel at ۶:۳۰ which I realy recomend. It can get hot in the area after there are about ۱۳۰۰ steps to the top.

_source.title: ۸th wonder.!
_source.body: Must se place for anyone who visits srilanka. This is a historical site and unbelievable enginering done way way back by King kashyap. Foreigners are charged LKR ۴۶۲۰/- and locals wil be charged at Lkr ۵۰/-. We went around ۴.۳۰ pm which was the best time to go to get rid of the heat. Further if you are lucky you can enjoy the sunset. God to take a water botle with you. Don t fed monkeys. If you are not physicaly fit beter not to take a chance. The site is beyond imagination and quite unbelievable.

_source.title: Amazing views
_source.body: We arived about ۷.۳۰ am and there were already lots of people there! It is definitely worth geting there early as it is coler and les crowds. We came down about ۹am and it was very hot and very crowded.

_source.title: Amazing experience
_source.body: I was initialy scared to do it but with the persuasion of my husband and kids i did ۱۰۰ step ithas a total of ۱۲۰۰ steps. We started at ۹ am. Best time in the morning to start the climb. I climbed slowly. It tok us two hours to and back. Entrance fe is ۳۰ for indians its ۱۵ USD. Bring water as you can only buy at the exit. Toilets are clean near the ticket counter. Views are stuning. There is a lion paw at the top beyond which the climb is step. I avoided this part due to my fitnes level. There are paintings miror wal gardens architecture built by the king. You can buy a guide bargain the cost we did not use one. It is one of the world heritage UNESCO site.

_source.title: Magnificent Location However pls be in Time
_source.tagline: Magnificent Location However pls be in Time
_source.body: Sigiriya is again one of the stuning and magnificent location of Sri Lanka. You can read reviews on most of the website however I am posting this review for some sugestions.

_source.title: Expensive but col
_source.body: Unfortunately we chose the wrong day to do this because it was public holiday. It was realy crowded so tok us a while to get to the top but you make it to the top and back down again in ۲ hours. Beware of the monkeys i would not bring fod with you as they wil most likely try and steal it from you and can get prety agresive. View at the top is spectacular. I wouldn t recomend this if afraid of heights.You should definitely bring a hat and you might want to bring some water depending on how fast you think you l be and how hot it is. we went there around ۱۰:۰۰ but probably best to go earlier. Couple people ofering to guide you but its not worth it. Also I would not wear flip flops or anything like that as they wil probably fal of. Definitely check if its a public holiday or anything like that before going! The entry fe is expensive but it is worth it view at the very top is great.

_source.title: A hard climb with beautiful views and wasps!
_source.tagline: A hard climb with beautiful views and wasps!
_source.body: Described localy as the eighth wonder of the world and recognised as a UNESCO world heritage site it certainly is a very imposing granite rock which has had a royal palace and a monastery on top. Your entry fe gives you aces to the ful Sigiriya complex but be warned entry fe is pricey.

_source.title: Backpacking Asia
_source.body: A must se even at the ۳۰ US entry fe. I tok a public bus from the bus station in Kandy. Tok thre hours to reach the stop at Sigiriya from where I walked about ۲ k s to the ticket both. Tuk tuk are available for those who prefer not to walk. I was fortunate it wasn t to hot with plenty of cloud cover but a few times there was no cloud and the heat was intense. Not to hard a climb. Can be done easily in les than one hour. Truly amazing.

_source.title: A must place to visit
_source.body: A must place to visit if you are in Sigiriya. Pidurangala also god but very dificult to climb. Can be proud as a sri lankan when visit this rock.

_source.title: Great for the adventurous minded not for the fainthearted
_source.tagline: Great for the adventurous minded not for the fainthearted
_source.body: A step climb to the top prety exhausting and not for the faint hearted. If you are afraid of heights then best to avoid this atraction.

_source.title: Realy stuning but take an umbrela!
_source.tagline: Realy stuning but take an umbrela!
_source.body: A wonderful experience. Amazing views. Fascinating history. But don t get caught in a tropical cloud burst!

_source.title: Simply Stuning. A true experience.
_source.body: Visited the rock during a grand tour of Sri Lanka and this is an absolute must on any tour. It is a simply wondrous place. Pictures and words do not do justice to the experience.

_source.title: Quite an experience. So glad we did it.
_source.tagline: Quite an experience. So glad we did it.
_source.body: Made it to the top and down in ۲ hours. The cost is prety step for foreigners. Watch out for guides who swetly ask you for help.

_source.title: Expensive entrance fe stuning view decent climb
_source.tagline: Expensive entrance fe stuning view decent climb
_source.body: Started the ۱۲۰۰ steps at ۷ am which is the best time in the morning to start the climb. If you start later or in the afternon it gets to hot. Entrance fe is ۳۰ which is a lot of money if you re backpacking on a budget. It takes about ۱ hour to get to the top and ۱ hour back. Don t forget to bring water as you can only buy cold drinks at the exit. Views at the top were stuning but don t forget you wil be exposed to the ful efect of the sun as there s no shade at the top.

_source.title: Honeymon
_source.body: One of our visits on our honeymon guide tok us around he tok us up to the base pay the moat and left us to met him at the South car park later it is some climb to the top with concrete steps at first then a spiral staircase up to the miror wal after this beware of moneys and wasps and mosquitos there are signs warning of this we then saw the next steps up to the final level I didn t dare it was to busy And loked realy dangerous so pased on that bit my wife went up and said it was amazing a highlight of Sri Lanka.

_source.title: You must se this
_source.body: Start early in the morning to climb the stairs to the top. Kep calm and bring water for about ۴۰ min - ۱ hour climbing. Fantastic views.

_source.title: Incredible Place
_source.body: We were amazing at how gorgeous this place was. When we got to the top we ended up being the only two people there which was mindblowing for a place this stuning. When you are in Sri Lanka you must make a trip here. It does not disapoint.

_source.title: Beautiful place!
_source.body: The sher amazement of a swiming pol atop the Sigirya Rock! The rock paintings are very special. Just wish the weather was beter though!

_source.title: Beware of the Monkeys
_source.body: We arived in the early evening - about ۴.۴۵ and entrance closes at ۵ so were decided to wait until the next day. There were not many people about and a few stray dogs and some monkeys. Near the ticket ofice is a cafeteria seling ice creams and cold drinks. We bought an ice cream and while my husband was chating to the lady inside I went out to put my wraper in the bin. ۳ Monkeys came towards me. The largest got up on its hind legs when it got to about ۳ fet from me it bared its teth and growled. As it started to come towards me I threw the ice cream to the side it stil came on for a second and then realised I had thrown the ice cream away and ran picked it up and caried it into a tre. It hapened very fast and was very frightening. If I hadn t ben as quick to throw the ice cream away I m certain that monkey would have biten me. In the end I ended up doing just what you are not suposed to do - feding the monkeys- but I had to think quickly and I hadn t go a choice. Be careful especialy with children around the moneys. In the morning when we went back to climb the rock there were no monkeys about and loads of people. But I stil had my ice cream inside the cafeteria! Don t forget to visit the museum to - it is very interesting with a terible gift shop!

_source.title: Moderate Climb Stuning views
_source.body: The view from the top are outstanding. The rock isn t as high as I first thought and if you are a fit and active person you wil fly up. Would definitely recomend going as early as posible ariving there at ۷ would be the ideal time as any later and you wil have to que for the stairs to get to the top. The temperature in the early morning is just right.

_source.title: Stuning Rock - A Must Do
_source.body: Arived around ۹am with a guide. Lots of people but did not fel crowded. The grounds before the actual climb are magnificent and the history is fascinating. The entire climb around and up to the top is not to dificult. My husband has bad knes and managed most of the climb mising the last push to the top. There were people clearly nervous about heights and having to push themselves to the top but it is very achievable. Yes it was hot but only what we expected and manageable. This magnificent palace is carved out of granite and is truely something you wil not want to mis. A must do.

_source.title: This ۸th wonder of the world is a must visit!
_source.tagline: This ۸th wonder of the world is a must visit!
_source.body: Sigiriya is the home of Lion Rock a ۲۰۰ m high rock and the site of a ۵th-century palace and kingdom. Formed out of the magma of an extinct volcano King Kasyapa chose the rock as a site for his palace and inded his own kingdom. The ancient rock palace has some very unique frescoes that are incredibly wel-preserved considering they are more than ۱ ۵۰۰ years old and at the plateau you wil find the beautiful gardens of Sigiriya which are among the oldest landscaped gardens in the world.

_source.title: Stuning place with great views
_source.body: There are no words for this place. Only sugestion is to lok at what the palace loked like before so when there you can use your imagination.

_source.title: What an efort climbing but wel worth it
_source.tagline: What an efort climbing but wel worth it
_source.body: Just as wel we left at ۷am in the morning the steps were fairly step so not for the faint hearted. Wel worth being at the top but exhausting geting there.

_source.title: Briliant Experience
_source.body: This was a great experience and definitely worth doing. The views were spectacular and the history of Sigiriya is so interesting.

_source.title: Morning Climb
_source.body: We arived at the museum at ۰۷:۰۰ as it opened to purchase tickets. We then went straight to the complex and started the climb to the sumit. It was incredible but I am scared of heights and it realy pushed me. Everything was wel cordinated and stafed. After exploring the sumit we came back down and explored the rest of the ruins then went to the museum which was very informative.

_source.title: Great Hike!
_source.body: We managed to do the hike and it tok us about ۴۵ minutes to reach the top. Lots of Tourist come here to visit the Sigiriya. There is a fe that neds to be paid at the entrance. We didn t take the tour guides but just folowed the trail on the map provided. If you are a person that is afraid of height dont go there.

_source.title: Sri Lanka s must se sight
_source.tagline: Sri Lanka s must se sight
_source.body: The ancient city of Sigiriya was top of my list for things to do in Sri Lanka and maybe because of the expectation I was perhaps a litle disapointed by the hoardes of people visting even first thing in the morning. That said its stil a five star and a must se in Sri Lanka and despite the step entrance fe.

_source.title: Amazing place
_source.body: This is a beautiful place. If you want to go to the top of this old fortres you have to climb over ۱۰۰ stepts.It s not that hard but it is very hot outside so try and go early in the moring of at evening to se the sunset. And also there are a lot of monkeys up there.

_source.title: Nice:) Go early in the morning and pay the entrance fe in USD
_source.tagline: Nice:) Go early in the morning and pay the entrance fe in USD
_source.body: We visited early in the morning to avoid the heat.

_source.title: Nice litle climb
_source.body: Nice litle climb worth the view from the top! At the time we visited it wasn t to crowdy. You can buy some king coconuts along the way.

_source.title: The tiping trap
_source.body: We visited on a hot humid morning and along with our alocated guide were son joined by another guide who ofered to help my wife up the stairs. This was apreciated at the time as my wife was strugling with a painful kne. The experience is wel worth the efort the information provided by our guide was valuable in apreciating the site. Once at the top we thanked the second guide ofered him a ۵۰۰ rupe tip. He said this was not aceptable and demanded a ۲۰۰ rupe tip. After returning to the botom I ofered our second guide a ۲۰۰ rupe tip but he said ۳۰۰ was his price. We never paid this much in tips any where else during our ۲ weks in Sri Lanka found the guides at the Ancient Rock to be gredy rude. Be sure to negotiate the tip before your tour starts.

_source.title: Beautiful views of the Sun Rising over Ela
_source.tagline: Beautiful views of the Sun Rising over Ela
_source.body: Great hike through a tea estate and an easy climb to the top. Local people are very helpful and wil provide directions to get there.

_source.title: ۳۰ dolar for a view
_source.body: Yes the view is great there s a lion paw and some brick wals on the top. You ned to try hard to imagine what those buildings could be once. Why is the miror wal is caled miror It is just a yelow painted wal. Overal it does not worth usd ۳۰. Go to next hil Pidurangala for lkr ۵۰۰. It s just to expensive for what you get.

_source.title: Get up early and GO!
_source.body: Not to hard on the knes and a lovely early morning activity! The sunset is amazing and the views wil blow your mind! Unfortunately it is an Instagram Tourist hotspot as wel and you l ned to be patient with the glamorous posers.

_source.title: Excelent ples
_source.body: Excelent plea wonderful UNESCO died and god view I m recomend sigrya rok god people waking buteful images

_source.title: Get hiking
_source.body: Its kind of best hiking place n flying rawana was so god. There are best view on the top like ۳ mountains conect together.

_source.title: Wonderful
_source.body: The best ancient experience how a king has lived inside a Huge Masive Rock with al the Srilankan Paintings inside Realy enjoyed visiting the World Unesco Heritage Site in Srilanka

_source.title: The climb was hard work but worthwhile
_source.tagline: The climb was hard work but worthwhile
_source.body: We climbed Lion Rock in the early morning (۷ am) which was a god idea as the heat can be very taxing. I am ۷۵ and have had coronary artery stents ۱۲ months ago. The trail up was reasonably step with many steps but many rest areas posible. When we reached the staging area for the laders (the Lion s paw) I was surprised that we were so close to the sumit. The laders are step but safe. However if you are scared of heights do not do the final section as there is a shear drop that loks startling. Great views from the top and fascinating ruins.

_source.title: A great easy hike!
_source.body: We spent an hour here one afternon - it s an easy hike with lovely views of the countryside and some cafes nearby for a break. There is also zip lining if you want an adrenaline rush!

_source.title: Quick climb for fantastic views
_source.body: Beautiful views and only around ۲۰ mins walk from Ela town. Definitely recomend! Also if you have any spare fod/water there are some cute pupies at the top who were very grateful to have their water bowl filed up in the heat

_source.title: Great Kingdom!
_source.body: Amazing history paintings architecture techniques and view. Great place for every travelers who are able to climb. Other can wait down.

_source.title: Lovely walk
_source.body: As a lot of tour company s sem to have canceled their tours there weren t many people at Sigiriya when we climbed in the afternon maybe ۲۰ people. Make sure you have time to explore the grounds after you climb by folowing the signs that go to the car park. We found that more interesting than the actual climb. It s a beautiful area. When we came down there weren t any tuk tuks around (perhaps a sign of les tourists) so we walked to our nearby hotel (beware of snakes and elephants if you have to do the same).

_source.title: Easy hike with nice view
_source.body: There s ۳ viewpoints here at Litle Adam s Peak. This is a relative easy hike with mostly steps going up to the first viewpoint. The second viewpoint neds to go down and up again on dirt path and hence not advisable to do it if it s wet. A nice view up here and definitely worth the hike while in Ela. No entrance fe here.

_source.title: Hard work but thoroughly rewarding
_source.body: Being ۶۵ with arthritic knes I found going down to be more dificult that going up. It was ۳۲ degres with high humidity so that aded to the degre of dificulty. However if you take your time and kep your fluids up it is certainly achievable. There are some grand views going up and the view from the top is magnificent. If it is physicaly posible for you to do the climb then do it.

_source.title: Amazing views and very peaceful
_source.body: Hard work walking up but the views make it al worthwhile. It s a must to do if you are in the area. There is also a ZipLine experience you have to pay for though. Not sure if you d be able to se and apreciate the views as much as walking at the top.

_source.title: Please take fod for dogs
_source.body: There are some very hungry dogs on the way up - in particular one young black and white pupy who was eating dirt because he was so hungry. There is nowhere else for them to get fod or water from up there. We fed the dogs biscuits as that was al we had. If you take up some fod and water for the dogs that would make a real diference.

_source.title: Wonderful way to start the day
_source.tagline: Wonderful way to start the day
_source.body: Beautiful walk to a great vantage point for awesome views of the Ela countryside best in the morning when coler.

_source.title: it is completely view point
_source.body: we visited the mini adam s peak we had a very god walk out very much photogenic excelent view point and very interesting to do hiking amazing natural views morning tim is very god to do walk out very fresh and fel awsom!

_source.title: Loved this hike.
_source.body: Gets your heart pumping but it s short so most people can probably manage. Views are beautiful. There is a litle extension hike to another peak once you get to the top that is way way way harder than it loks from that angle so beware but I m glad I did it. Also a fun litle zipline around there to

_source.title: Lion Rock amazing!
_source.body: We did it ۱۲۰۲ steps to the top in the heat we were so proud but it was wel worth it.

_source.title: Stuning views
_source.body: We went up during a storm with cloud al around. On the peak we were stod in the cloud with nothing to se. Then it cleared and revealed stuning ۳۶۰ degre views of the surounding hils mountains roads and towns.

_source.title: Great views
_source.body: This is one of the "easier" walks in Sri Lanka if you are loking for a magnificent view. I m not overly fit but made it comfortably. The views are worth the smal climb.

_source.title: Amazing views
_source.body: We arived about ۷.۳۰ am and there were already lots of people there! It is definitely worth geting there early as it is coler and les crowds. We came down about ۹am and it was very hot and very crowded.

_source.title: Nice short hike with a god view
_source.tagline: Nice short hike with a god view
_source.body: We went through ۹۸ acres resort to get here and stoped for lunch afterwards. It only takes about ۴۵ mins to an hour from Ela town to get to the top.

_source.title: Stuning Rock - A Must Do
_source.body: Arived around ۹am with a guide. Lots of people but did not fel crowded. The grounds before the actual climb are magnificent and the history is fascinating. The entire climb around and up to the top is not to dificult. My husband has bad knes and managed most of the climb mising the last push to the top. There were people clearly nervous about heights and having to push themselves to the top but it is very achievable. Yes it was hot but only what we expected and manageable. This magnificent palace is carved out of granite and is truely something you wil not want to mis. A must do.

_source.title: Easy climb
_source.body: A god walk to do just before breakfast and before it gets to hot. You can also climb the peak in the late afternon to se the sunset but we found the cloud and rains tended to come in around ۳.۰۰pm which would have limited the view on the top.

_source.title: This ۸th wonder of the world is a must visit!
_source.tagline: This ۸th wonder of the world is a must visit!

_source.title: Another Kodak Moment breathtaking in many ways
_source.tagline: Another Kodak Moment breathtaking in many ways
_source.body: Close to ۲.۵klm from the centre of town this is must do when in Ela the walk to the top in most is quite easy having smoked ۳۴ years and after giving up ۱۱ years ago I found that I had to rest a few times on the way up but the efort is rewarded with the most stuning views. Take water and wear comfortable fotwear best to avoid the heat of the miday sun.

_source.title: Nice walk close to Ela town
_source.tagline: Nice walk close to Ela town
_source.body: Nice walk not to hard (maybe ۲۰mins to get up the steper stairs at the end) and great panoramic views from the top. I loved this walk but mainly because of how quiet and peaceful it was at the top. I think this is because we did it around lunchtime when it started raining so everyone else left to sek shelter! I would recomend folowing the litle trqck away from the main peak down to al five knuckles this track is a lot harder however fels a lot more adventurous and gets you away from the crowd

_source.title: Stuning place with great views
_source.body: There are no words for this place. Only sugestion is to lok at what the palace loked like before so when there you can use your imagination.

_source.title: Nice viewpoint
_source.body: An easy ۴۵-minute walk up to the viewpoint best done in the morning. Lovely vistas and panorama from the top.

_source.title: Tour
_source.body: It was god the best time to visit Sigiriya is as early as ۶.۳۰ am when the sun is not hot before the big local crowds come in or in the evening around ۳.۰۰ pm when the sin is going down.

_source.title: Magical Place
_source.body: Magical place. A very beautiful view from the hil. I recomend going Up. One of many obligatory places on Ceylon.

_source.title: So glad we did it!
_source.body: Everybody tried to put us of climbing to the top. Al the advice was that we should do it only in the early morning and when it wasn t so crowded. Nedles to say we didn t have any choice as we were there at miday on a public holiday. It was hot crowded and dificult (I found the first bit up the stone steps much harder than the bit after the Lions Paws where at least there was a handrail) but it was worth al the efort. Magnificent views! Just don t believe that the local people are going to be polite and queue quietly. They push and shove you al the way and cut you up when they get the chance. They even tread on you to get in front. But there s never any rancour and they do it with a smile - and they don t sem to mind if you push and shove right back. In fact be wary of anyone who extends a helping hand. They want money!

_source.title: Must se!
_source.body: Must go of Sigiriya! Very hot and very crowdy you should go early in a morning Dont forget to bring your water to the top Stay away from the cheky monkies:-)

_source.title: An incredible Place
_source.body: Lots of beautiful nature. Climbing up is not easy but I think it is posible to reach the top of every person. The most important thing is not to rush. We are not fast just a litle bit rested. The most important thing is to have water. Beautiful panoramic views can be sen from the top. From the top of the hil we landed down quickly as it was easy to get down.

_source.title: Sigiriya rock
_source.body: It s not just a climb up the rock but has an interesting history behind it. The climb it self was exhausting but with the short stops it helped us gain some breath. Once you reach the top you totaly forget the climb the views are just incredible. Would recomend this to everyone with a healthy heart.

_source.title: Incredible
_source.body: I arived relatively early around ۸:۳۰am and purchased a ticket there. There weren t any queues realy which was great. I did this on my own with no guide and realy enjoyed it. I do think a guide may have given me a bit more knowledge of the place though. It was busy and the climb was hot! The views are absolutely out of this world. I would highly recomend this experience if you are in srilanka.

_source.title: Fabulous views
_source.body: Worth geting up early to do this climb both for the heat and for the number of people pasing on the staircase going up the side of the rock. I d prepared myself for a much longer climb but reached the top quicker than i thought. We had a guide who told us some interesting information but it s not necesary. The views in al directions are spectacular. We left our hotel at ۶am and were back having breakfast by ۹.۳۰. Lots of savy monkeys around so hang on to your valuables!

_source.title: Tough but worthwhile
_source.body: It is a beautiful site initialy aproaching the rock through the ponds. You can imagine what it was like when the empire was at its heights. Once you reach the base of the rock its then a easy walk up the the wal of mirors. Once you reach the Lion s Paw there is a plateau where you get some fantastic views and a god rest stop - then its a vertical stair climb up to the top of the rock. This was the toughest part mainly due to the heat and crowds (it was mid morning) Once you reach the top of the rock you are rewarded with a beautiful view of the surounding area - wel worth the climb up!

_source.title: Stuning views from the top
_source.body: Amazing experience worth the climb. So much history in this area. Enjoyed the museum tour before to explain the site and its history and significance for Sri Lanka.

_source.title: Its beautiful but for Foreigners its costly
_source.tagline: Its beautiful but for Foreigners its costly
_source.body: In title itself I mentioned both sides of the place.

_source.title: Not to be mised
_source.body: Just do it. Get over the height and climb to se one of the great sights. Either the build was genius or foly but either way amazing

_source.title: God visit. Step climb.
_source.body: I have recently visited sigiriya rock. It was impresive with lots of things to se (gardens caves etc) however I fel the toughnes of the climb gets played down slightly. The steps realy are tough especialy the last section. I am great with heights and even I was starting to get a bit wobly towards the top. When you get to the top the views are worth it. We set of early and got there about ۸.۱۵ by the time we got to the top it was ۳۵ degres and only ۹.۳۰ in the morning. I would sugest going as early as posible to avoid the heat and crowds. The crowds were fine at the time we went. One final thing. At the lion fet location if you decide not to proced to the top there is an open area with water to wait. This area semed quite busy (people

_source.title: One of top ۲ sights in Sri Lanka
_source.tagline: One of top ۲ sights in Sri Lanka
_source.body: The other being the Blue Whale we saw so this is a high bar! Physicaly beautiful and historicaly fascinating must-se. Recomend visiting very early in the morning - it is worth an early wake-up to get to the top with a handful of people and not have to snake up the step stairs with an endles crowd in the hot sun.

_source.title: Amazing fortres
_source.body: Our guide did tel us that to climb the rock in the morning is easier but it s busier as more tourists do the morning climb.

_source.title: Wonder of the World
_source.body: Its a must visit place in Sri Lanka. It is also UNESCO s world heritage site. Once you go there you should climb to the top as the views on the way is amazing seing al beautiful nature and amazing Sri Lanka. Please take water with you and also try to go in the morning.

_source.title: An iconing symbol
_source.body: The rock fortres Ancient City of Sigiriya is not only iconic because it is UNESCO heritage but also because of its beautiful history. If you get a chance do read about King Visthavasa and his empire. The frescos that adorn the wals and the architecture are stil considered a marvel.

_source.title: Tour Sigiriya
_source.body: One of the best in Sri Lanka. I invite pls to visit this place if not visited. And also make sure you go early in the morning so that sun wil not be an isue at al.

_source.title: A must do!
_source.body: We got up early to climb Lion Rock and we re very glad we did! Although we arived a litle late because of an elephant-in-the-road situation! A lovely aray of gardens and ponds flank the path that leads towards the start of the walk. There are quite a few stairs so I d probably recomend decent shoes - but it wasn t as hard as we were expecting. Doing it early meant that the majority of the path up the rock was in it s shade. Great views of the surounding area at the top but not much shade so you can t spend more than about ۳۰ mins there.

_source.title: Expensive but gorgeous panoramic view
_source.body: I was in Sri Lanka for ۱۵ days. I tok an early morning bus from Kandy bus station to Dam bula. I then tok another public bus from Dam bula main bus station to Sigiriya. The bus fare is only ۴۰ rupes. The bus conductor was kind enough to alert me when the bus arived at the town nearest to the Sigiriya Lion Rock. From this town it was about ۱۵ mins walk away from the entrance of the atraction.

_source.title: Expensive but worth it
_source.body: Comparatively it s an expensive excursion (۳۰/p) but it was realy col to se and learn more about the history. The hike up is quite tough and we did it in the midle of the day (which I do not recomend!). Best to go for early morning or later on for sunset (unsure of how late you can go up). The views from the top are amazing and the ruins are interesting to walk around.

_source.title: One of the best places we visited in Sri Lanka
_source.tagline: One of the best places we visited in Sri Lanka
_source.body: An impresive rock on which there used to be the king s palace built in the ۵th century. Now there are only foundations of these buildings left. Metal walkways are step and narow which might be a chalenge for somebody. It s definitely worth to climb on the top of the rock as the view is amazing although in a hot day it s not an easy walk.

_source.title: Greatest wonder of Sri Lanka and the ۸th wonder of the world
_source.tagline: Greatest wonder of Sri Lanka and the ۸th wonder of the world
_source.body: Al About Sri Lanka travel crew has hosted more than ۱۰۰+ hapy travelers in the past ۱۵+ years and Sigiriya is one of the best atractions for every traveler. This is a true marvel of ancient Sri Lanka and it resembles the rich culture and history that goes back to thousands of years.

_source.title: Thriling climb to ancient ruins and views!
_source.tagline: Thriling climb to ancient ruins and views!
_source.body: The best advice I can give is to get up early and be at the ticket ofice when it opens at ۶.۳۰am

_source.title: Climb It and Go Early
_source.body: We are not great explorers! However you canot go to Sigiriya without giving the rock climb a go. As we discovered luckily you don t have to go al the way up but at least get yourself up to the rock paintings and lions fet. Yes it s al quite step geting down is harder) but take your time and go early (۶:۳۰am) to beat the crowds and heat - we were back at our acomodation nearby by about ۸:۳۰. At least you can say you did it!

_source.title: Enjoyed the walk up Sigiriya Lion Rock
_source.tagline: Enjoyed the walk up Sigiriya Lion Rock
_source.body: This is the highlight of our Sigiriya visit. Our chaufeur guide started us early at ۶۳۰ am. When we arived at the ticket ofice there was already a short queue. Each foreign adult ticket cost LKR۵ ۳۱۰/- or USD۳۰/-. We skiped the museum and headed straight for the walk up the rock. Our chaufeur guide could not walk up with us as only licensed guide for the Sigiriya is alowed to conduct guided tour there but he showed us the way. It was quite easy to folow the path as many people were walking the same way. You can engage a licensed guide inside the Sigiriya we were aproached by one but didn t ask much about how much it costs etc. The climb was quite step at some points but the steps and railings helped a lot. It was god that we started early so the weather was not to hot and the pace was faster as there was no human jam. The views along the walk up down and on top of the rock were spectacular. There were ۳ rounds of ticket checking - first at the entrance towards the walk up second at the mid way and third just before walking up the spiral staircase to view the paintings on the wal. We enjoyed Sigiriya very much! We were back on ground at visitors car park at about ۸ am just the right time for breakfast!

_source.title: Worth the climb!
_source.body: Go early to avoid the heat and make sure to bring lots of water. The view from the top is amazing! The climb tok about ۴۵ minutes each way.

_source.title: Very comercial but great
_source.body: You must go early to this place and get your guide to have entry tickets before you get there (ticket ofice opens ۰۶.۴۵)

_source.title: Beautiful Rock! Must visit in Sri Lanka
_source.tagline: Beautiful Rock! Must visit in Sri Lanka
_source.body: Sigiriya rock is by far the best thing I ve sen in Sri Lanka. It has ben declared as the ۸th wonder of the world by UNESCO and has a rich history asociated with it.

_source.title: LOTS OF HISTORY AND MYTH
_source.body: A mix of Ramayana and Budhism. That would best describe this place. This is one of the places where Lord Budha actualy visited. This is a world heritage site. The climb is a must to the top and the view is breathtaking. almost every stone has a story and ensure that you have a god guide to apreciate the relevance to Ramayana. The place has some interesting sign boards (se photo atached). Don t let it deter you. It is worth the climb

_source.title: Big efort but worth it
_source.body: There are many steps to climb just to get to the Lions Paw the a step stairs to the top. A god level of fitnes is required to get to the top. A Hat sunscren and plenty of water is esential. The site at the top is surprisingly large. Care neds to be taken because of uneven ground and steps. A very interesting site for those able to get there. Views are wonderful. Watch out for unauthorised guides There are no facilities once in the site so be prepared.

_source.title: Enjoyable experience climbing the Lion Rock
_source.tagline: Enjoyable experience climbing the Lion Rock
_source.body: It s a must to do whilst in Sri Lanka. We stayed a stone throw away so saw it each day at breakfast. It was a chalenging hike to the top but worth the efort even though it was hot at the top. it s advisable to take a hat and wear sun scren. We had an amazing tour guide so he informed us of the history and information throughout which was helpful.

_source.title: So worth the efort.
_source.body: Go VERY early it opens at ۶ ۳۰ and you want to be one of he first up Les people and a more comfortable climb. A reasonable level of fitnes and a god head for heights esential in parts.

_source.title: Oh those kings had it god!
_source.tagline: Oh those kings had it god!
_source.body: A step climb up narow steps folowing a steady line of visitors of al ages and ability - so thankful for the metal hand railing. At the top a col breze the ruins of a ۵th-century palace and city and a panoramic view of the plateau below. Largely the ruins are just foundations there are a few standing wals. There are no services once you are inside the site so make sure you bring some drinking water؛ there isnt any shade and the sun was hot (February). If you are bothered by heights you might find the ascent chalenging. Monkeys lounge on the wals scaning for signs of fod if you bring any fod be careful؛ we saw a lady who was biten trying to hold onto her snack from a thieving monkey.

_source.title: Simple one
_source.body: For me in my opinion I don t think it was that great. There s nothing up there and the way to go was a single track which you have to stucked with a lot of people. I prefer Pidurangala Rock but if you visit Sigiriya go both rocks!

_source.title: Ancient city visit
_source.body: This is a fortres and ancient city which if you are there in Sigiriya do visit. Be prepared for a litle hike with lots of stairs to climb spiraling stairs step stairs tiny stairs etc. But it s worth the walk and a litle activity. Don t mis out the heritage site.

_source.title: Excelent Morning Visit
_source.body: We visited Sigiriya early morning - I think this was a wise choice by our guide due to the heat - Sigiriya is stuning and worth a visit but if you don t like heights / smal staircases on the side of a masive rock then this is not for you. The view from the top is amazing but geting there is hard work - we visited with children aged ۶ and ۱۰ and they loved the views but they had plenty of of questions of how / why / when etc and lucky for us the guide had the answers.

_source.title: Sigiriya Lion s Rock - Most Famous Atraction in Sri Lanka
_source.tagline: Sigiriya Lion s Rock - Most Famous Atraction in Sri Lanka
_source.body: Sigiriya Lion s Rock is one of the best and famous atraction in Sri Lanka. If you are young and fit you should do this activity. It was so fun to Climb There was so much to learn about history and technology used here. It was rainy day but it was not a big isue for us. It was fun we enjoyed the rain. It s worth climb to se beautiful view from top of the Sigiriya. AMAZING!

_source.title: Realy special!
_source.body: I truly enjoyed climbing Sigiriya Rock. Got there early and we were on our way at about ۶:۴۰ am. It s hot here in April so there was some serious sweating involved but it s not a huge hike realy. Bring some water. Also we had our guide / driver with us who always has al the important stories to explain a place - realy a great value ad considering there is just some ruble. I thought the entrance fe for a family of four in exces of USD ۱۰۰ quite step but I am glad we did it.

_source.title: Highlight of Sigiriya
_source.body: The earlier the beter to beat the heat and the crowd. The entrance fe is ۵۳۱۰ rupe for foreigners which is kind of pricy. It also includes Sigiriya museum that is in the same building of the ticket counter.

_source.title: A big climb
_source.body: A big respect to my wife she had fractured her ankle not long before we traveled but she made it to the top. What a climb! If you are contemplating going make sure you go early in the morning otherwise the crowds are enormous and take a botle of water. Bots are not neded but trainers wil sufice. Take your camera excelent views from the top. Wel worth a visit.

_source.title: Walking and climbing the rock
_source.body: My daughter and I visited the rock at ۶۳۰ in the morning. The weather is perfect for walking the rock at this time.

_source.title: Worth the efort
_source.body: My advice. do it in the morning before it gets to hot. There are steps to be climbed and it could be a chalenge. Having said that it is realy worth it just to be impresed with the human ingenuity that constructed such a temple. The view from the top is impresive. The frescoes that remain on the rock wals are stuning (note no photography alowed). The area is overal impresively maintained right down to the removal of the plastic wraping from your drink botle at the checkpoint. Your bags are also checked for any other plastic materials that could contaminate the site. A model other countries could folow. The stair case is quite safe though I can se it can become busy. The signs for hornets is advisory and definitely not an isue for us. Get there when the park opens to avoid the crowds. Certainly worth the climb.

_source.title: Prety. Prety to avoid
_source.body: We were very excited to visit. and more excited about the climb with my ۶ year old. but trust me the journey was nice but the destination was not even worth the walk.

_source.title: Awesome
_source.body: The ancient city was one of our favorite stops on our trip. The climb to the top of the rock is long but worth it. The view is incredible once you reach the top.

_source.title: Sigiriya- Lion Rock climb
_source.body: What an experience it is to climb the rock. Our driver advised us to do it later in the afternon to avoid the hotest part of the day but nevertheles it was stil nearly ۳۰ when we climbed around ۴pm. That said it was worth it! It wasn t as busy as some have said in previous reviews although there were many people we didn t have to wait in long queues going up or down. Just the ocasional pause to catch your breath and of you go again while others around you do the same.

_source.title: Amazing
_source.body: This area is fascinating. The museum gives a great insight into the achievements neded to creat a town on top of this rock thousands of years ago.

_source.title: Raw nature at its best
_source.body: Having spent ۲ weks traveling around Sri Lanka Ela and Sigiriya had their own charms. Sigirya has alot more wildlife to ofer. Many wil also argue that ۵۰۰ rupes to climb the Lion s Rock is to expensive؛ which it is. However if you are coming to Sigiriya then climbing the ۲ large rocks is something that just has to be done! There are many steps but it is more straightforward than Pidurangala rock - just be aware that their are monkeys nearer to the top who wil want to get into your backpacks!

_source.title: A god workout it worth it
_source.tagline: A god workout it worth it
_source.body: We climbed the rock and where not let down it s best to have a guide so they can show you things and explain the history. We left our hotel at ۶.۱۰am to get to the rock as early as posible! This was for two reasons to mis the majority of the other tourists and also to do it at the colest time I can highly recomend this as it a tough ascent and it gets hot an sweaty. The pain was wel worth the it the view was stuning

_source.title: Gorgeous Place!
_source.body: I highly recomend bringing the exact amount of money you ned to enter. The price is ۳۵/person and I dont recomend paying in their local curency as it fluctuates to much from day to day.

_source.title: Extraordinary
_source.body: It was wonderful So I m here at sri lanka together with my local boyfriend and he bring me to sigiriya and it s was so worth it. It was so amazing as you can se al the ancients scrible and rock formation. Nature is life

_source.title: Mainly a to do thing
_source.body: We climbed it yesterday: went OK.

_source.title: An esential and important site to visit in Sri Lanka
_source.tagline: An esential and important site to visit in Sri Lanka
_source.body: We left our Sigiriya hotel early to take advantage of the coler conditions we drove half an hour to Sigiriya Rock Fortres a UNESCO site that dates back to the ۵th Century when established as a king s palace and fortres. It was later used as a Budhist Monastery until the ۱۴th Century.

_source.title: Wel worth the efort
_source.body: We didn t quite make it for ۶.۳۰ as we d hoped but we had our tickets and were on our way before ۷ and it only got crowded when we were on our way down.

_source.title: One of Sri Lanka s esential visits
_source.tagline: One of Sri Lanka s esential visits
_source.body: Climbing the rock of Sigiriya is an esential part of a visit to Sri Lanka and posibly the most memorable. It can be crowded and hot but experiencing the climb together with the thousands of Sri Lankan people is not to be mised. Get there early and take plenty of water. A back pack is a god idea to leave hands fre as some of the climb is quite step and exposed although always robust and safe. There are a lot of steps but it is always crowded so the rate of climb is leisurely and does not fel strenuous for the older person. The climb itself is exciting and breathtaking but there is also the most stuning cave art after a short stretch up a spiral staircase and then the view from the top is marvelous.

_source.title: A must se. but strenuous
_source.body: This site is huge: much of it is easily acesible at low level - ancient water gardens fortifications etc. However the focus of the site is the Lion Rock and its fortres. Climbing this wil be a chalenge for many people. But if you think you are up to it give it a go. It is mostly steped so easy-enough for the able-bodied. The views (even on a misty day) are fabulous. On the sumit was a huge fortres evidence of which stil remains.

_source.title: A fabulous climb for the fitest
_source.tagline: A fabulous climb for the fitest
_source.body: This is a tremendous site. It is the foundations of an ancient town existing BC. The main atraction is a vertical climb up a rock face to se the foundations of an ancient palace on the top. The climb is just over ۱۰۰ steps so you ned to be fit and not sufer from vertigo. There are fabulous views and a stoping place two-thirds of the way up if you canot make it to the top. It is wise to arive early before ۹.۰۰am as it becomes very busy when coach trips arive.

_source.title: Perfect Place to visit. Awesome😍
_source.body: This place is ful of miracles and I Cant believe I climbed the ۱۲۰۰ plus steps! Such an amazing feling when you reach the top! its hard to think how it was built at that time. It is a vast area with loads of architectural structures including ponds Steps Dors and many more.

_source.title: A Must Se! (Arive Early)
_source.body: The Ancient City of Sigiriya was amazing to se! But. we should have arived earlier. When we got to the begining of the path up it was crazy! There were so many people pushing to get up the stairs. Mant travelers turned around and left to get out the madnes. Get there early for les crazy!

_source.title: Get there early ۶۳۰am
_source.body: I had a voucher so got the first ticket but then with my driver went to the museum which did not open til ۸am so when on teh climb. Some tips take water and rest on your way if you can. Im not fit so had to rest on the way and at the top. Wonderful site and later in day returned to se the museum.

_source.title: Guide for the unfit- just do it!
_source.tagline: Guide for the unfit- just do it!
_source.body: Incredible and absolutely worth the cost- as foreigners we should definitely pay more so I do not disagre with this.

_source.title: Great Site!
_source.body: Finaly - a UNESCO site worth the price of admision in Sri Lanka! Somehwat chalenging walk - do it in the morning as the rock provides shade for most of the climb. Walk through the wel-marked remains of royal gardens on way to the steps and stairs to the top. Once on top in the midst of a medieval fortres enjoy ۳۶۰ degre views. It s a lot easier coming down. Get a pick in front of the Lion s Fet to. Nice breze on top. Clean (relatively) bathroms on site.

_source.title: Such a joke!
_source.body: The only point is given to the beautiful view of the lion rock but the management of the site is absolutely TERIBLE!

_source.title: Not just the view
_source.body: My personal opinion is that Lion s rock is both easier and safer compared to Pidurangala. The view on top is amazing but it is primarily the vestiges of an ancient time that are strikingly magnificent.

_source.title: Amazing views safe but a hard climb
_source.tagline: Amazing views safe but a hard climb
_source.body: I climbed this rock with my two children ages ۸ and ۴. I was realy concerned about the safety. Oh wel the climb is not unsafe at al. Al the ۱۲۰۰ steps are wel made. Few are bricked and others are metal stairs. They re fenced as you go up. There are many places in betwen with shade where you can stop and rest. Its hot no doubt. Cary water and wear sunscren and hats. Its gets windy as you go up so no wories.

_source.title: Wonderful but go early
_source.body: Very impresive but go as early as posible as it is very exposed and hot. We got there at ۶.۳۰ when it opens and there were a reasonable number of people there even then. When we were on the top at ۸am it was very hot and obviously would be much warmer later in the day. There is litle shade on the top.

_source.title: Impresive rock with very god views
_source.tagline: Impresive rock with very god views
_source.body: My wife climbed the rock and as she is a ken rambler said the climb was not dificult at al. Lots of history of the area and wel maintained gardens

_source.title: Early bird catches the worm and avoids sun stroke
_source.tagline: Early bird catches the worm and avoids sun stroke
_source.body: One of the highlights of our tour of Sri Lanka. The rock is a ۲۶۰ metre climb most of which is via steps on the shaded west side of the rock.

_source.title: Sigiriya
_source.body: Climbing sigiriya was one of the best thing I have ever done.It was a chalenge.I did walk around the top very much and the view are breathtaking and wel worth wobly knes.It was a great sightsen in srilanka.

_source.title: Bring Water!
_source.body: Highlights: First the walk to the top includes a wal of gorgeous frescoes as wel as the incredible lion paw steps. These two stops along the hike make for welcome rest stops and are realy quite amazing! Second the view from the top is breathtaking and wel worth the climb. Third the monkeys were realy friendly and quite adorable. They kept my spirits high as I began to run out of energy towards the top!

_source.title: Nice Place Breathtaking View
_source.body: ۱۰۰+ steps to climb. It is best to visit early to avoid heat and crowds. View from top is fantastic.

_source.title: quite a place
_source.body: First of al be careful of large wasp who reside on the top of rock.! They atacked the people just after we left the place. few people were hospitalised I heard. Old king has built the place. It s realy worth to climb up and se the ancient paintings and the city ruins. but authorities should pay atention for preserve the paintings and also the city ruins. Place was overal OK except the site guides on the botom of rock and the entrance charge for tourist. site guides sometimes realy anoying for tourists. someone should do something

_source.title: Hot climb
_source.body: You want to start early as it gets hot and it gets busy. The rock does not lok chalenging from the base but it is hard work. Take it steady and al wil be wel.

_source.title: ۱۲۲۰ steps to climb up
_source.body: If you visited another ancient city in asian country I don t sugest this place but if you are not it is to be mised. So hot so crowded long way to go up but when you arive the best part is lion cave. Anything else except some ruined wals and roms that has not clear information about the time. Elephant rock cobra rock shoud not to be mised.

_source.title: Over rated and expensive
_source.body: You ned to climb ۱۲۰۰ steps (about ۲ hours) to get to the top No service or shaded areas Not much to se on top

_source.title: Not to be mised but go early
_source.tagline: Not to be mised but go early
_source.body: Get up early and get to the rock early before ۹am to avoid the heat crowds. The step steps and climb to the top are wel worth the views and experience. Take your time going up and lok back at the panoramic views!

_source.title: amazing place
_source.body: although it can get prety crowded and it is not a cheap place to visit stil I think that it is worth going there a lot of climbing to the top compensates the breathtaking view and the remains let you think how it must have loked like in the past in its glory days

_source.title: Amazing views!
_source.body: This is an amazing sight to visit. Sen for miles around.If you manage the fairly strenuous walk/climb to the top you wil not be disapointed. Its a must if your in this area but make sure you time it right. I climbed at ۴.۳۰pm just as it was geting coler and in time to witnes fantastic sunset.

_source.title: Very very nice
_source.body: Is a fortres high enought to se the neibourhods. Is a unique senzation that you are on the top of the word especialy because they don t have tal buildings.

_source.title: Not for the faint hearted
_source.body: With over ۱۰۰ steps to climb - of difering types and sizes - this is not for the faint hearted or unfit. You ned sturdy shoes and plenty of water. It is best to go very early in the day to avoid crowds and heat. It opens at ۷am. It is an amazing site with a lot of history and stuning views from the top.

_source.title: Completely breathtaking
_source.body: My favourite thing I ve done in Sri Lanka overal. Absolutely amazing! It s a long climb so bring water and comfy shoes you can wear shorts and t-shirt as there s no temples. I went for sunrise/ it opens at ۶:۳۰.its very quiet and you can climb the stairs at your own pace as it s quite daunting! Enjoy and take lots of photos!

_source.title: Crowds diminish the mystique
_source.body: This is certainly an impresive seting. So impresive that it sure brings in the crowds. Being declared a heritage site by UNESCO guarantes you wil be sluged a US۳۰ admision fe. You are warned by a smal notice at the ticket counter that if there is to much crowd congestion on site you may not be admited. In that case you wil not be refunded the ticket price! Similarly if aces to the site is terminated by a swarm of wasps from one of the many nests in the area you wil also receive no refund. Climbing the rock in the high heat is a bit of a chore but it is likely your climb wil be slowed by queues of tourists especialy at many of the pinchpoints on the stairway. It would be hard to pas up the oportunity to visit this site but there are a few anoyances asociated with it.

_source.title: World Heritage Site Adventure
_source.body: Located about ۲ hours from Trincomale Sri Lanka is the ancient vilage of Siririya. Overloking the vilage is the unique landscape Sigiriya Rock had a palace on top built in the ۵th century AD. The Rock is a ۲۰۰ meter out croping entered by walking through pathways and magnificent gardens pols teraces and the remnants of buildings. Mid-way up the Rock you arive at a sectioned of part just after the Miror Wal that includes ۱۹ female fresco figures which date from the ۵th century. The government has baned any photography of the figures in order to preserve their coloration. Aces to the Miror Wal paintings Lion s Paw and to the top of the rock is a chalenge. Many of the rock stairs are uneven and do not include handrails. You ned to be physicaly fit to make the climb to the top but if you are physicaly chalenged you can take a break part way up where there are about thre flat break areas and shade. Expect to take about ۹۰ minutes of climbing to arive at the top of the Rock from the base. The route up to the top is a combination of rock steps metal stairs and a few flat areas.

_source.title: Beautiful

_source.title: You might like it I thought it was a tourist trap
_source.tagline: You might like it I thought it was a tourist trap
_source.body: The entrance fe for foreigners is ۳۰ usd. I thought this was excesive given locals only pay ۵۰ rupes however it does include the museum. It is the same fe to just do the museum whether you climb the rock or not. It is by far the most expensive atraction in Sri Lanka. The climb wil chalenge many as it is ۱۰۰m up to the frescoes of which only ۱۹ remain in various states of repair higher stil to the sumit. You canot photograph the frescoes this was baned in ۲۰۱۵. Yes there are some god views from the top if there is no mist but you wil have many more photo oportunities as you travel around this beautiful country. _source.title: Amazing mountain top ruins
_source.body: This UNESCO World Heritage site was the location of King Kasapa I s palace from ۴۷۷ to ۹۵ AD. Tickets for foreigners (non-Sri Lankans) cost about ۳۰ USD but are wel worth the price. After a comfortable walk through gardens and stone walkways at the base of the rocky mountain there is a serious climb to the top with at least one detour along the way with Budhist wal paintings. The final part of the climb after the lion s fot is on step metal stairways. This is step although with hand guards and a fence to prevent fals. The whole climb is a god workout so this is not recomended for those who are in por physical condition. The top has ruins of the original palace (it is mind bogling to think how this was constructed in the ۵th century) and amazing views of the valey and surounding lakes. Highly recomended!

We didn t walk up the rock and this was beyond our abilities we did however speak to people who did and they were very impresed. We walked the gardens mainly loking at the bird life which was extensive. But al the area around the rock is excelent for wildlife watching particularly the birds buterflies and wildflowers.

_source.title: Interesting history great view

_source.title: Nice place

The climbing is not hard regular stops ۱ ۲۰۰ steps just a few large rocks at the top. Great at sunset (and not has hot as mid afternon) busiest ۱۱h۰۰ to ۳h۳۰. Use toilet before none after and bring pack sac with water. Could be windy at top. Watch out for your bags or anything you might leave unatended for a few seconds.the monkeys are very quick!

_source.body: This hugh rock has what sems to be vertical faces and near impenetrable.

Also I think ۳۰dolars is alot to charge concidering the experience. Posibly beter to go some other time during the year.

_source.title: Timing is everything

The climb back was a completely diferent mater. The hoards arived around ۸am and there was a queue to the top (heaven knows what the top was like!). If you have the chance go as early as posible and DO NOT go on a national holiday - we heard stories of hour plus queues at ۸am on the Bak Ful Mon Festival in February and I would imagine the experience would be ruined.

_source.title: Great views from the top
_source.body: This is a very long climb best to go early in the morning before the crowds.

_source.title: Climb early to avoid the heat queues

_source.body: Entrance fe is prety step for tourists but the grounds are lovely and there s plenty to se here.

_source.body: Very crowded even though we got there early - the steps are ok even though there are a lot of them to the top of the rock but the crowds make it quite tricky and if its raining I would give it a mis as the stone gets very slipy and the metals steps quite dangerous if you are ok on your fet give it a go if not dont risk it.
