Most people had no respect for personal space and would literaly squash you into a rock if it meant they could get in front of you. Ruined my whole experience. It was ok at the top but nothing breathtaking. Also if you ve ben to Rome or sen any of the ancient roman ruins this wil be below par for you. If you re gona go make sure you go as early as posible so the ignorant people don t ruin it for you.

_source.title: Go early morning
_source.body: Don t enjoy a long morning in your bed and go early! This wil make a huge diference. Couldn t imagine it would be so crowded! We were almost alone when we got up to the top. At the moment we started our descent I couldn t believe the stairs were al fuly packed with people waiting one behind the other to go up. The view is worth the efort. But the stairs can turn of a lot of people. No hight fear alowed.! It could be a chalenge when you se thru the stairs at this hight.

_source.title: amazing historic site we have every sen
_source.tagline: amazing historic site we have every sen
_source.body: no words to say. it is fantastic and realy interesting site its a must to se if you are in sri lanka have many water ways and kings palace was awesome

_source.title: You can climb it or.
_source.body: . you can take the softer option and tuk-tuk around the rock. We chose the soft option and it was god fun. The driver tok us to several great vantage points for photos. If your driver asks if you want to take the long detour to se the lake definitely do it. It is not a great road but you have great views acros to both Sigiriya and Pidurangala.

_source.title: Hard work but worth it
_source.body: Didn t think we could do it but we did. We arived early to beat the heat and crowds and it wasn t to bad. You can take your time so there s no rush. The views are amazing and beautiful. It isn t easy and the heat makes it worse so go early. There are spots along the way to rest and take pictures but otherwise it s single file in some areas. Bring water.it s esential! Wel worth doing!

_source.title: Arived around ۹am
_source.body: Despite being warned about big crowds and ariving at "peak hour" it realy wasn t that bad. When you get to the top there is a rewarding coling breze!

_source.title: An efort in the heat but worth it.
_source.tagline: An efort in the heat but worth it.
_source.body: We climbed the rock at opening to beat the crowds and heat.

_source.title: Amazing
_source.body: One of my best memory ever i wil remember it for tge rest of my life.amazing place it was a real advanter to reach the top with my wife and smal daughter.realy it worth and you must vist it if you head to sri lanka

_source.title: Worth the steps!
_source.body: Visited Sigiraya with ۲ friends today not realising it was a public holiday! Despite the crowds we had a briliant time and the views from the top are stuning.

_source.title: Lots of stairs but worth the hard work!
_source.tagline: Lots of stairs but worth the hard work!
_source.body: No visit to Sri Lanka with out a visit to Sigriya Rock. You se it on every turist bok and every post card and every poster in Colombo airport so of course you have to go and se it live. We started walking up at around ۸ am in the morning. There were lots of people but more coming on our way down. It is an amazing walk up al the stairs but only if you are use to walking and don t have problems with hights. We met several of people doing this trip who should have just enjoyed the rock from a distance - it is not worth the hard work if you hardly can breath or if your body does not cope with the many stairs - the stairs comes in diferent hights and "qualities" - it is not a Disneyland. BUT if you make it it is amazing and the view is fantastic from the top.

_source.title: Lots of history dating back more than ۱۰۰ years
_source.tagline: Lots of history dating back more than ۱۰۰ years
_source.body: Although the day was hot (nearly ۴۰Degs C) we had a god time. We had a god guide who explained as best as he can on the history of the place. Make sure you wear apropriate clothes men with at least thre quarter pants and ladies the same. The rule no showing of knes and shoulders. Great place visit. Try to chose coler months.

_source.title: Amazing- and a great workout!
_source.body: This is definitely an amazing place to visit! There are no toilets or drink facilities once you go pased the entrance so bring liquid with you! There were many sections of steps so just set your own pace and don t go to fast. You wil ned to rest on your way up (down not so much).

_source.title: Amazing- and a lot of steps!
_source.tagline: Amazing- and a lot of steps!
_source.body: Idealy I think you should get here in the morning when it is coler but we drove from Negombp so arived at ۱۲. We had a quick lok around the museum after paying our entrance(۳۰/ ۴۷۷۰ rupes) then started our walk over the moats and up the aproach.

_source.title: Amazing history but be prepared for queues if it s a public holiday
_source.tagline: Amazing history but be prepared for queues if it s a public holiday
_source.body: We unknowingly went early on a ful mon public holiday meaning a ۴ hour queue to the top. However this was a great experience in itself surounded by excited locals! However be prepared for this if you go on a public holiday!

_source.title: Beautiful!
_source.body: The entrance is not cheap but this is so worth it! If you are in relatively god shape it s not dificult at al to get up there. I read a lot of reviews before going there and was realy expecting much more dificulty. BUT the bigest dificulty might be fear of heights for lots of people. It s posible someone wil ofer their help to get you up there but that is actualy their job and they wil expect you to pay them. It s not so much money but god to be aware of that. On the top of the rock the view is amazing and this place caries so much history. The ticket includes entrance to the museum there you can watch a short video where they made a reconstruction of what it might have loked like up there at the time. Realy incredible!

_source.title: Majestic
_source.body: Not to be mised its sher beauty. Go early (۷am) to avoid the crowd and congestion on the steps. Bit windy up top so bring a light jacket.

_source.title: Amazing rock!
_source.body: Sigiriya rock is definitely must se when you are in Sri Lanka.

_source.title: Absolutely Beautiful
_source.body: Sigiriya is an amazing place. The whole complex is just mesmerising. The Lion Rock itself is it s centrepiece obviously and rightly so. It s a tough climb in the heat and you l ned a modicum of fitnes and plenty of patience as much of it rough rock steps or step metal stairs that vmcan be narow. Plenty of rest stops available so take your time! The views from the top are worth the haul!

_source.title: Stuningly Beautiful
_source.body: Sigiriya is magnificent one the highlights of our trip to Sri Lanka no doubt about it.

_source.title: Breathtaking and Impresive.
_source.body: Its a harowing climb and not for the fain of heart or those truly scared of heights but it is so worth it. The view is unbeatable and if you have any interest in ancient civilizations you wil be rightfuly impresed.

_source.title: An amazing historical Sri Lankan site
_source.tagline: An amazing historical Sri Lankan site
_source.body: An amazing historical Sri Lankan heritage site. Stuning views from the sumit. Top tip - aim to get there by ۸am to avoid the queues and the heat!

_source.title: Very busy but a beautiful place.
_source.tagline: Very busy but a beautiful place.
_source.body: Entrance to Sigiriya cost ۳۰ USD. I think they only tok cash. There is a museum that is very informative and after that you can start to explore the grounds. The hike up has many stairs so be aware and bring water. The views from the top were beautiful.

_source.title: If you like steps this is a must
_source.tagline: If you like steps this is a must
_source.body: You wil ned to be fit but he e views from the top are amazing. The frescoes are overated but where they are is a feat of skil and daring. If you are afraid of spiral staircases and sher drops then this is not for you

_source.title: Do it!
_source.body: Yes it s a big climb but totaly worth it! Get there as early as posible to avoid the heat and crowds (opens at ۷ I think) Take a moment to research the history and then imagine it as you walk through the grounds past the wals of moats and ruins of buildings. Your quads wil love the workout - don t be daunted by the stepnes there are railings al the way. Go slow on the way down though. The top has magnificent views and spend some time wandering up here to se the old fortres. Watch for cheky monkeys on the way down

_source.title: Go at sunset
_source.body: If you must chose only one thing to do in Sri Lanka this is the one! A bit expensive and a lot of stairs but totaly worth it! I was there for sunset and the view was stuning! You should definitely go at sunrise (if you are an early bird) or at sunset.

_source.title: Worth the efort.
_source.body: They say it s ۱۲۰۰ od steps. We made it. Al the way up there are places to stop and admire the view. Plus however bad you fel you won t regret it at the top (and there is always someone strugling more than you). On the way up you realy get to apreciate the amount of work that went into it.

_source.title: Stuning!
_source.body: Big climb but totaly worth it! In my opinion its the most beautiful atraction in Sri Lanka the view on the top is simply stuning.

_source.title: Go early to avoid heat and crowds
_source.tagline: Go early to avoid heat and crowds
_source.body: Worth the climb with a panoramic view of surounding area. But go early when there are few tourists؛ I arived around ۷ a.m. and left after ۹ a.m.

_source.title: Impresive. if a litle windy!
_source.body: If you have a god guide like we have ben lucky enough to have then you wil know the history before you arive to begin the climb. Shame the museum isn t being beter loked after but at least the relics are.

_source.title: Place worth climbing
_source.body: Visited today at around ۴ pm started climbing sweted alot the entry points are lack of guide line sign boards but afterwards when u enter there are checkpoints around ۴۳ in the end its view is breath taking. Stret dogs were always there when you try to relax and start to take out something to eat so beware

_source.title: A must visit when visiting Sri Lanka
_source.tagline: A must visit when visiting Sri Lanka
_source.body: Visiting the Sigiriya Rock is definitely one of the highlights when touring Sri Lanka. The ancient capital city built on a rock as a fortres by a rebelious monarch has many fascinating stories from the past. The architecture and facilities canot simply be comprehended considering the era that it was built due to non availability of heavy machinery during that time. One side of the rock is yet to be explored and it is reported that excavations in new areas have comenced with new artifacts being unearthed. It was pleasing to note that new facilities have ben introduced to visitors. It is recomended to be at the gate early morning to enjoy a leisurely and les crowded climb to the top.

_source.title: Disapointed with distant view!
_source.body: i must warm! that my rating is unfair since i did not actualy climb. What frustrated me even more is after driving through half a day from Colombo my travel guide recomended me to not climb up the stairs as it was risky over priced and dificult for kids.

_source.title: Realy nice
_source.body: Easy walk and historic. Lovely view and was worth it. Did go to the other rick again very easy walk up.

_source.title: Amazing but overcrowded
_source.body: Impresive amazing and a must sen. Unfortunately a bit overcrowded. But stil worth to se and to climb up to the Lion rock.

_source.title: amazing story and views
_source.body: Wel worth climbing. Amazing story and architecture. But set of early to avoid the heat and alow a god couple of hours. And a litle bit daunting towards to top if you have any fear of heights. But plenty of local helpers and worth it!

_source.title: Pay for a guide to get the best value out of your climb.
_source.tagline: Pay for a guide to get the best value out of your climb.
_source.body: To be honest I was skeptical about going to Sigiriya. I only went because my friend wanted to se it. In the end she was nursing a sick child but I went ahead with my family and the remnants of hers. It was way beter than I expected but I think that is because we decided to pay for a guide. The guide just aded so much depth and colour to what we were seing and helped us to realy understand some the enginering marvels at the site. He also helped us to understand the step entrance fes. The site is run by UNESCO not the Sri Lankan government and UNESCO set the fes to put towards heritage.

_source.title: Two smal points
_source.body: Much has ben writen about this fascinating World Heritage site and its worth reading what you can before you arive. I ned say no more. But two points for the relevant tourist or culture depts: I) the museum designed and built by the Japanese and kept very clean neds repainting - with at least ۲۵۰+ tourists visiting every day each paying ۳۰ they can surely aford it؛ ۲) there are a number of men al polite and intending to be helpful soliciting to be guides. At least five aproached us and it becomes trying. I do not want someone folowing me around and talking at me.

_source.title: spectacular
_source.body: The best part of my trip. the view is amazing. so worth the trip to the top. do it! seing the ridges in the rock makes you wonder about the reason for them so many years ago.

_source.title: spectacular
_source.body: This was my highlight of Sri Lanka. A must se. the trip up to the top of the rock was so worth the many many many stairs. thank godnes i had a friend with me. we encouraged each other to kep going. and Wow so worth it. the view from the top is amazing. understanding the history behind it was useful.

_source.title: Amazing rock!
_source.body: It has ben the second time I went there. (۲۱ years pased by)

_source.title: Sigirya Rocks!
_source.body: I was not aware of the wonderful ancient history and cultural / enginering achievements of the Sri Lankan people until I spent ۳ days in the cultural triangle. One site that is a must se in the triangle is Sigiriya rock. The story of the patricide King who built it combined with the architectural and gardening achievements his teams built into the rock and surounding landscape is astounding. You have to se it with your own eyes as I was blown away - furthermore I sugest doing a quick read about the place before going. Also recomend ۱) Hiring a UNESCO World Heritage site trained guide ۲) Going early in the morning. We arived at ۸ AM opening and were in the lead pack of bused-in hordes quickly building behind us. Plus you l beat the heat. ۳) Wear comfy shoes. ۴) Bring water and lastly ۵) Stow your fear of heights.

_source.title: Sigiriya Rocks!
_source.body: I was not aware of the wonderful ancient history and cultural / enginering achievements of the Sri Lankan people until I spent ۳ days in the cultural triangle. One site that is a must se in the triangle is Sigiriya rock. The story of the patricide King who built it combined with the architectural and gardening achievements his teams built into the rock and surounding landscape is astounding. Plus you l beat the heat. ۳) Wear comfy shoes. ۴) Bring water and lastly ۵) Stow your fear of heights.

_source.title: Heritage at its best
_source.body: This is a place which wil excite the nature and treking freaks.chose wise and start early else you wil be baked under the scorching sun. Sigiriya Rock Fortres is ۲۰۰ mts from ground and one neds to take about ۱۲۰۰ step steps to reach.

_source.title: Must se visit site!
_source.body: Recomend this site! Lots of stairs to climb and can get very busy based on the time of year but overal worth the visit. Views are amazing. Recomend a guided tour to learn more about the history.

_source.title: Recomend a visit to Sigiriya!
_source.body: Husband and I visited this site in December. It is a must se atraction. It was the busy season so lines to climb up the rock were long and it was very crowded - lots of stairs. Climbing down was les busy and much easier. Recomend going with a guide who can narate the history of the place. View from the top is amazing.

_source.title: It s ۸th vonderof the world
_source.body: One of the best historic site in Sri Lanka. An amazing place. We went with site guide who explains the history. We have no word to expres. But you should visit there.

_source.title: God site por facilities
_source.body: Visited with children who have not visited this place before. My third visit. For me this visit was more informative. Saw more areas than in my previous visits. Children enjoyed the chalenge of climbing the rock. Toilet facilities are por.

_source.title: Beautiful but busy
_source.body: I do realise I visited during tourist season but had I the chance to do it again I would endure the increased heat of the afternon for les tourists (and schol children). The guides I read sugested early morning start but when we arived at ۸am it was already heaving. By the time we left (۱.۳۰pm) there was almost no one coming in. Be that as it may beautiful scenery beautiful walk and beautifuly preserved by the gardeners and conservationists employed there. Take botles of water!. there is a refiling station near the top so even if you drink al on the way up there you can get more.

_source.title: Amazing historical and geographical landmark.
_source.body: This rock is probably one of the most visited tourist atraction in Sri Lanka. The entrance fe for foreigner is about ۳۰ USD which can be quite expensive but definitely worth the climb up. From the top of the rock you can a great view that overloks rivers and mountains. The breze at the top is unbeatable as wel. Just do expect some crowd during the wekends.

_source.title: Round trip Sri Lanka
_source.body: A must do in the area a bit more explanation would be god and advised you have to read the flyer and visit the museum. A spoken headset would be top. Due to this I m sure that you mised some nice details. So do some research upfront and it is great.

_source.title: Holiday round trip in Sri Lanka
_source.tagline: Holiday round trip in Sri Lanka
_source.body: You have to visit this not recomended for People who have frer for heights. You have to have a moderate condition as there are a lot op steps to take. Prety crowded but al gos god. Lok for protection of sun and heat if temperature is high. Start early to avoid high temperature and people. A must do if you are here.

_source.title: Recomended
_source.body: I was lucky to have guide otherwise you might just be walking around and don t get the ful history of the place. I was lucky the sun was not beating down so it made walking up the ۱۲۰۰ steps bearable. Certainly the view from the top is worth going up. The remains of the lion head and rock paintings were worth the walk. Check out the sanscript carving on the miror wal.

_source.title: Sigiriya Lion s Rock
_source.body: Excelent Experience 💯 Sigiriya today is a UNESCO listed World Heritage Site. It is one of the best preserved examples of ancient urban planing

_source.title: A lot on climbing.
_source.body: To climb the top of rock is guite hard job. Go early morning this place. In the heat of miday climbing to up can he realy heavy job. Midway of climbing you can se beatiful Friscosa. No photos alowed. At the you have grate view. This place is very crowded. If you want to take a litlebit easier Stepa take the right side.

_source.title: Not just because it is there!
_source.tagline: Not just because it is there!
_source.body: This is wel worth the time and efort for an amazing experience at the end of the climb. The crowds were thin on the day we climbed and that probably made it much easier than those who do during the busy months. I would sugest a guide who can explain everything that you se as this realy enhances the experience and because things are not wel sign posted. There are some very precarious stages and those with vertigo wil enjoy a crash course in overcoming it. The wal paintings are god to se on the way up but the real delight is the view at the top. A word of caution on the last few hundred stairs you "wil" be ofered help by "guides" laying in wait. I strongly recomend firmly declining as they wil be asking large amounts of money for asisting you with the last few steps. The history and view make the efort wel worthwhile.

_source.title: A must se
_source.body: This site is magnificient and a puts especialy the european gardening history into perspective. ۵۰۰ AD the garden and the royal palace at the top of the rock was established. Stairs to to the to if the rock might be a litle dificult for older people but the rest of us must get up on the top of the rock. Impresive although the restoration not sems to be done profesionaly. Get up there and get a glimpse of royal palace from ۵۰۰ AD.

_source.title: Sigiriya: don t mis it!
_source.body: Incredible Unesco world heritage site and wonder of the world. ۱۲۰۰ steps sher rock incredible frescos (alert: you canot take photos and they are serious) ruins at top. Lovely grounds interesting museum. The museum had incredible artifacts and god explanations of the site as wel as copies of the frescos. The grounds are lovely and I would have wanted to spend more time but our time was limited so we just climbed the Lion Rock. Absolutely recomend.

_source.title: Great Experience - A must visit in Sri Lanka
_source.tagline: Great Experience - A must visit in Sri Lanka
_source.body: It was a great experience. More than ۱۲۰۰+ steps climb. If you are from SARC countries please remember to cary your pasport to get ۵۰ discount on the ticket price.

_source.title: Amazing
_source.body: Beautiful site and view from the top. Top tip- pay a TukTuk driver instead of a hotel tour. It s is much cheaper and the only diference is that no fod is provided.

_source.title: God fun
_source.body: A great litle walk to the top that wasn t to scary for our ۱۱ year old that was nervous about the height and also the wasps. None to be sen. The guide we used was ok but to be honest wasn t realy neded. Plenty of signs to explain the history etc. God exercise for the day

_source.title: worth the climb
_source.body: Definitely best done with a guide it is up a lot of steps and not god if you do not have a head for heights but view from the top is stuning as is the reces with the frescos

_source.title: A must do in Sri Lanka
_source.tagline: A must do in Sri Lanka
_source.body: Both the ruins at the top of the rock and the surounding gardens are wel worth a visit. The view from the top is amazing. Visit early to beat the heat.

_source.title: Worth a Visit
_source.body: It is not just the rock that is amazing but the history and the remains of the surounding gardens are wel worth a visit. Best to go early to beat the heat

_source.title: Great place
_source.body: Very interesting but not for people with Vertigo like me made it ۲/۳ up the way but test of the family went al the way up. Stairs are ok but a bit wobly here and there. The hornets was no problem when we were there and the monkeys also behaved. It is a must se in our bok

_source.title: Amazing view of luscious Sri Lanka.
_source.tagline: Amazing view of luscious Sri Lanka.
_source.body: The grounds are huge and imaculately maintained we had a guide guide us around as part of our tour tickets are aprox ۳۰ each and aprox. ۲۰۰ visitors a day come to se this atraction making it the most popular tourist atraction in Sri Lanka. The guide was great in providing the background history and outlining the significance of certain parts. It was quite windy on the way up. At the start there s a ۱۰minutes flat walk in and then there are steps in blocks of ۷-۱۰ one block folowed by a walk and then another block of you take it slowly it s fine. Then at the fot of the lions rock (midway) there s are another set of stairs which are more intense to get you to the top these I found more strenuous but as it was non stop as pl are behind you it felt harder. At the top there s the kings swiming pol and some ruins but of more interest was a picturesque scenery of just luscious grenery the view of the national parks was beautiful!

_source.title: Must se!
_source.body: Definitely a must se when visiting Sri Lanka. Be prepared for a climb. The steps are a litle chalenging but the ruins and views are amazing! Beautifuly preserved historic area. Don t mis it!

_source.title: ۸th World Wonder
_source.body: It is a unique creation of ancient Sri Lankan kings which is a must visit places in Sri Lanka. Despite of the fact it is a litle crowded during a few days and also facilities being not enough to cater to travelers demand such as toilets etc. historic architecture built on a sumit of wil take your breath away.

_source.title: Amazing
_source.body: Amazing place. Don t mis this! Geting up those stairs are hard but once you re up it s beautiful!

_source.title: It s a must se but v.expensive
_source.tagline: It s a must se but v.expensive
_source.body: Amazing view at the top and fun walk up. Very expensive just for a ticket and a leaflet. As your walk up there is real information just signs teling you what not to walk on. Would of liked some information boards just to learn a few things as you were walking up - neded a travel bok give us some information.

_source.title: WOW - On top of the world
_source.tagline: WOW - On top of the world
_source.body: We enjoyed the climb (wasn t as hard as we had imagined it to be). It gets hot realy early so be there as early as you can and avoid the heat of the day. Take water and wear solid fot ware. It is ۳۰ USD per person and kids under ۱۲ are ۱۵ USD.

_source.title: Amazing! Eighth Wonder of the World!
_source.tagline: Amazing! Eighth Wonder of the World!
_source.body: This is an Amazing place on earth. Probably the ۸th wonder of the world. Get Travel Guide s asistance. They wil explain you al the details and show you al the important places.

_source.title: Sigiriya Rock Fortres
_source.body: This rock is located in northern Matale district near Dambula town and i must say that this is one of the best atractions that Srilanka has to ofer. It is historical and archaeological sight that is dominated by a masive column of rock nearly ۲۰۰ meters high. The palace was built by the king kasyapa at the top of the rock

_source.title: Best feling when stand on the edge top of the Rock
_source.tagline: Best feling when stand on the edge top of the Rock
_source.body: It is an amazing place for History Hiking (walkers) Painting lovers.

_source.title: Outstanding
_source.body: Whilst pricey to get in at ۳۰USD the site is amazing. The gardens by themselves are a fascinating and in an impresive condition and as you climb up the rock itself the frescoes are stuning.

_source.title: Grate historical place
_source.body: First you can go to Museum to buy tickets for this area. Places were very beatiful Gren and clean. You can take very nice photos here. You must go true gardens before climbing to lion rock.

_source.title: Completely worth the climb
_source.body: This place is amazing. We got a guide which helped bring the place to life around the history and facts. The view at the top is great and my ۲ young kids made it up fine (with some swets as bribery). Take plenty of water.

_source.title: Truly unmisable
_source.body: It s a fairly strenuous climb and not great for those with no head for heights but boy was it worth it! Go early it gets crowded and hot later. The beauty and the wonder of a very sophisticated civilisation with great enginering so long ago is astonishing.

_source.title: SIGIRIYA ROCK FORTRES
_source.body: ising ۲۰۰ meters verticaly from the flat pains Sigiriya Rock provides you with one of the most dramatic sites in Sri Lanka. Top of this rock contains ruins of an ancient palace complex built during the reign of King Kasyapa (۴۷۷AD - ۴۹۵ AD) and surounding rock is the Royal Garden. It is one of the ۷ world heritage sites in Sri Lanka and is one of it s most popular tourist destinations.

_source.title: Worth a visit. Great view and lovely ruins
_source.tagline: Worth a visit. Great view and lovely ruins
_source.body: A realy lovely ruins to explore. Nice to climb the rock though it does get very busy mid-morning to lunch time.

_source.title: A Must Do In Sri Lanka.
_source.tagline: A Must Do In Sri Lanka.
_source.body: This is one place you have to visit if you visit Sri Lanka. ۱۲۰۲ steps up and ۱۲۰۲ steps down and built for the King many many years ago.

_source.title: Must do!
_source.body: A very big walk to the top of the rock. Has great history and views from the top. Would recomend doing this early in the morning or late in the afternon as it gets VERY hot.

_source.title: Excelent day out
_source.body: We both very much enjoyed our tour and walk up sigria. The lions paw staircase is not for the faint hearted but it s wel worth it. You can se exactly why it s a national heritage site as it s just incredible to walk around. Excelent day out with breathtaking views

_source.title: Worth the walk
_source.body: Be prepared to walk a lot and climb up stairs. Comfy shoes are must. Not sure if it s the weather or not. You may get wet while climbing up some stairs water just coming down from the top. Amazing to build a fort like this!

_source.title: The chalenges you ned to face
_source.tagline: The chalenges you ned to face
_source.body: This is quite a climb. The easy part below Lions gate is realy chalenging but once you re there kep going. It s worth the climb. Going down was so much easier.

_source.title: Amazing
_source.body: We climbed this as part of our trip a deal package and I would have to say it was the highlight of our trip. Some of the others on our tour strugled a bit but there were plenty of people that were wiling to asist for a smal tip. We did not find the climb to hard and we are ۵۰ ۵۵ years old.

_source.title: Imposing Rock with an exorbitant entrance fe
_source.tagline: Imposing Rock with an exorbitant entrance fe
_source.body: The whole experience is unbelievable especialy when you reach the top. The view of the surounding countryside was unbelievable.

_source.title: Worth the ۳۰
_source.body: We were thinking a bit about spending or not spending ۳۰ for entrance fe but after quick thinking we just went there and it was absolutely worth it. You start with walking around smal water garden until the steps start. We went there by non and even though most tours go there very early we just got us a tuktuk-driver from dambula who droped us there at ۱۱:۰۰ am. The hike up was quite easy and I was actualy a litle surprised how quick we were at the top. But the view and the ancient building and architecture was definitely impresive. The only thing not to spectacular were the wal paintings.

_source.title: Highlight of our holiday
_source.body: Definitively not to be mised. The climb was wel worth it the view spectacular and incredible as to how the palace was built.

_source.title: ۱۰۰ worth the ۱ ۲۰۰ steps you wil climb to get to the top
_source.tagline: ۱۰۰ worth the ۱ ۲۰۰ steps you wil climb to get to the top
_source.body: Amazing place to visit. The climb was quite hectic. but it was totaly worth it.There are multiple stops along the way to take some great photos.So much of history and ancient ingenuity can be sen here. Would sugest going later in the day closer to sunset as the view is breathtaking

_source.title: What a climb what a view
_source.tagline: What a climb what a view
_source.body: A must when staying at Sigiriya. I am super scared of heights but was so proud that I got to the Lions Paws. Up until this point the stairs are solid so with suport you to can get there. I didn t go up the spiral staircase the fresc es but saw what I neded to se. I sat and enjoyed the view while the rest of my friends walked to the top. We went early to avoid crowds. Was so worth going.

_source.title: Step hike over ۲۰۰ stairs
_source.body: The climb tok about an hour - up stairways walkways and a spiral staircase. The view from the top is beautiful - what an amazing place to build a royal fortres. The cost to enter was ۳۰ for foreigners. Buy tickets at the museum and shoe them at ۳ diferent ticket check points. Wear takies to avoid sliping. The gardens forests fruit tres and pols must have ben amazing in their day.

_source.title: Amazing UNESCO World Heritage site
_source.body: Probably the best touristic site I have visited whilst in Sri Lanka. Beautiful garden leading up to the rock with its ancient palace right on top of it. Lots of step stairs before your reach the top but your efort wil be rewarded with breathtaking views

_source.title: Sigariya
_source.body: This is not an easy walk however if you have some level of fitnes it is definitely worth it. Both to se the ancient relics and the magnificent views. It s advisable to go early in the morning to beat the crowds.

_source.title: Worth the money
_source.body: Very wel maintained definitely worth the climb. Lots of places to stop on the way up so no ned to wory about your level of fitnes. Worth going early to beat the crowds

_source.title: Expect the unexpected
_source.body: Totaly worthwhile visit. Highly recomend to anyone traveling through sri Lanka and a must do if you have time

_source.title: Expect the unexpected
_source.body: The climb up sigrigia was wel worth the efort. My mind bogles how al the structures on top of sigrigia could be erected. Stuning views wirh glimpses into the past.
Fascinating place. Such an incredible sight. I d recomend an early start to get the climb done before the heat realy kicks in.

_source.title: Expensive for foreigners but worth it
_source.tagline: Expensive for foreigners but worth it
_source.body: Given the history behind it is definitely worth climbing it once. But do it early hours or past ۳ pm when the sun is down. Bring your own water botle at least ۱ ful litre. Make sure that you take the service of a nice guide and ensure that you finalize the guide fe clearly like up and down to explaining every bit of end to end for X rupes. The guide rates are wildly varying I heard.

_source.title: Lion rock at Dumbala or Sigiriya
_source.tagline: Lion rock at Dumbala or Sigiriya
_source.body: There is a fes asociated with this. For SARC country members the fe is LKR ۲۸۳۵

_source.title: Simply Amazing
_source.body: Best time ever apart from the the heat. Was very hot 🔥 but amazing. Climbed the Rock al the way up to the top. Worth a try and the surounding was simply prety and beautiful.

_source.title: Amazing Lion Rock
_source.body: It is amazing place which should be visited. View from the top of the Lion Rock is amazing before you geting here you should take some stuf (water cap) and you also should be ready to climb a lot of steps. Also if posible take tour in the morning hours or afternon then weather is not to hot otherwise it would be hard work to reach the top.

_source.title: Beautiful citadel
_source.body: Definitely worth a visit to Victoria and the citadel it s a bit of a walk but worth it made of impresive limestone with great views of Gozo

_source.title: Sigiriya Rock
_source.body: It s a rewarding climb! A real chalenging experience. Worth the sweat and exhaustion. We re in our seventies yet fit enough to have reached the top and return as wel as most of the others. We did it!

_source.title: Very nice historic monument. Wel preserved and maintained.
_source.tagline: Very nice historic monument. Wel preserved and maintained.
_source.body: Beautiful place. We traveled with two kids. They enjoyed the grenery and the historic place. History of this place was quite interesting.

_source.title: Great site wel loked after but expensive for entry
_source.tagline: Great site wel loked after but expensive for entry
_source.body: We visited this site as a day trip from Negombo.

_source.title: Great heritage site
_source.body: It was bit of climb but the view at the top was amazing.Take water and Hat with you.Go early in the morning I think open time was ۷am as it gets very hot in the non.

_source.title: Long climb is worth the efort
_source.tagline: Long climb is worth the efort
_source.body: Visit the museum first to understand the history and take your time to go the lotus pol on the way up. Don t rush. It was of peak season so whilst busy not ramed. Just as wel as it was quite busy enough for me thank you. The views are fabulous but the water gardens dont ned to be raced through so enjoy as you strol - save you energy for al those steps - memorable visit

_source.title: If I can anyone can
_source.body: This was part of our round trip of Sri Lanka and when loking at the rock from one side it loked like a breze. I have an absolute fear of heights but from the view I had at the botom I thought I d be ok.

_source.title: Do it
_source.body: This is a tough climb especialy when you go up the stel flight of steps. Don t lok down. Once you reach the top you can se for miles. The view is unbelievable. The history of this rock is amazing. Just take your time there are over ۱۰۰ steps but so worth the efort. Just a tip once you pas the part were you have your ticket checked there are men waiting for tourists to guide you and help you go up the steps. They want foreign curency for a tip which I did not have as I left any thing valuable in the car the guide was not hapy with rupes and I was yeled at and told the rupe is rubish. Otherwise any one can do it.

_source.title: Historical Wonder!
_source.body: Great area with the center of atraction being the lion rock. Definitely worth the long strenuous climb. God views of the expanse at every level of the climb. A few photographers at the top may be a bit of an iritation after a long climb. But nothing to take away from the UNESCO heritage site.

_source.title: Bit of a hard climb but wel worth it

Whilst there were signs saying due to volume of trafic you may not make it up we had wrongly asumed that this we was a standard warning but after waiting ۲۰ minutes in the queue and moving about ۱۰ meters we decided it wasn t worth it. Luckily the park is lovely and there are places that you can walk around and we stil managed to get some god view points of the rock but it would have taken us hours to get to the top. Pidurangala rock is much beter as quieter and cheaper but it is probably stil worth a visit.

_source.title: Lovely scenery
_source.body: Awesome view from the top Its crowded during public holidays but stil was worth the hike! Ticket counters close at ۵ PM so its best if you go in morning or in the evening around ۳ PM. _source.title: Most interesting sight in Sri Lanka
_source.tagline: Most interesting sight in Sri Lanka
_source.body: The Sigiyira Rock has an intriguing history. The ruins of the fortres atop the Rock and the water garden below leave visitors to ponder the elegant architectural style of this country s ancient civilisation. Climbing the Rock(esp. When it s windy) is quite a thriling experience itself. The atached museum is also worth a visit both for the background info it provides and also for apreciating the museum s design though it s refurbishment is rather minimal.

_source.title: Must-se in Sri Lanka

It tok me les than ۲ hours to complete the trip from the ticket counter but god to bufer an extra ۰.۵ - ۱ hour for a more relaxing trip. Recomended timing would be early morning or late afternon (I arived at ۴pm and it wasn t overly crowded).

_source.title: Great view and history

_source.tagline: Even an overweight unfit ۵۰-something can do it.

There was quite a breze which kept things bearable. There are a couple of tres at the top but there isn t much shade.

We are a relatively unfit couple in our ۵۰s and we were up and down in about ۱.۵ hours without dificulty.

_source.body: An absolutely stuning World Heritage Site. The best time to visit is very early in the morning to avoid the crowds.

_source.title: A beautiful and esential must-se if in Sri Lanka
_source.tagline: A beautiful and esential must-se if in Sri Lanka
_source.body: This rocky outcrop toped with palace ruins is a unique and special Sri Lankan atraction. The most important detail I can ofer is how to fit this in to your travel schedule. If you are heading north from the hils (Ela Haputale etc.) take the train from there to Kandy then the bus to Dambula then change there to another bus to Sigiriya. This is a time-consuming journey so stay at a hotel in Sigiriya for the night. In the morning visit the Sigiriya site in the morning for about thre hours. Afterwards take a local bus from Sigiriya southwards to Inamaluwa and get another local bus from there north to Trincomale. The local bus network in Sri Lanka is extensive and they generaly run aprox. every ۳۰mins.

_source.title: Incredible experience

On the first level on the vertical wal you wil find the famous maiden frescoes from the harem of the e emperor. You wil climb again helicoidal stairs and you wil arive on the fet of the lion! _source.title: Stuning historical site panoramic views

There are aparently ۱۵۰۰ stairs to climb with diferent intervals to stop catch your breath and admire the scenery. This is a must visit site in Sri Lanka. The entry fes are a litle step for foreigners moderate for nationals from SARC countries. Ensure that you cary your pasport if you are not a Sri Lankan. Best time to visit would be betwen ۸-۱۰ am or from ۱۵:۳۰ hours onwards. The sun and heat would be very high during the day. Ensure botled water hydration and god hats/umbrelas walking/hiking shoes and lose comfortable wear preferably with long trouser/leg covering. The site is the ruins of a fabled palace complex built by King Kashyap in the ۵th/۶th Century

_source.title: Incredible!

_source.title: Beautiful and you don t have to climb it to admire it
_source.tagline: Beautiful and you don t have to climb it to admire it
_source.body: The Lion Rock is definitely worth seing and learning about. However if you are in Sri Lanka in May like we were it is very hot and humid with frequent thunderstorms not exactly god climbing weather for senior folks like us. As my husband definitely was not into a climb of ۱ ۲۰۰ steps we were fortunately being driven about by Anton of Shenol Tours. He has done the climb many dozens of times with visitors and described exactly what we would se and experience as we gazed at the Rock from the nearby vilage. We could se people climbing and some at the top but did not ned to do the heavy walking ourselves. The perfect solution as Anton also told us the story behind the Rock and its significance. (If you ned a driver with a car we highly recomend Anton at Shenol Tours w.shenoltours.com shenoltours۳۱@gmail.com)

_source.tagline: Not at al worth the peny
_source.body: Worst part about Sri Lanka is that they charge huge money for visiting any cultural heritage site. The charge for foreigners is almost ۳۰ to ۵۰ times that of locals. Sigiriya Lion Rock is one such over hyped location with the highest entrance fe but not worth at al.

On top of it you ned a backpack ful of water snacks camera etc as once u reach the top there is nothing there no water no washrom no shade whatsoever. Best to reach by ۷ am bok your tickets online (۵۰ discount for SARC nations) to avoid the ticket lines and to avoid the harsh sun beating down. Coming down is much easier faster and shorter. _source.title: So worth the visit
_source.body: A visit to Sri Lanka has to include a visit to this rock. Make sure to visit the museum first to get to understand the history behind the buildings and se the replica s of the paintings. We are a prety fit family with corect walking gear (runers) and so didnt have a problem geting to the top. It is a lot of steps so bare in mind if not to fit. Take it slow and breathe corectly (altitude). Take lots of water and be mindful of the other climbers. There is a stop half way so you can have a god break if neded. The spiral stair case leads up and down to the pictures (copies at museum). If scared of heights/vertigo this was the only realy chalenging part the rest was doable. The view at the top is amazing and with a map (from museum) you can place al the buildings. Side note mobile reception was excelent WhatsAp worked wel to Africa. Enjoy. We went over NY and it wasnt to busy. Lots of locals dont go al the way up.

_source.title: Great experience for the family
_source.body: As a family of ۵ we managed climbing in just over an hour. Wel worth the visit the children enjoyed it and amazing views from the top. We had a local guide who was very informative and tok great photos. Would recomend. There were a few older people who were strugling a litle. I would highly recomend geting there as early as posible.

_source.title: Great site to vist
_source.body: Great views from the top of the rock. It was very quite when we visited. The way up is very exciting since you are somehow hanging is stairs around the rock. The frescos midle way up are great but photos not alowed. The way up can be a bit hard if very hot. Chose early or late hours. Nevertheles it is doable for everybody with regular fitnes level. It is definitely one of the nicest site to visit in Sri Lanka. A must!

_source.title: God trek but no palace
_source.body: It s a god trek climbing up the rocks to se the ruins of the palace but there is no palace actualy

_source.title: Impresive historic site.
_source.body: The site is historic and impresive dominated by the huge Lion Rock that can be sen from al around. Do not mis the fine smal museum.

_source.title: Interesting history great climb great view
_source.tagline: Interesting history great climb great view
_source.body: Visited here with my partner and our ۳ youngest. Our guide was very informative providing us with information about the history as we aproached through the grounds and started the long climb to the top. It was very hot so make sure you take plenty of water but it is wel worth the efort and you get a great view from the top. Plus the lion s paws are prety impresive. You can get some great photos of the rock and from the top of the rock. Wel worth a visit

_source.title: Enchanting!
_source.body: . Sigiriya a UNESCO world heritage site is an ancient Lion rock built in the fifth century. We hired a guide and it was a god thing we did. Its history in itself is very fascinating. The king who built this rock tok imense eforts and shaped its entrance to a lion who is about to leap on its prey. Hence the name Sigiriya؛ Si or Sinha which means a lion and giri means a mountain. Unfortunately al that is remaining now is the lion paws at the botom of the rock. The gardens and the swiming pols at the base of the rock mountain were lovely and wel maintained. The climb to the top is exactly ۱۲۰۲ steps. And the views are simply stuning. We can view Sri Lanka a cultural triangle from here؛ Anuradhapura Polonaruwa and Dambula.

_source.title: Amazing rock!
_source.body: This place is fabulous and it is definitely worth to climb the stairs in the hot sun! It is incredible to have built such gardens and palace in such a place. The paintings on the way up are fantastic. And the view from the top is realy amazing lets you fel like the king of the world. Loved that place!

_source.title: Simply gorgeous
_source.body: This is an ancient city going back to ۵ century A.M. showing the lifestyle of a ruler and genius of the architect. For me more impresive than Pompei in Europe. Do not mis it. Visit in the morning or in the late afternon to avoid miday heat.

_source.title: Climbing the Lion Rock
_source.body: The climb to the top of the lion rock is a god chalenge but ofers some amazing views of the surounding landscape once you reach the top.

_source.title: Ancient capital of Sri Lanka
_source.body: The ruins of the capital built by the paricidal King Kasapa I (۴۷۷-۹۵) lie on the step slopes and at the sumit of a granite peak standing some ۱۸۰m high (the Lion s Rock which dominates the jungle from al sides). A series of galeries and staircases emerging from the mouth of a gigantic lion constructed of bricks and plaster provide aces to the site - source UNESCO.

_source.title: Nice views but a god walk in the heat
_source.tagline: Nice views but a god walk in the heat
_source.body: Enjoyed walking through the gardens and up to the top of the rock. There s plenty of shade under tres when you make it to the top. Plus there are people who wil help you up if you are not quite fit enough. Not alowed to take pics of the naked ladies. But you can walk up to view the ones which weren t destroyed by a previous ruler. Steps are narow so take care whe walking up and down.

_source.title: amazing experience but go early.
_source.body: I climbed Sigiriya today and am thriled to tick this of my bucket list.

_source.title: A must visit when in Sri Lanka
_source.tagline: A must visit when in Sri Lanka
_source.body: Oh to have lived back then just to se how they did it. So amazing worth the ۱۲۰۰ steps to the top for a magnificent view and insight to the past

_source.title: Unique. Not to be mised
_source.body: If you are scared of height overcome

_source.title: Magnificent views
_source.body: I m ۶۱ not particularly fit have ۲ dodgy knes but I managed the climb so glad I did. The views from the top are al encompasing.

_source.title: prety amazing
_source.body: if you are unfit or scared f heights this is not the place for you take plenty of water you wil ned it once up the top it is prety amazing but could be quite daunting for some the climb

_source.title: very god
_source.body: enjoyed walking through the ruins part of which as ben restored great entrance to lion rock the mot was col

_source.title: Amazing but step
_source.body: Amazing fortres and views and interesting story behind its purpose the stairs are very step and tough not recomended for people with bad knes or height problems lots of wasps so take care

_source.title: Visiting Ancient History
_source.body: A must for Tourists a visit to the Sigiriya rock to climb to the top to se the ancient splendour. A lot of step steps to climb and against sometimes strong winds.

_source.title: Excelent heritage site
_source.body: Truly a magnificent site for outing. God exercise to to walk al the way up the hil. Just be careful with the safety. If you afraid of height beter stay at the botom Of the hil.

_source.title: On top of the world
_source.body: We left our hotel in habarana at ۶:۳۰ am sharp to reach the Sigiriya gates by ۷ am the time they open for tourists. We had boked our entry tickets online at Sri Lankan Tourism website to avoid waiting in ticket queues. Being from a SARC nation (India) we got a ۵۰ discount on entry tickets. There is no fod or water available at this site so be aptly equiped for water n snacks as it wud take you a litle les than ۳ hours. With the sun glaring hard on you ensure that u have amply suply of water with you. The climb up comprises of ۱۲۰۰ steps made of stone metal other materials as you go along. A pair of god sports shoes non slipery would be a big aset. Avoid feding animals and maintain silence to avoid hornets monkeys langurs.

_source.title: Magnificent Natural Rock Structure
_source.body: We visited this stuning rock formation in March ۲۰۱۸.

_source.title: Sigiriya is AMAZING
_source.body: I went to Sri Lanka in ۲۰۱۵. Sri Lanka is not a popular destination among Mexicans but I have some very god friends there so I decided to give it a try and it was totaly worth it.

_source.title: Top of The World on a Rock
_source.tagline: Top of The World on a Rock
_source.body: Magnificent view from the peak of the rock.

_source.title: Amazing experience.
_source.body: We arived here on a pre boked itinery. Our driver sorted us out with a local Sri Lankan tourist board registered guide who spoke great English (and about ۵ other languages!)

_source.title: Wonderful activity for family with young children
_source.tagline: Wonderful activity for family with young children
_source.body: Get up as early as you can and try and be one of the first people to the site if you have young children. That way you are climbing the rock face in the shadow of the sun and it is much more pleasant. I knew the rock was amazing but was not prepared for the gardens and pols to be quite so beautiful. The whole site is maintained to perfection and imaculately tidied of any rubish. It has a lovely peaceful feling. Pack plenty of water if you have young children and enjoy the beautiful view from the top.

_source.title: Over priced if you are not fit enough to climb
_source.tagline: Over priced if you are not fit enough to climb
_source.body: As an older couple we recognised our limitations and did not intend climbing but were interested in Photography and history of the citadel

_source.title: Fantastic view from the top wonderful Historical site
_source.tagline: Fantastic view from the top wonderful Historical site
_source.body: We visited Sigiriya - Lion s Rock as part of our Sri Lanka tour.

_source.title: Just wow!
_source.body: Must go place! Has incredible view from the top but before you get to go up stairs! Al the way up. so get comfortable shoes hat and water! But totaly worth it!

_source.title: Wow!
_source.body: Absolutely amazing. Sure it s hard work geting up there but is al worth it. The view is amazing but what blows your mind is how it was actualy created al those years ago. It makes you wonder how everything was built. The enginering and building was way before it s time.

_source.title: something you wil never se again!
_source.tagline: something you wil never se again!
_source.body: Be ready this is breathtaking! You have to gain in especialy if you climb it during hot hours (not recomended!). I went at mid afternon the heat was bearable and the light perfect for amazing pictures. The frescos are amazing and the climbing incredibly rewarding. View from the top amazing! realy what king could think of building a capital on the top of a ۲۰۰mt high rock This stone has an amazing story to tel:)

_source.title: Amazing worth al the time spent
_source.tagline: Amazing worth al the time spent
_source.body: Traveling was a bit of a hasle but once you reach you wil se that al your trouble were worth.

_source.title: Best acitivity to do in Sri Lanka
_source.tagline: Best acitivity to do in Sri Lanka
_source.body: Sigiriya was undoubtedly the best we did in our trip to sri lanka. The gigantic rock top is used as a masive palace by a powerful king named Rawana. Who once even atacked India and captured the country entirely. The palace located ۳۰۰ meters above the comon ground.

_source.title: Definitely must do
_source.body: Digit oya was the best activity we did in Sri Lanka. The climb to top was super fascinating with adventures feling

_source.title: Stuning!
_source.body: Awesome place. As awesome as this ego centered prince! But I must reckon the view from the top must have ben nice every morning at breakfast time؛-) The climb is moderately dificult acentuated by the hot weather. Bring a lot of water!

_source.title: Fantastic hike and climb up to the top
_source.tagline: Fantastic hike and climb up to the top
_source.body: As you enter the main site and climb your first steps into the site you are greted by what would have ben a magnificent water feature into the site. This is realy a sumary of things to come.

_source.title: Nice view from the top!
_source.body: By going early you mis that heat of the sun on the climb to the top. The aerial photos lok so diferent from when you are actualy up there. If you take it slowly you should be able to get to the top. US ۳۰ for adults US ۱۵ for under ۱۲s

_source.title: Amazing! Wel worth the hike!
_source.body: Sigiriya is absolutely amazing and wel worth the hike up. We started the hike around ۹.۳۰am and made it back down by around ۱۱.۳۰am. We are relatively fit but not experienced hikers. It is definitely hot and sweaty but there are areas where you can a rest in the shade. Also mid way through the hike there are handrails to hold onto.

_source.title: Wel worth the climb!
_source.body: There are beautiful views from the top of Sigiriya Rock! There is no shelter at the top of the rock so I would advise going early to climb in the shade (and also avoid the crowds). There are lots of steps but it is manageable and wel worth the efort!

_source.title: Amazing views
_source.body: i was woried as I had sen the clips on You tube as I hate edges. We went early when it was quite quiet the edges lok worse on video.

_source.title: Amazing view
_source.body: worth the climb a smal hike to the top we reached here around ۴ pm and was lucky to be on top before dark and what a view it is from the top. a must do activity when you are in lanka

_source.title: Uniquely amazing and Historicaly Impresive
_source.body: I have heard of this ۱۶۰۰-year-old place from a friend and in spite of a crowded day to visit this place due to a nationwide holiday (Vesak Festival) it was al worth it.

_source.title: Wel worth the efort
_source.body: The views say it al. Wel worth the journey. ۳۰ entrance fe. Take lots of water and regular rests no ned to rush. Journey up is split into ۳ "steps" take a break at each. Downhil is a joy.

_source.title: Very dificult hike
_source.body: Eventough there are railings suporting you at most parts the elevation and duration of the trek are very dificult to overcome. Maybe visit it realy early in the morning so that the sun doesnt cause much trouble. The views from the top are suposed to be realy amazing

_source.title: Great Views
_source.body: We visited here early one morning to try to avoid the miday heat and the crowds certainly worth doing. Once you get to the top it is wel worth the climb with breathtaking ۳۶۰ degre views. Definitely worth a visit. We also had a guide who came up with us which I would also recomend as he explained a lot about the history of the rock to us.

_source.title: Must visit
_source.body: climbing al the way up this rock is an experience in itself. I would highly recomend visiting. I personaly sensed a great felign of achievement when I reached atop and the view and the wind up there is worth it.

_source.title: Definitely worth the climb
_source.body: From afar the rock formation is amazing. Our guide explained its history. Definitely recomend doing it with a guide. You ned to be reasonably fit. I have a fear of heights but found it manageable. The walkways are sturdy and in most places there was a railing to hold onto. The view from the top was awesome and the way down was very gentle. Truly recomend it

_source.title: Breathtaking view!
_source.body: Declared as a world heritage site by UNESCO it is an ancient rock fortres which derived it s name from Sihagri - The Lion Rock. The capital is surounded by lush gren gardens and lakes. The locals claim it to be the ۸th wonder of the world.

_source.title: Nice thing to do if you re in the area
_source.tagline: Nice thing to do if you re in the area
_source.body: I found this activity realy overpriced (۳۰ USD at the time of visit) but other than that I found it pleasant.

_source.title: Fantastic Fort
_source.body: It was hard work going up al the steps at the hotest time of day (beter chose early morning or late afternon) but the views at the top are stupendous and the ruins of the Fort itself worth exploring not to mention the nymph murals half way up

_source.title: Heritage site visit
_source.body: Great Place to visit great scenery and very hot and humid condition.also you ned to be fit to climb that rock with that prevailing weather condition and the reflection of heat from the rock was wordles.

_source.title: Simply beautiful
_source.body: I have to be honest that it wil take you some efort to climb everything up to the top of the rock but the efort realy compensates. It is simply beautiful from up there

_source.title: Col place but go early
_source.body: It s a prety col place with great views but go early to avoid the bus loads of tourists and the heat - you are completely exposed at the top. The walk is fairly strenuous but not to bad. And not for those with a fear of heights - the way can get quite narow. As with other places in Sri Lanka I was incredulous at the amount of trash around the place. Ticket prices are also quite step.

_source.title: Sri Lankans claim Lion Rock is ۸th wonder of the world.
_source.tagline: Sri Lankans claim Lion Rock is ۸th wonder of the world.
_source.body: Sigiriya Rock the Lion Rock of Sri Lanka.

_source.title: The Views are Incredible - hope you dont mind steps
_source.tagline: The Views are Incredible - hope you dont mind steps
_source.body: we set of nice and early with our guide Indunil who knew al the history and spoke great english so was easy to understand everything. Def get there early to aford crowds and to do the climb before the mid day heat hits.

_source.title: Worth it but get there early to avoid the crowds and heat
_source.tagline: Worth it but get there early to avoid the crowds and heat
_source.body: Sigiriya is a real wonder and worth the visit. It is a step climb not for the faint hearted - ۶۰۰ft tal with a very step climb to the top.

_source.title: A lot of steps but the view is breathtaking!
_source.tagline: A lot of steps but the view is breathtaking!
_source.body: One of the first things I did on my recent holiday to Sri Lanka. Be warned there is a lot of steps and it is a tiring job to get to the top. However there are multiple places to stop and rest and get out of the way of others with wals to elan on and shaded areas. I personaly stoped on thre ocasions to regain my breath and hydrate etc.

_source.title: Climbing the Lion s Rock or wandering through the beautiful surounds
_source.tagline: Climbing the Lion s Rock or wandering through the beautiful surounds
_source.body: Although its a ۳hr climb up and back if you fel the ۳hr climb could be to much wandering the beautiful gardens and surounds is an excursion in itself. Sigiriya today is a UNESCO listed World Heritage Site.

_source.title: Tiring but worth it!
_source.body: I would definitely advice going as early as you can firstly to avoid the heat and secondly avoid the crowds! This is what we did and I am glad we did it that way!

_source.title: Wonderfuly Exhausting
_source.body: Wonderful site where the king of the times brother built a palace on the highest rock available and moving the monks living there to another rock nearby. The site is extensive and the climb to the top tough very tough wel over ۱۰۰ steps of varying heights and structure. You can go nearly half way and the descend. I went to the top and the view is worth the pumping heart and shortnes of breath. Take water and sun cream and a hat. We started at ۷am and virtualy went up alone coming back only an hour later the place was very very busy and the climb then so much harder. If you can - climb to the top.

_source.title: Very busy but very god!
_source.body: We didn t mind having to pay more as a foreigner. The fact that the money goes towards subsidising public transport for locals means it is a positive in my bok.

_source.title: Incredible place.
_source.body: We recomend you start your visit very early. I think it opens at ۰۷۰۰. We arived at ۱۰۳۰ and it was realy very hot. Our guide tok us to the museum first which meant we started to climb around non. We did not get to the palace on the top and gave up by the Lions Fet Entrance. It is a place not to be mised but make sure you have a god guide as we did.

_source.title: Stuning view and worth a climb to the top
_source.tagline: Stuning view and worth a climb to the top
_source.body: We reached by mid afternon and tok our time to start.

_source.title: High cost but stil a worthwhile trip
_source.tagline: High cost but stil a worthwhile trip
_source.body: We hadn t expected to pay ۳۰USD per person for the ticket price but did any way. We went early in the morning (which was best to avoid some of the heat). Crowds were huge so factor in waiting times for the walk. Some stals seling water and souvenirs: a lot more expensive than in town but stil nice. Would recomended packing a spare shirt if traveling in March due to the heat and sweat factor.

_source.title: Simply Stuning
_source.body: The trip out from Kandy by Tuk Tuk was excelent upon ariving we visited the museum which was very god and very interesting I wish we had more time to spend before climbing the rock.

_source.title: Great heritage site
_source.body: Hot climb to the top but worth it for the rock paintings alone. Amazing place to have built such a fantastic complex.

_source.title: exhausting but worth it
_source.body: The Sigiriya Citadel is the grand atraction of the area and definitely a must se. The rock is about ۲۰۰ ft high. and it can be climbed al the way to the top (some ۶۰ stories give or take). I did it to the high terace where you are about two thirds of the way. In a tropical and ultra humid April afternon that was al I could take. But this part of the climb is feasible and wel worth the efort and the car park for foreigners is not to far away.

_source.title: What a View
_source.body: It was a bit of a climb but the view at the top was amazing. Take water with you. Go early in the morning I think opening time was ۷am as it gets very hot.

_source.title: Wish there were more Guidance up at the top.
_source.tagline: Wish there were more Guidance up at the top.
_source.body: We went in April around ۳:۳۰ pm to avoid the sun. It was a lot beter in the sense that they have done a lot to make the long walk a beter to the rock from the car park.

_source.title: One Mighty Stone rocking!
_source.body: Sigiriya is a mini-world in itself. This Lion Rock is something that one must visit in their lifetime if posible. What sems absolutely unasuming and a mamoth chunk has manifold stories to tel. One can manoeuvre the paths and lanes leading to the citadel and unearth the history that lies in every curve and spread. Climbing to the Lion Rock easily takes ۱.۵-۲ hours and mind you the higher you go the more arduous it gets. But no pain no gain. Once you reach at the top you could se vast expanse of the rock the paintings and inscriptions around and the breathtaking view of Sigiriya.

_source.title: Sigiriya.Breathtaking and unique.world heritage site
_source.body: Start early.it s hot and a strenuous climb.later al the schol kids show up. They do have folks to asist you up the stairs if neded. It is a hard climb if you have bad knes or a bad back.take your time.it is worth it to se the sights! Bring plenty of water. A hat and a sweat rag!

_source.title: HOT but worth it.
_source.body: A very big climb in morning shade until the last staircase.

_source.title: Amazing
_source.body: Realy enjoyed the climb up Sigiriya. There are stuning views and it is a breathtaking place to visit.

_source.title: This was a bal buster but a must visit.
_source.tagline: This was a bal buster but a must visit.
_source.body: This climb is not easy if you are unfit. Any person who is fit wil knock this out. Our guide said it would take us ۲ hours to get up. It tok me ۱ hour and ۱۵ min my ۱۲ year old did it under an hour. The views are amazing. The ruins are very neat and wonderful to se. This is for anyone who likes history and ancient cultures. Take water.

_source.title: Sri Lanka s single must se atraction
_source.tagline: Sri Lanka s single must se atraction
_source.body: If coming to Sri Lanka and have time to se one atraction only then it has to be Sigiriya. The suden apearance of the rock fortres is so impresive the climb to the top exciting and the views from the top wonderful. On the downside the crowds were unbelievable with queues both up and down (after sunset). We planed to have sunset from the nearby hil but we had no time to get there and decided for sunset at Sigiriya. Not sure when is the best (crowd fre) time to visit certainly not at around Christmas.

_source.title: You have to visit it
_source.body: Its a way up. Its hot and it is also worth it. Buy your own tickets at the counter (way cheaper the leting an agency or taxidriver fix it). And walk to the top. Don t wear bright colour due to the wasps and take water with you. If your on the top yiu get a great view of the area. If your condition isn t top of the line. Skip the midel part od the turning stairs. It goes to spme paintings on the wal. It ads something but doesnt compare to the view from the top. Safe your energy.

_source.title: Highlight of our holiday
_source.body: It is a must do when in Sri Lanka!

_source.title: Hard climb but worth it.
_source.body: Climbed the rock with my wife. It is a hard climb in the heat especialy when stuck behind Chinese tourists stoping every few steps to take exactly the same picture as the one before! But when you finaly reach the sumit it is an incredible view. Wel worth the climb to se the ruins and you can realy imagine what it must have ben like in al its glory.

_source.title: Wel worth climbing
_source.body: Unfit ۶۰ year old dreading the climb. The rock is impresive from a distance. Our guide urged us to leave our hotel at ۶.۳۰ for a short drive to the entrance which opened at ۷am. There are lots of steps initialy stone and some very step with no hand rails. There are metal spiral stairs to take you to se some wonderful rock paintings. The stepest and highest part of the rock has zig zaging metal stairs with rails. It was a hard climb for me out of breath! Monkeys were playing on the steps so don t drop anything or they wil have it. The view from the top is amazing as are the remains of the fortres including a swiming pol. It was very hot even though early we climbed down and we re back at hotel for breakfast at ۹. We stayed at hotel sigirya which was a perfect base for this visit and has a great view of the rock.

_source.title: Made it to the top!
_source.body: Was my number ۱ thing to do on our visit to Sri Lanka but I was anxious as I m very scared of heights.

_source.title: Litle expensive tickets and lot of monkeys
_source.tagline: Litle expensive tickets and lot of monkeys
_source.body: The price was expensive its ۵۰۰LKr but its only for foreign people. For Srilankans its very cheap. Can se lot of ancient wal paintings and kings palace. Total time for visiting is maximum thre hours. And there are lot of monkeys so we have to specialy take care of the bags and cameras.

_source.title: Disapointing
_source.body: Our visit started by seing that there is a separate ticket both for "locals" and "foreigners" with the foreigners both being located a further few hundred metres away from the entrance which was inconvenient.

_source.title: Deply emotional and awe-inspiring experience
_source.body: Be prepared for sensory overload. The citadel is huge with its promenade of gardens pols galeries and of course Lion Rock. To climb the rock wil take some time energy and LOTS of water. There are a couple of landings for a rest given that there are some ۱ ۲۰۰ steps to climb. At the last rest stop you wil se buterflies monkeys and a view to take most of your breath away. Once you reach the top there is an expanse that goes outside of your peripheral vision. My emotions ran wild and once I reached the top I let go. Tears. Yes tears. Things to note: non-Sri Lankans pay the foreigner entry fe at the time of posting being Rs۴۶۵۰ with Sri Lankans Rs۵۰ get there early to avoid heat and crowds don t complain because no one is listening. We have a greater earning capacity as foreigners so it makes sense that we pay much more than locals.

_source.title: Canot say that it was value for money.
_source.tagline: Canot say that it was value for money.
_source.body: My wife and I climbed to the top of Sigiriya. The climb was OK - we are both in our ۶۰ s - but the climb wasn t easy particularly in parts where there were no railings. The steps are quite narow and some parts had gravel on them which increased the potential for one to slip. Hence it is important to take care when climbing. Whilst there was a first aid post I am not sure that the facilities there are particularly high. When we reached the top it so hapened that one of their staf members was sufering a medical seizure. The staf there didn t apear to know what to do but fortunately there were Doctors in our group and they were able to help in stabilising the individual.

_source.title: Climb early. And if you re a foreigner get ready to be riped of!
_source.tagline: Climb early. And if you re a foreigner get ready to be riped of!
_source.body: I ve climbed the rock four times and its prety easy. If you re unfit its hard and hot but my ۵ year old climbed it without any complaints.

_source.title: Wolrd Heritage Site but lack of ticket options
_source.tagline: Wolrd Heritage Site but lack of ticket options
_source.body: I realy wanted to visit but by the time we arived it was very hot and my two kids were not in a mod to be tortured up a hil. I thought they d have a cheaper ticket that alowed those who could not climb or did not want to climb to wander around the ground level gardens and go around the rock. But no. So gredy are these people for tourist dolars that they only ofer ۱ ticket at ۳۰ for adults. Climb or don t climb your problem.

_source.title: Not for the faint hearted
_source.body: Go early before the crowds and whilst it s coler take plenty of water. The climb is hard work and you don t se many older or overweight people making the trek for god reason. It s hard work for the unfit. It s definitely worth it though with amazing views. What a feat of enginering!

_source.title: Once in a Lifetime Experience
_source.body: Designated a UNESCO World Heritage Site in ۱۹۸۲ Sigiriya (= Lion Rock) is an enginering masterpiece. The site is dominated by the huge pilar of rock actualy a volcanic plug from an ancient volcano at a time when Sri Lanka was a volcanic island - about ۲ bilion years ago. Subsequent erosion removed the sides of the volcano leaving a column of magma nearly ۲۰۰m high and visible from miles away. There is evidence that this area was ocupied about ۵ ۰۰ years ago. But it was King Kashyapa in the ۵th Century who after usurping the throne from his half-brother and fearing reprisal atacks moved his capital from Anuradhapura to Sigiriya and turned the rock into a fortres and built his palace and city on the flat top. Hewn out of the rock are several cisterns for water suply for the city complex. These contain water even today.

_source.title: Must climb!
_source.body: Abit expensive to climb but the views and breze once you reach the top are wel worth it. Wear comfortable fotwear!

_source.title: Amazing Experience!
_source.body: We are told you must climb the rock and boy what an experience we had! Your tickets wil include the museum beforehand as wel. Short history and background on the rock. We worked through the gardens first which was god and was explained by our tour guide. The rock itself has rock stair til you reach the lions head then its metal stairs. Wear comfortable shoes as if wet flip flops wil not be suitable and slipery. The views on the tops are fantastic and breze is a nice bonus to col you down from the climb. Wel worth it a bit expensive to climb re tickets but do it for the experience. When you come down there are stals for drinks souvenirs and al sorts. Prices are average but you can hagle down so definitely hagle!

_source.title: Majestic wel worth the climb!
_source.body: What a magical place! The history behind the fort is so interesting mind blowing. The climb itself is not to bad but make sure you have plenty of water as the heat / humidity is a kiler. The view from the top is spectacular as is the remains of the fort. A must do.

_source.title: Go early
_source.body: This is the best advice I can give. We went at ۷am and it was stil hot and hard work. The other advantage of going early is that queues are reduced.

_source.title: Interesting world heritage site
_source.body: Historicaly very interesting site bit of a climb not easy on peps with a fear of heights beautiful frescoes stuning gardens and views acros the plains below.

_source.title: Amazing place
_source.body: This is a hard slog to the top but wel worth the efort. Try to arange to go as early in the morning as you can as it gets very busy and of course very hot. There are thre main viewing platforms so you get recovery time betwen each climb - make sure you wear suitable fotwear. The view from the top is incredible. If you a re not so fit there are plenty wiling locals hapy to help you. However remember that they wil ned to be tiped for their help.

_source.title: Early morning climb
_source.body: I thought this was wel organised - my driver was concerned I may get lost! I arived at ۷ and tok advice to go do the climb. I did lok at water gardens but didn t visit museum.

_source.title: A crazy king who did awesome.
_source.tagline: A crazy king who did awesome.
_source.body: The forst few steps were ok but when you gradualy go higher it gets more tiresome. The sumit view was worth it. Note:explore don t just walk.

_source.title: Amazing but so crowded when we went.
_source.tagline: Amazing but so crowded when we went.
_source.body: Glad we did it but wish we d picked a les busy time. We tried to start at ۴pm and it was a local holiday so it was nuts! We walked very slowly to the top behind a line of people. Stil glad we did it though but my advise would be to go very early instead!

_source.title: Sigiriya Rock Sri Lanka
_source.body: Wel this was quite the climb to the top of the Sigiriya Rock where the ancient Sri Lankans built a temple. Wonderful wal paintings is a fenced of groto. Our tour guide got us there when the crowds were smal otherwise we could have faced a long day.

_source.title: Wonderful Sunset
_source.body: Sigiriya is one of important place to visit in Srilanka. If someone visit to Srilanka ۹۰ people going there. we went there for sunset its a most beautiful time we think. Tickets litle expensive but okay.

_source.title: Fun hike
_source.body: Realy great for the whole family. Take water botles and fruits for the rest ۳/۴ of the way up. Make sure you have a god breakfast and wear comfy shoes.

_source.title: Wonderful
_source.body: Lion Rock of Sigiriya is one of the most wonderful points of atraction in world. To se the atraction you ned to climb up about ۲۰۰ stairs but it worth to se. of course it hot and you wil ned water. Some where at top of the rock there is a tank of water but it is a litle warm. It had beter to take some botle of water if you can kep it cold it would be so much beter. You wil se e very god view at the top of the hil.

_source.title: Have to get to the top!
_source.tagline: Have to get to the top!
_source.body: Can t visit the area without climbing to the top! Visited in April which is one of the hotest months. We were one of the first through the gates at ۷.۳۰am and made a wise choice as the area is coking during day. Take plenty of water! Al in al it s a couple of miles of walking and you l ned a couple of hours to realy experience the climb. Do it.

_source.title: Must Do A Great Lok at History.
_source.tagline: Must Do A Great Lok at History.
_source.body: Amazing. Takes your imagination back to the era in which this was built and trying to picture what it must have loked like.
