Incredible size with the surounding garden layout and the moat which surounded the palace. The climb is quite manageable if you don t push it. ۱۲۰۰ steps take a breather when you ned it but be realistic if your not fit or have mobility isues it is step it is hot it is narow so don t hurt yourself. Views from the top are delightful and take the time to just sit down take yourself back a few thousand years and imagine the comings and goings of people. Advice: go early before it gets to hot and the tour buses arive and disgorge their visitors. If youa re physicaly up to it you realy must do it.

_source.title: Amazing experience
_source.body: This is realy a special place with amazing views. It s realy busy and obviously gets hot. Go early have god shoes a hat and plenty of water. There are people along he way who wil put their hand out to help you unles you ned it decline as they want money. Stay away from the moneys and dogs and be prepared to tolerate al levels of fitnes. The last part of the climb is the stepest views worth it though.

_source.title: One of the highlight of any trip in Sri Lanka
_source.tagline: One of the highlight of any trip in Sri Lanka
_source.body: A must do without a doubt. We did it very early to avoid the crowds. We were there at ۷am and were first to climb. The sumit ofers spectacular views of the country side that is after you have climbed and I am stil wondering how they managed to anchor these stairwels on the rock.

_source.title: Barely made it half way!
_source.body: We consider ourselves reasonably fit but with a ۲ year old hot weather and a time limit imposed by our driver we were nowhere near making it to the top. The gardens museum and views were god but if you can t make it to the top then it s an expensive trip for ۳۰ each! There were lots of locals ofering to cary our child but not knowing whether he d acept being caried by a stranger put us of. Wel done to everyone that makes it to the top!

_source.title: Great view
_source.body: We had a wondeful climb and just being around a a giant boulder was mind blowing. The climb up is realy not dificult and can even be done using flip flops. Do hire a guide so that you se the significance of things.

_source.title: Memorable
_source.body: As a reasonably fit ۷۰ year old I was up and down with a half an hour at the top in two and a half hours.

_source.title: Fantastic views
_source.body: The climb is worth it to se the fabulous views and also there is oportunity to lok at the rock paintings in the way up. It does get busy so best to go early and take a guide. There are u oficial helpers who may try and take your arm to help you up the steps this is anoying. Take water as no facilities once you begin the climb. Area is kept clean and there are some tourist shops to buy gifts also.

_source.title: Run down infra structures for the price they charge
_source.tagline: Run down infra structures for the price they charge
_source.body: Lions Rock is in itself a breathtaking place.

_source.title: You just have to do it.
_source.tagline: You just have to do it.
_source.body: It s abit of a strenuous thing to do but it was such an amazing view from the top.

_source.title: An astonishing mariage of history and nature!
_source.tagline: An astonishing mariage of history and nature!
_source.body: The first thing I would say is to arive as early as posible. Unfortunately due to transport limitations we comenced our climb up at ۱۱am. This meant that we were walking up stairs in the miday heat which verged on torturous!

_source.title: What a place
_source.body: Absolutely beautiful not a easy climb to the top but worth it. Tok me awhile to reach the top as the heat does not help definitely recomend doing this first thing in the morning as the afternon sun can become unbearable with no shade.

_source.title: Sigiriya Rock
_source.body: It was ۳۴ degres! Over a thousand steps with two young children.

_source.title: A must se - but go early to avoid the crowds
_source.tagline: A must se - but go early to avoid the crowds
_source.body: A must se if touring Sri Lanka - realy interesting site and great wildlife to in the form of monkeys and land monitors! We arived at the entrance at ۸am and I think this would be the latest I would recomend going at. Watch out for the hornet signs a woman in front of us got stung so pay atention to the notices to be silent. Take lots of water. We had a guide as part of our package which was god to get more information but I ve also climbed it many years ago without a guide and its stil a great experience either way.

_source.title: Worth the climb
_source.body: Be prepared for a long climb up the rock that is truly worth it! You don t realy ned a guide to go up the rock just get the ticket and folow the path to the top. stop along the way to admire the view

_source.title: Amazing Place
_source.body: Sigiriya is one of the most amazing places I have ever visited a fortres built on the top of the rock by King Kasyapa (۴۷۷ - ۴۹۵ CE) with decorated sides with colorful frescoes and a gateway in the form of an enormous lion. Sigiriya today is the UNESCO listed World Heritage Site. It is one of the best preserved examples of ancient urban planing.

_source.title: Rewarding Climb
_source.body: We were there queuing early before ۷am. The hike up was not as tiring as we thought it would be but the advantage of doing it at this time of the day is that virtualy the whole trek is done in the shade. Sections are tiring as the sun heats up. You get a litle treat half way as you ascend a set of spiral staircases to view the cave painting which are quite mesmerising.

_source.title: Great View and Amazing
_source.body: My first site visit in Sri Lanka that s a great hike to on top of the rock was quite impresed how they managed to build this on top of this rocks. Very beautiful view from the top of the rocks the garden on the botom is very huge and wel maintained til now.

_source.title: ۱۲۰۰ steps but as many reasons to do it!
_source.tagline: ۱۲۰۰ steps but as many reasons to do it!
_source.body: We climbed it with our two young kids ۴ ۶ and it was totaly worth it. It s not that hard if you take some breaks and have water with you. The views from the top come as a reward for your efort. Go ahead take that climb you l never regret it!

_source.title: Climb the Lion Rock
_source.body: The climb is not real easy for those with any mobility isues but the view from the top is worthy of the efort. The steps are a litle scary but safe even if you are fazed by heights.

_source.title: Worlds ۸th wonder. very creative works.
_source.body: there are lot of steps to climb. but on the way we can sit and relax there are wal paintings and some historical things to se on the way. tickets are litle expensive here its around ۴۸۵۰ in sri lankan rupes.

_source.title: Beautiful views and ruins of palace
_source.tagline: Beautiful views and ruins of palace
_source.body: The hike up to the top requires walking up ۱۲۰۰ steps and its relatively hot but as long as you are able to walk stairs this is worth the time. The views from the sumit are impresive and the ruins of the palace are wel preserved. A tour guide was provided by the company I boked my entire stay in Sri Lanka with. The guide gave some interesting facts about the area but you do get a map that has the information on to.

_source.title: A great long climb for a great Sight
_source.tagline: A great long climb for a great Sight
_source.body: Fascinating history with this UNESCO site. Definitely worth going to if not for the history behind it.

_source.title: Col Experience - But Loads of People
_source.tagline: Col Experience - But Loads of People
_source.body: This experience should be way coler than it is but there s just so many people climbing to the top it s hard to enjoy fuly. I would recomend going first thing in the morning to avoid the crowds - because they get prety brutal as the day goes on.

_source.title: Get ready for long flight of stairs to the top
_source.tagline: Get ready for long flight of stairs to the top
_source.body: I recomend to start the climb as early as posible. The top of the rock have no shelter and it is exhausting to climb during the mid day. Most importantly when I come down at about ۱۱am I se long queue waiting to climb up.

_source.title: World Heritage
_source.body: Amazing castle on sigiriya lion rock with historical stories. Its beter to start your journey earlire. If not you wil fel tired with the hot climate.

_source.title: Great view!
_source.body: We had a wonderful trip and walk up the rock. It takes some efort to reach the top (duno how many stairs but many. You wil make it). The view we enjoyed up there was totaly worth it! Wow that is realy something special. And the whole Story of this rock is so fascinating ans shocking at the same time! Visit this place.

_source.title: Interesting climb
_source.body: Rest asured that there are steps and hand rails over at most parts of the climb. Climb was manageable but wil be beter if we start the journey earlier where there wil be les crowded. Surprising to discover that the hiden paths of the lion rock - was quite "wow"when some areas actualy lok like Manchu Pichu. Overal definitely a plus for the Sri Lanka trip.

_source.title: Experience and History Excelent
_source.body: As other travelers have mentioned start early - ۸.۳۰ am is excelent to arive prior to the tourist buses! Take a private tour if you are able. A lot of the gardens and paintings ned to be explained. Spiral staircase loks dificult - to the paintings - but isn t! Views are incredible. Watch where you are walking and al wil be fine! Take your time and you wil make it to the top!

_source.title: What a view!
_source.body: As a family with tenagers it s sometimes hard to kep everyone hapy (especialy when Mum likes historical temples) so this was a great solution. We arived around ۸am (as per the other reviews.it gets hot and busy so arive early). I have a bad kne so was woried about the climb but wore walking shoes and this certainly helped. You sweat a lot so take lots of water and take your time. Yes it is worth it and yes you wil be hapy you did it. One thing I would not recomend is to take fod up there. We thought breakfast loking at the view would be special but there are dogs on the top who would be hapy to help eat your fod so not what we had in mind. We then went to the lower level and a monkey stole my sons sandwich and others were ken on trying to grab the rest.

_source.title: Chose your time - worth the climb
_source.tagline: Chose your time - worth the climb
_source.body: We were warned it would be beter to get up at the crack of dawn to go on a trip to climb the rock but on our ۳rd day of excursions we decided to wait a bit and got there about ۱۰am on a Friday. so did everyone else though. A sea of schol children swarmed over the paths it semed every schol in Sri Lanka had emptied to visit that same day.

_source.title: Chose your moment - worth the climb
_source.tagline: Chose your moment - worth the climb
_source.body: We were warned it would be beter to get up at the crack of dawn to go on a trip to climb the rock but on our ۳rd day of excursions we decided to wait a bit and got there about ۱۰am on a Friday. so did everyone else though. A sea of schol children swarmed over the paths it semed every schol in Sri Lanka had emptied to visit that same day.

_source.title: Outstanding View
_source.body: Extremely humid when I climbed however the view made up for it. Climb is not as daunting as it apears from the botom and you are able to go at your own pace. Take plenty of water with you. Be aware that you wil come acros monkeys and dogs. Make sure you bring the mozie repelent. Walk up to the start of the climb is just as amazing. Take your time. Round trip climb should take betwen ۱.۵ - ۲ hours. There are some traders at the car park on your exit that wil sel fod drink and souvenirs.

_source.title: Stuning location but get rid of the helpers
_source.tagline: Stuning location but get rid of the helpers
_source.body: A stuning and interesting historical site which was completely spoilt for us by incredibly in your face people forcibly helping you when you don t want it. Repeating the word no countles times had no efect. Having broken my fot last year admitedly I was being careful but I had the very obvious asistance of my partner. Partly because of this harasment I decided fairly early on that the climb was not for me so I decided to sit and wait while my partner completed the climb. I was then folowed until I had no option but to retreat to the haven of the coach that we arived in. My partner did complete the climb and enjoyed the history and the views.

_source.title: Very interesting history before climbing the rock
_source.tagline: Very interesting history before climbing the rock
_source.body: Worth reading about or geting a guide to talk you through the history. Realy enjoyed the garden walk. What a beautiful spot.

_source.title: A lovely family excursion
_source.body: We loved our visit and climb up the thousand plus stairs. Cracking views and interesting history. Kids (۴ ۶- girls) both managed with the asistance of some candy bribes. Stairs are quite step and scary. Completely worth it.

_source.title: Go early and don t skip the gardens lower down
_source.tagline: Go early and don t skip the gardens lower down
_source.body: The Sigiriya damsel paintings and the views from the very top are wel worth the step hike. The walk up is actualy not to bad until the very last part from the lion s paw platform to the sumit. Our four-year-old did it without much help. There are a few viewing areas to stop of at and the steps level out once or twice. However if you have a fear of heights as I do you wil definitely ned to stel yourself for the steps up to the Sigiriya damsels and the final set of stairs. The Sigiriya damsels are reached by a circular metal staircase that stretches up the side of the rock. Once you are there you are on a metal platform juting out from the side of the rock itself؛ it has a short railing wal. The damsel paintings are very wel-preserved and worth the extra climb.

_source.title: A fair hike to some amazing views
_source.tagline: A fair hike to some amazing views
_source.body: Went here as part of a tour.

_source.title: Stuning
_source.body: We went first thing in the morning before breakfast to beat the heat along with the crowds of bus tours. We climbed the rock which was stunin however. The rock itself and the grounds around it are equaly impresive. Along with the stories about the rock. Walking to the top is not esential.

_source.title: Get up early for this one gang!
_source.tagline: Get up early for this one gang!
_source.body: We arived around ۱۰am and it was already packed so I d recomend going for sunrise. This would also be smart because it was so dang hot when we went. There were loads of people but it was stil ok. There were a bunch of schol groups to that held up the walking paths. I m afraid of heights but I managed ok for this. There s a mix of stone stairs and stel stairs. The rock is incredible loaded with history. Worth the hike up. The views from the top are amazing and the top of the rock has a lot of history involved to. Wouldn t recomend geting a guide as they just ad to your costs. There s a museum you can do at the begining which wil tel u everything and there s also gogle where you can research! Fun fact: there s no toilets after the museum so go then and take tisues/toilet paper with you. Take lots of water wear a hat loads of sunscren and wear sunglases. There isn t to much shade up the top and sometimes not much of a breze.

_source.title: Not for the faint hearted. But a fantastic chalenge
_source.tagline: Not for the faint hearted. But a fantastic chalenge
_source.body: Try to get here as early as posible. ۷am would be god. Temperature can get extremely high and if you get here by ۷am you could be out of the heat by ۹.۱۵. There are only ۳ tres on the top for shade. After ۹am lots more people arive. If you want to avoid standing on suspended stel stairways with people in front and behind you go early! If you sufer from heights may not be your cup of tea. Coming down is easier than going up as the down stairs come down a diferent and it fels like an easier route.

_source.title: simply amazing
_source.body: great place to visit but avoid climbing if you are afraid of height because the view during the hike can make you dizy. Wel worth visiting while in Sri Lanka. Best to go in the morning before the crowds!

_source.title: Awesome views and climb ۰ what an amazing place this must have ben
_source.tagline: Awesome views and climb ۰ what an amazing place this must have ben
_source.body: We climb up here in the late afternon - a god choice not to many people as al the buses had left for the day. A bit of a climb for us older citizens but was actualy easier that I expected and although narow it was very wel maintained. The views for the top were amazing - evening is a god time to go. Using one s imagination it is not dificult to imagine what an amazing place this was at the height of the civilisation. We did not have any of the isues mentioned by other reviewers eg being hasled however that may be because of the way we handle it - around the world this is not an unusual experience. Would thoroughly recomend this experience unles you are realy scared of heights but if posible make the climb.

_source.title: Total uter rip-of
_source.body: ۳۰ entrance alows you to walk up hundreds of steps to the top of a rock without any signs. On the way up my spouse was man-handled by ۲ men grabing her uper arms against her repeated protests. In adition you wil be told you canot photograph (even without flash) some wal paintings. My response to this was "for ۳۰ I can enter any major museum in the world and be alowed to take photographs". At the top there are no signs of where to exit.

_source.title: Certainly worth the climb
_source.body: Thankfuly we set of early as it was so hot and humid. It is not an overly dificult climb but in parts has very step steps and it s just the heat that gets you. A fascinating history and the expansive view from the top was wonderful. Wal paintings very complete which was surprising. God there are many levels to take a breather if neded so if you chose not to climb to the top you can wait for your companions. Amazing to think they built this in such a dificult location complete with a swiming pol. God to se so many schol children visiting this incredible place. Hapy to recomend and a must do whilst in Sri Lanka.

_source.title: Worth it if you have few dolars to spare
_source.tagline: Worth it if you have few dolars to spare
_source.body: it is worth it once if you have a few dolars and time to spare. On the road to Sigriya from Dambula lok out on the left for the board saying entrance for foreigners only. It wil take you Entrance cost is USD ۳۰. The climb is very much doable by even a not so fit person. Pick up the site map with numbered landmarks from the information centre near the ticket both and read the numbered plaques at the site؛ you wil not ned a guide. The top is literaly ruins or hardly any ruins left but the view is breathtaking. A great photo oportunity. Be prepared for the heat and queues. To beat both it is beter to do in the early part of the morning. Cary enough water. The museum is like a children s schol project a waste of time. Public conveniences are few and porly maintained.

_source.title: Real historical interest and great viewings
_source.tagline: Real historical interest and great viewings
_source.body: Fascinating place steped in history and an amazing site that just leaves you wondering how on earth they built it and then lived there sucesfuly. We went about ۱۰.۰۰ am and it was a particularly hot (۳۸ degres) and humid day so we were soaked in sweat as it is quite a climb in such heat. Knowing what I now know and if I could have aded an extra day on to the holiday I would have split the transfer from Kandy (۲ and half hours drive) and visiting the site by organising an overnight stay in either Sigiriya or Dambula so that we could have climbed at ۷ am. We did this earlier time for World s End hike and the temperature earlier is a far nicer experience. If like us though you don t have enough days to split the travel and climb go for it the enjoyment outweighs the sweat. One of the more expensive entrances for Sri Lanka but stil only ۴۶۵۰ rupes each (۲۲) and wel worth it.

_source.title: Tiring but worth it
_source.body: Go early morning as it gets very hot and dificult to climb. Not for young children or those with walking dificulty very step steps and loads of them. The views at the top are wel worth it. Simply stuning

_source.title: Stuning views wel worth it
_source.body: Wife ۲ kids ۱۰ ۸ comenced the climb at ۸.۴۰am reached the top at ۹.۱۰am. There were a few people but never in a queue. It was shaded until ۳/۴ of the way up but prety hot. Its not a realy tough climb but you do get a sweat up. Yes it is quite pricey but we knew that before we went and glad we did it. The views are absolutely stuning the history behind it is interesting and just experiencing it was fulfiling. You cant visit Sri Lanka not visit this place. Highly recomended.

_source.title: Worth the climb but very busy
_source.tagline: Worth the climb but very busy
_source.body: This rock features on most of the tourist brochures for Sri Lanka. The climb is not particularly dificult but is very hot and slow because of the numbers wishing to climb. The views are spectacular and worth the climb

_source.title: Climb Pidurangula Rock instead.
_source.body: Climbed this rock after much hesitation after reading blogs and reviews to save the money and climb the rock next to it instead which you can se the view of beautiful Lion Rock from top of.

_source.title: Amazing!
_source.body: The ancient kingdom of Sigiriya is amazing! Its a UNESCO world heritage site and wel worth the visit. Our resort in Habarana organised the trip and recomended we travel in the early morning. It opens at ۷am. We traveled by tuk tuk. Some of the climb is single file and it gets hot so try and beat the tour buses. It is a big chalenge for those of us who are scared of heights and there some unscrupulous locals who target you. We were aproached by a man at lions rock entry (aparently they target anyone not in a tour group with a guide). He flashed a badge saying he was an oficial but we now know it was fake. He wouldn t leave our side even when we reached the top. We gave him a tip equivalent to ۱۰ Australian which he said wasn t enough. He then demanded more money and in Australian curency. I realy don t want to be saying anything negative but people ned to be warned. The problem is that locals rightly pay a token fe to get in making it an easy scam for some. Please don t let this warning put you of going to what is otherwise a magnificent site.

_source.title: Amazing views؛ worth the climb
_source.body: Sigiriya is definitely worth the climb but just make sure you go early! There s only one way up and down for most parts so steps can get very busy؛ we timed it so that it was just starting to fil up - a bit to much for our liking - on our descent. I m scared of heights but was ok for the vast majority of the climb؛ the worst bit is climbing to the highest point at the end due to the gaps in the steps - don t lok down!

_source.title: A god walk with literaly a back drop of history and heritage
_source.tagline: A god walk with literaly a back drop of history and heritage
_source.body: We went on this walk in February. We started the walk at ۳ p.m. The weather was pleasant about ۲۵ celsius but it was overcast. I prefer the word walk rather than a climb to describe this chalenge but of course the walk is elevated. So long as you are not someone short of breadth or very obese it is very doable if you take your time.

_source.title: Majestic experience!
_source.body: Majestic experience! Once in a lifetime chance to experience the Lion Rock and to one of the greatest wonders of Sri Lanka and the World!

_source.title: Unforgetable experience- a must do
_source.body: There is no place in the world like this with its human history going back thousands of years and the sophistication of what they managed to achieve is incredible in comparison to most other societies in the world.

_source.title: A stuning place for a stuning price!
_source.tagline: A stuning place for a stuning price!
_source.body: We almost mised this as we were wary of the area because of the recent problems and we were glad we decided to climb the rock.

_source.title: A litle over priced but worth doing once at least Go early morning to mis the queues!
_source.tagline: A litle over priced but worth doing once at least Go early morning to mis the queues!
_source.body: I ve sen many reviews complaining about the price id say around ۲۰ each isn t to bad but maybe a litle over priced I d say its worth more like ۱۵ as a non-local your going to be paying ۳۰ /۴۶۵۰~ LKR.

_source.title: A litle over priced but worth doing once at least Go early morning to mis the queues!
_source.tagline: A litle over priced but worth doing once at least Go early morning to mis the queues!
_source.body: I ve sen many reviews complaining about the price id say around ۲۰ each isn t to bad but maybe a litle over priced I d say its worth more like ۱۵ as a non-local your going to be paying ۳۰ /۴۶۵۰~ LKR.

_source.title: RIP OF not worth it
_source.body: Locals pay ۵۰c foreigners pay ۴۰AUD. Can understand foreigners paying a litle extra but can t justify such an exorbitant mark up. ۸۰ for two of us to go and se a rock which quite frankly was not worth it. Over crowded touristy and without a guide you have no idea what s going on or what it is you are seing. Our driver told us that a couple of years ago they used to include a map and a CD in the entry price which explained what everything was. Very disapointing. My advice - Skip it and save your money for something more worthwhile. Sri Lanka (as beautiful as it is) is fast turning into a country that charges first world prices for third world service. Wish we had known this before we went up this rock!

_source.title: Great experience!
_source.body: Walked up with our two children (۴ and ۵ yrs). Started ۷.۳۰ in the morning. Bring lots of water! Amazing views and lovely suroundings.

_source.title: God place to se an ancient kingdom.
_source.tagline: God place to se an ancient kingdom.
_source.body: If you plan to travel during March - April bring plenty of water. Because it is very hot during those months. There are two ticket check points. One is at the entrance and the other one just before the Miror wal and Frescoes so make sure you have your ticket with you.

_source.title: Hot climb but worth it for the views
_source.tagline: Hot climb but worth it for the views
_source.body: We had children (۶ ۸) with us and decided to climb in the evening due to jet lag. We set of around ۴pm. It was stil very hot at the botom but had coled down plus there was a bit of a breze by the time we got up. Kids managed fine but are used to doing quite a lot of walking. Would have felt a bit nervous with much younger kids on some of the metal staircases but ours felt big enough. We got down a bit before ۶ but didn t spend ages wandering in the gardens on the way. Bring plenty of water but beware of snacks with lots of monkeys.

_source.title: Not worth the money - try Pidurangala Rock instead
_source.tagline: Not worth the money - try Pidurangala Rock instead
_source.body: Once you have batled through the queues at the ticket ofice (for some reason located in the museum - not so for the locals whose ofice is before this one) you have to part with ۳۰ (adult) ۱۵ (۶-۱۲yrs). This is ridiculous considering Pidurangala Rock (oposite) is only ۴ (and much beter in my opinion - les crowds and you actualy get to se the rock from a distance).

_source.title: Must go early
_source.body: My partner and I climbed the Rock at about ۹.۰۰am and that was to late. You realy want to start as early as posible because the heat is insane. There were a lot of people as we were going up so we did have to stop a lot. It is quite expensive at ۵۰usd but the view from the top did make it worthwhile.

_source.title: cultural experience
_source.body: Came here with my husband. To be honest I hate heights so be prepared for a large amount of walking uphil on an edge of the rocks.

_source.title: Fantastic
_source.body: A must se. Incredible part of Sri Lanka. Early morning is the best time to visit before the mid day sun. Expect a bit of waiting at various stages due to the volume of visitors.

_source.title: Spectacular views
_source.body: This is a worth the pain and strain of the climb up hundreds of steps. Take plenty of water and wear god shoes.

_source.title: Crowning jewel of Sri Lanka
_source.body: This is the best atraction in Sri Lanka acording to me. Best stay in the Dambula City and take the bus to Sigiriya. Easily acesible. Amazing view and one of the best ruins I ve sen. It can get hot during the afternons so best do it in morning. Also helps beat the ever-growing crowd. If you re from a SARC nation then you get a ۵۰ discount on the entry ticket. So please cary your pasport.

_source.title: Expensive and hearbreaking
_source.body: The entry fe is way more than we expected and with nearly ۴۰۰ Rupes the highest we had paid so far.

_source.title: The Palace of the God King -A must visit to se the paintings
_source.tagline: The Palace of the God King -A must visit to se the paintings
_source.body: A group of us visited Sigiriya The site of the Palace of God King who created this rock citadel and painted his damsels on the rock surface that was the highlight for many scripts on the miror wal.Started the climb son after breakfast to avoid tourist trafic and the sun.The sunset would be the best time for great photos and sun rise from Pidurangala. the unesco site charges a fair price as an entrance fe.The working fountains become spectacular during the rainy season but the climb becomes chalenging.To explore the kingdom it takes many hours.To climb and comdown thre hours is ample for the not so fit.There are lots of caves entrances gardens to se before you enter the Lion paw stair case to se the Frescoes and read the miror wal scripts.The climb to the top can be a chalenge but worth al the efort.to se the spectacular scenery.

_source.title: Por dogs
_source.body: Our trip was ruined by the state we found two adult dogs and ۵ pupies in at the top.

_source.title: Worth the efort but pricey
_source.body: We went here late morning which was probably to late for the heat of the day. It was a tough walk up the steps but worthwhile to se the views and reflect on how this could have ben built so long ago on such a grand scale. Interesting grounds and gardens to. Not cheap to get in but this sems to be aproach of government to make money from tourists.

_source.title: Expensive and crowded.
_source.body: Expensive and crowded but worth the trouble. Once you are on top it is truly fascinating. Can t understand why the kings quit using it as a castle retreat and let it go to sed.

_source.title: We loved the view must go!
_source.tagline: We loved the view must go!
_source.body: The garden around is great the rock is huge and everyone must go and make a trip there. It is quite expensive atraction in Sri Lanka I would say but not that expensive for what you se and experienced. I loved it.

_source.title: To avoid in mid day
_source.body: Yes it s the most visited atraction in SL. Yes it s worth a visit. However if you have no other choice then geting there in the midle of the day be prepared to sweat your life of and wait in line for several minutes in some corner.

_source.title: Worth expensive visiting
_source.body: Entrance cost USD۳۰ but view is nice and worth. Beter go early morning or later afternon before ۷pm closure otherwise to crowded especialy under hot sun

_source.title: God Climb in Trafic!
_source.body: First clas location and interesting thing to do. God climb but very busy and ful of slower moving people. Worth the efort to se one of Sri Lanka s major cultural sites. You must do it.

_source.title: Stil a great rock
_source.body: The site is realy a site where is almost nothing left but the wal foting but the rock is stil a great rock.

_source.title: Great view persistent "guides"
_source.body: Amazing view from the top. The walk/climb not as bad as I thought except for the last part which is not for the faint hearted. Very persistent tour guides - our chaufeur warned us about them and glad he did.

_source.title: The view is worth the climb
_source.tagline: The view is worth the climb
_source.body: This is one of my favourite climbs we did! Would definitly recomend doing this earlier in the morning. We started the climb about ۸:۳۰ and was at the top by ۹:۳۰. There is no shade so you wil fel the ful heat of the sun which is why it s not great to do this early afternon. It is not a particular hard climb there is just lots of stairs to go up so just take your time. The view from the top is amazing. There is also a litle museum on site which is included in your entry fe. Don t mis this as is has amazing photos of the rock over the years.

_source.title: The view is worth the climb
_source.tagline: The view is worth the climb
_source.body: This is one of my favourite climbs we did! Would definitly recomend doing this earlier in the morning. We started the climb about ۸:۳۰ and was at the top by ۹:۳۰. There is no shade so you wil fel the ful heat of the sun which is why it s not great to do this early afternon. It is not a particular hard climb there is just lots of stairs to go up so just take your time. The view from the top is amazing. There is also a litle museum on site which is included in your entry fe. Don t mis this as is has amazing photos of the rock over the years.

_source.title: Amazing place but expensive for Sri Lanka
_source.tagline: Amazing place but expensive for Sri Lanka
_source.body: A step climb up ۱۲۰۰ steps in the heat but great views from the top. ۳۰ each to enter which is a lot for Sri Lanka but woth it unles on the tightest of budgets.

_source.title: Wel worth the efort
_source.body: Sigiriya rock can be sen for miles but the beauty of the gardens and the exquisite archetecture warant a visit. You ned about ۲ - ۳ hours to do this site justice and a guide is invaluable in describing the various artefacts. Although quite a climb to the top this can be done in stages and the paths / steps are god. Once the top is reached the ful extent of the citadel is evident and the views are fantastic. The lion fet at the base of the final climb are wel preserved and the paintings in the rock are stil impresive. Sunglases hat and water are esential equipment.

_source.title: Highlight of Tour
_source.body: Go early morning to beat the crowds and the heat. Lots of steps but there are places to take a rest. Enjoy fabulous views from the top and marvel at the skils neded to build this fortres. Very impresed with the wal paintings.

_source.title: A simple climb and breathtaking views (made beter by the monkeys)
_source.tagline: A simple climb and breathtaking views (made beter by the monkeys)
_source.body: The museum and rock are wel worth a visit. This ancient site is home to some interesting history and a god story to tel. The climb is simple and easy to folow (۱۶۰۰ steps - ۶۶۰ft). We saw al ages completing it. Best time is early morning it gets very busy around ۱۰-۱۱ o clock. It think the photos I ve taken speak for themselves. The monkeys were my highlight!

_source.title: Tiring but so worth it!
_source.body: We ventured up the rock at ۳.۳۰pm yesterday afternon. I wil admit I tok a litle bit of coaxing as we d ben sat in a car for ۴ hours. I was woried that we wouldn t have enough time to explore and make it up the rock before dark.

_source.title: A tough climb but a great experience
_source.tagline: A tough climb but a great experience
_source.body: We visited Sigiriya Lion Rock as part of our ۷ day tour and its a very impresive World Heritage Site. We had a guide to take us to the top and back who had done the climb thousands of times and was very knowledgeable. There are beautiful views both leading up to the rock the climb and from the top. There are ۱۲۰۲ steps to the very top and some are quite step so you might strugle if you have any mobility problems. There is also a spiral staircase against the rock face about half way up which you can climb to se the wal paintings or you can bypas it if you re afraid of heights. We started fairly early before it got to busy and to hot! Make sure you take plenty of water to kep you going. On the way down you might come acros a snake charmer which you can take pictures of if you give him some money you can also have a python around your neck for a fe.

_source.title: A hard climb but worth it!
_source.tagline: A hard climb but worth it!
_source.body: It was luckily a coler day when we climbed and it was stil a hot and hard climb. The views from the top are stuning so wel worth the climb. You do ned to be steady on your fet and reasonably fit. Museum is interesting and grounds prety.Go early if you can to avoid crowds.

_source.title: Loved this hike and the amazing view!
_source.tagline: Loved this hike and the amazing view!
_source.body: I did this a couple of days ago and ۱۰۰ recomend everyone to do it as long as you are physicaly able!

_source.title: It s al about the view
_source.tagline: It s al about the view
_source.body: The first visit we did! It was awesome! Very exciting climb not to dificult but you might wana take it slow if you are not used to. The view is breathtaking

_source.title: Tired legs
_source.body: One of the stops on the tour of Sri Lanka very prety as you walk up to rock and very impresive it is a very hard walk with lots of steps and loads of people but the views are worth it as it was included in our tour l did not realise how expensive it was to get in

_source.title: Stuning view from the top but very crowded
_source.tagline: Stuning view from the top but very crowded
_source.body: Went with our guide in the lower parts and he told us the background and history. The climb we did ourself we arived quite early around ۹AM and already a lot of people in area. When aproaching the rock there where some local guides asking if we neded a guide we said no and loked bored so they lost interest in us it worked and the the climb started. Finaly at the top the view was realy spectacular realy worth it.

_source.title: Nice to walk
_source.body: This is an ۱۸۲ meter high mountain as King Kasyapa built a castle on. This is a great trip ۱۲۰۰ steps. Bring along some water it s hot and you ned some to col down. The tickets are a litle expensive buts worth it. My grandson is five year old and he walked up al by himself. Let the children chose the tempo. A lovely view on the top.

_source.title: Dificult to get up to the top
_source.tagline: Dificult to get up to the top
_source.body: My husband managed to climb up most of the way but was defeated by dozens of schol children charging down. I was detered by the climb itself and the hundreds of tourists pushing upwards. Aparently there were nice paintings of heavenly maidens and the rock itself was impresive but somewhat crumbly. I don t think I mised that much as I saw the rock from the road anyway!

_source.title: Bit of Rock climbing؛)
_source.body: This is wel worth the visit if you have a residency visa for Lanka make sure you take your pasport as your pay local fes visitors from overseas pay substantialy more. Take a guide as there is a considerable amount of information that you wil mis if you do not take one. The climb is not realy chalenging however might not be a god idea to do it with bad knes as there are a lot of steps involved. Scenery is truly amazing and in its day this place would have ben a serious bachelor pad!

_source.title: Disapointed with the local disturbing travelers
_source.tagline: Disapointed with the local disturbing travelers
_source.body: Lion Rock is a god place to visit for a few hours. easy hike up the top. What is anoying is the local kept bothering us that they want to help us up the hike and ask for money. We told them we don t ned help but they kept folowing us and try to hold our warms etc. When my husband told them to leave us alone they started to swearing at us. was quite anoying and scary. This realy ruin our experience with this place

_source.title: Great view worth the climb
_source.body: Amazing view from this site incredible to think how they built structures around this rock. Had a great guide who told us the story of this heritage site so much to learn. Not the easiest to do especialy if you sufer from heights/vertigo definitely worth visiting climbing the ۱۲۰۰ steps.

_source.title: Out of puf but what a view.
_source.tagline: Out of puf but what a view.
_source.body: The walk up to the top is an ordeal but one worth making. Although we climbed during a rain storm al the way to the top it was stil worth the efort. Not just the view when you get to the top but the diferent views you get as you ascend this fantastic monument. Very od seing a sign teling you to "Be Quiet" because of a hornets nest on a near by tre.Ignore al those at the botom ofering to help you climb as they expect a nice bung for the efort and you do not ned them. Try to get information about the history of the rock because it is fascinating.Toilets in the ticket ofice are a disgrace but would recomend the efort involved geting to the top.

_source.title: worth it!
_source.body: wel. you have to clime ۱۲۰۰ steps before you take the way of return. its not easy but its not extrimly dificult. You have to do it. The girls of sigirija and the view from the top of the rock worth it.

_source.title: A Long Way To The Top!
_source.tagline: A Long Way To The Top!
_source.body: Loved my visit to the rock early in the morning. Try and get there before ۷am for the climb to beat the crowds and the heat. It is quite spectacular however the climb is not for the faint-hearted. It is a beautiful seting for the ۵th century king and his ۵۰۰ concubines with wel-established water gardens if you are reluctant to make the climb to the top. You may wish to go as far as the Wal of Mirors. The climb is wel worth the efort. One of the highlights of my visit to Sri Lanka.

_source.title: Worth the money!
_source.body: Fantastic views! This consists of ALOT of steps and isn t for the faint hearted. It costs ۳۰USD and totaly worth it- however I would strongly advise doing Pidurangala (۵۰۰ r/s) as you get a great view of the rock itself!

_source.title: Expensive but unique
_source.body: Go early to beat the crowds. Lots of stairs with lots of people but worth it. The museum was so so.

_source.title: Very busy so be prepared
_source.body: Entry is not cheap at ۴۶۵۰ rupes per person. As you would expect from a UNESCO World Heritage Site it is wel-loked after and wel-stafed. There is a smal museum near the entrance which is probably worth a short visit. There are also "foreigners-only" toilets in this part of the complex which were just about ok and no more. The gardens at the fot of the rock are quite peaceful and ofer god photo oportunities. The one-way route up to the sumit takes you first to the frescoes and from there up a series of metal stairs to the top. Due to the number of visitors you are only ever walking as fast as the people in front which can be a litle frustrating. At the top you can wander around the ruins at leisure and enjoy the views of the surounding countryside (for a more relaxing/les crowded experience of the same views Pidurangala is a much cheaper and beter option). A few information boards around the site would be helpful. We went up and down including visiting the museum in about ۲.۵ hours.

_source.title: The high spot of a trip to the area
_source.tagline: The high spot of a trip to the area
_source.body: Best visited in the early morning this is a climb worth making. The first part is the most strenuous up a number of flights of narow steps. The frescos are reached by an enclosed iron spiral staircase with a separate one to come down. The miror wal leads to a terace and from there the Lion Gate and an exterior iron staircase lead to the top. For me this was the easiest part of the climb. Views from the top are stuning and the swiming pol is particularly impresive. The route down is a mainly separate one and can be taken at a leisurely pace.

_source.title: The high spot of any trip to this area
_source.tagline: The high spot of any trip to this area
_source.body: Stuning views great historical interest and a sense of achievement sum up a visit to Sigiriya! I would completely agre with other reviewers that early morning is the best time to visit. The gardens are impresive but the rock itself is far more so imagining what it would have loked like in ۴-۵AD. The first part of the climb is up step narow steps.

_source.title: Beautiful
_source.body: While we did not make it to the top the whole area and grandeur of the area has to be taken in and apreciated. While I was wiling to try the climb other members of our group were not able to do so - age is one factor and the heat another. We walked around the grounds and viewed what we could.

_source.title: vacation in srilanka
_source.body: We had a wonderful trip to various places in srilanka like.sigiriya Kendy Nuwara eliya Habarana Waskaduwa Colombo etc.we are realy thankful to Mr Shanil who aranged our trip in very short duration of time with god luxury vehicle and wonderful driver cum guide Mr Ruchira.srilanka is beautiful country with many god places for sightseing and adventure sport s.

_source.title: What a great view
_source.body: Can t be in this area without this experience. Walked up in the morning tok us ۲۵ minutes with a baby on the back. You should definitely do this early morning as there are les tourists and the sun is not so hot. Great view.

_source.title: Ok to vist one time
_source.body: Not so worthy to spend ۳۰ wel maintained but views are just if you climb on any mountain did not like the site

_source.title: Worth the trek up
_source.body: The views from the top are amazing and give a ۳۶۰ view of the suroundings.

_source.title: Busy but worth it
_source.body: We climbed this as part of our tour of Sri Lanka. We had our own guide for the tour who pointed the problems with local men trying to apoint themselves as guides or reaching out pretending to help trying to instigate a touch so that can try to extract money. A firm no did the job as instructed. Why they let them there given you have gone through a checkpoint is not clear.

_source.title: Must se
_source.body: It felt like something out of the Jungle bok. Was a great experience. Go wearing proper hiking shoes and take plenty of water

_source.title: Magnificent
_source.body: Its realy hard to climb with those smal fot steps stairs but its realy worth when u reach the top of it. Breathtaking view

_source.title: Great experience
_source.body: Great experience - also for kids aged ۷ and ۱۰. Great view and safe stairways. Wonderful view over the area

_source.title: Historical
_source.body: We had visit the Sigiriya Rock. Its a amazing place to visit. Tickets litle expensive. taking a side guide is god. because we can have god education. the water garden we canot think how they build in ۴-۵th century. Highly Recomend this.

_source.title: A must in Sri Lanka
_source.body: If you re there you must go - for the history for the beauty and uniquenes of the rock itself and for the sense of achievement. My advice - go when there is almost nobody there. We skiped the morning and the evening hike. We decided to go at ۲pm - no queues at the ticket ofice. ANd yes it was hot but I believe it is so much hoter when you walk one step per minute (exageration) and expose yourself to the sun much longer. We walked the pace we felt comfortable with. There was almost nobody at the top. It was perfect and I d definitely do that again:) Admision fe is ۳۰ usd

_source.title: Serene. but not for multiple visits
_source.tagline: Serene. but not for multiple visits
_source.body: Few things to kep in mind when you plan to visit this heritage site.

_source.title: Amazing View from the top
_source.body: After climbing Bhutan s Tiger Nest this should be a piece of cake. But we were wrong it does have its own chalenges that we ned to deal with.

_source.title: The only way is Up
_source.body: After climbing Bhutan s Tiger Nest this should be a piece of cake. But we were wrong it does have its own chalenges that we ned to deal with.

_source.title: Stuning piece of history!
_source.body: Lion Rock is the home of an ancient palace surounded by visualy-stimulating gardens and rock formations. The climb takes about ۳۰min-۱hr depending on your health. I recomend going with a guide as he brings the place to life with stories facts and pasion. Absolutely stuning views up top! A must-se if in Sri Lanka.

_source.title: An interesting site - even without going to the top
_source.tagline: An interesting site - even without going to the top
_source.body: We didn t like the idea of al the steps to the top and wondered if it was worth going without going up there. It was! The gardens are lovely and have plenty of ruins to explore and there s a great view of the huge rock itself. You can only se the frescoes by going up al the steps - but we decided the frescoes at Dambula caves made up for not seing the Sigiriya ones (and were easier to get to!).

_source.title: Wel Worth Visiting!
_source.body: We arived at the site at ۰۹۰۰ and it was already very busy. Most people sem to visit the site betwen ۰۸۰۰-۱۰۰. The hike to the top is via steps and these get narower as you climb including a spiral staircase at one point. The width of the steps means that for the most part you are in single file and moving at the pace of the slowest person. When climbing up in the morning you are in the shade but take plenty of water. The view from the top is wel worth the climb!

_source.title: Beautiful Sigiriya
_source.body: Beautiful vilage didn t climb the lions rock but admired it from below. Saw a wild elephant bathing in the river a memory that wil stay with me forever.

_source.title: Simply Stuning
_source.body: It s a long climb but the wonderful paintings on the way interesting ruins and views from the top make it al worth it.

_source.title: A Wonderful Area
_source.body: Not only is the Rock an amazing climb the surounding landscaped gardens are lovely. Even if you are unable to do the climb it is worth a wander around the acres below.

_source.title: Phenomenal!
_source.body: One of the most beautiful places I have ever visited! The museum was fantastic the cave paintings were breathtaking and so was the view! So much history and beauty here. I don t want to give away to much you must se it for yourself. Would hapily recomend this place to anyone.

_source.title: Capital Highlight of Sri Lanka
_source.body: This is a world famours site seing to make a life visit to the great archaeological value of king Kasyapa giving it s view to make a remarkeble site to give it s nature to the fortres itself.

_source.title: wel worth the ۱۲۰۰ steps to the top
_source.tagline: wel worth the ۱۲۰۰ steps to the top
_source.body: We would advise to start very early in the morning. We arived at the site at ۷.۳۰ am to avoid the heat and it tok us nearly an hour to climb but we tok it easy. We did not return down until near ۱۰ am to discover that there was now a huge queue of people waiting to ascend the steps. We were so glad to have gone early as it would have taken twice as long to get up. It is a tough enough climb so not to be done in the heat of the day. Also wear very light clothes.

_source.title: Best World Heritage Site In Sri Lanka
_source.tagline: Best World Heritage Site In Sri Lanka
_source.body: This was my first World heritage site in traveling life and It was amazing experience i never get. As my opinion this site can visit anyone but disables and to old peoples dificult to climb up the rock but they can visit museum which is in ground flor and get idea about the site. Since my first traveling to today the site has no any changes of historical value. Someone fel the ticket price is to high but compare with other countries sites prices are same but the value of site more than the ticket price. You can visit this place over ۲ hours and many variety of ancient creations (Frescoes Moet King palace cobra hod cave miror wal and lion paws etc.) can se. The special thing is great view sumit of the rock. Most of peoples loving to experience sun set view at top of the rock when you in top another special thing is you wil se many sites around the Sigiriya Rock Fortres. At first seing if you fel this site is not worthy to visit after geting the experience you wil be satisfy.

_source.title: A rock in the midle of a forest
_source.tagline: A rock in the midle of a forest
_source.body: A beautiful to visit the old kingdom fortres. It is definitely worth the anxuious climb to the top. Only way to the top is via their scafold build pathway. That is why the king used to live there.

_source.title: Hot but fun day
_source.body: I recomend going early in the morning because there wil be lots of people and very crowded. The views were amazing and the top had many dogs and pupies that were super kind and fun to pet.

_source.title: The view is nice
_source.body: The view is nice and the ruins also but everything gets shadowed by the steps you have to climb. Mainly there are some concrete steps that are realy nice and the ones that are in the shadows of the tres are usualy visited by the monkeys. But at some points the stone/concrete steps are not there anymore and you have to use some metal stairs that don t inspire to much stability (these are found mainly after the lion paws)

_source.title: A must-do when visiting Sri Lanka!
_source.tagline: A must-do when visiting Sri Lanka!
_source.body: This iconic rock is a must do for al travelers in Sri Lanka. Aim to start early morning to beat the crowds and the heat. There are steps to the top so it is manageable and safe. Beautiful views of the rock at the begining and more beautiful views from the top.

_source.title: Tough climb.
_source.body: Tough climb. way to far. but the more you go up the more you wil fel the excitement. nice concept of puting stairs alongside the rock. To crowdy though and to hot as wel. But a must visit heritage place.

_source.title: A must se for wide views.
_source.tagline: A must se for wide views.
_source.body: The rock towers above the landscape and so geting to the top provides a great view. You buy the tickets at the ticket ofice and then have to walk to the entrance and then show the ticket to the both there. I originaly went to the entrance thinking I could buy a ticket there only to be directed back not much of an isue just something to be aware of. The garden grounds are nice enough and when I was there a couple were having their weding photographs being taken. First there are some steps steps then some winding metal steps to the frescoes. Once you have sen the frescoes (not many there) you then descend winding metal steps paralel to the ones you ascended which makes it lok like the people coming down have already ben to the top but they haven t realy you literaly just go up the steps and come down. There has ben some controversy in the past here because there is actualy a hornets nest somewhere near here and in the past people have actualy ben severely stung. There are warnings on show. Then there is the walk along the miror wal and then more step steps to the lions paw. Here you can take a breather as in front of you you se the final set of steps that wil give you that sense of vertigo. If you are afraid of heights this is the part that you wil ned to stel yourself for. Along the way up the final set of stairs you may come acros locals who wil help you and once at the top wil try to stay with you throughout and act as a guide though of course wil expect payment. If you ned help then use this service though just be wary of how much you give you may think you are being nice by giving more but al that does is inflate their expectation for minimal service. I would not advise geting help from one of these people if you think you wil ned help or want a guide then organise that yourself before ascending. Some of the stairs make clanging sounds but for the most part are sturdy and there rails al the way up. At the top the view is great and there is quite a bit to se. The descent is easy. I think it is definitely worth visiting for the great views.

_source.title: Roundtrip
_source.body: Very nice must se. Walking above from The fot of the Mountain to top great Overview of the area. Great hike

_source.title: absolutely amazing
_source.body: I d score this higher if it were acesible to al. It s a masive climb (۱۰۰+ steps) and worth it for those who can manage it. those who can t have some pleasant gardens in which to sit and wait

_source.title: A nice visit.
_source.body: A nice place to visit lovely views.Very expensive entrance by sri lanka standards though almost ۵۰۰ rupes.

_source.title: Lack of signage and felt kinda ripof
_source.tagline: Lack of signage and felt kinda ripof
_source.body: Sigiriya is a popular significant tourist atraction in Sri Lanka it is an UNESCO World Heritage site. However it lacks proper signage information around the site.

_source.title: One of the gentest thing to visit in Sri Lanka
_source.tagline: One of the gentest thing to visit in Sri Lanka
_source.body: It is a marvelous View from the top and not to hot up there. Quite East to climb as there are god steps al the way. Can be smart to Go up there before it get to hot during the day.

_source.title: Amazing morning at Lion Rock
_source.body: Pros: great views wel maintained and an enjoyable climb. Cons: stairs get step so be cautious if you re nervous with heights.

_source.title: Not an easy climb but a great view at the top.
_source.tagline: Not an easy climb but a great view at the top.
_source.body: If you climb Lion Rock wear god shoes and be prepared for aching legs the next day. I wouldn t try it in rain as the stairs would be very slipy. We set of at ۶am as it s to hot later in the day. It s a long haul to the top but the reward is a fabulous view of the surounding jungle.

_source.title: Part of the Sigiriya Heritage Site
_source.tagline: Part of the Sigiriya Heritage Site
_source.body: Even if you do not climb to the top (what is highly recomended please make an efort it is worth doing it) the whole site is very nice. Paintings in the cave near the top are very beautiful (no photos alowed). Old town is beautiful make sure you walk al around once you reach the top.

_source.title: Probably the most important Heritage site in SL
_source.tagline: Probably the most important Heritage site in SL
_source.body: Absolutely fantastic. I love history and heritage places and this one rates very high on my worldwide list. It is prety huge complex and the main atraction is right on the top of the Sigiriya Rock so kep on climbing these ۱۲۰۰ steps. Beautiful views from many points and a ruins on the top are also impresive. Top atraction. Try to come as early as posible to beat the heat and the crowd.

_source.title: ۱۲۰۰ steps but worth it
_source.body: This is a must do visit. I have a prosthesis below my left kne but stil managed to do it. Be wary of the men who are waiting at the steps from ground level to the lions paws entrance. They say they are working there but in reality wil expect tip from you of c.۱۰۰ rupes for asistance on the way up and down. If you ned asistance then you should be open about it and agre a fe beforehand to avoid a misunderstanding later.

_source.title: Beautiful view from the top
_source.body: Ticket counter opens at ۷ am. Go early morning or late afternon. Entry ticket for foreign tourist is ۳۰. For SARC country citizens ۵۰ discount for that u ned to present original pasport (they DO NOT acept photocopy)

_source.title: ۲۰۱۲ steps of pain - for a great view!
_source.tagline: ۲۰۱۲ steps of pain - for a great view!
_source.body: OK this is a real trek and it is not for the faint hearted. It is along slog to the top and it tok me (a semi fit ۶۸ year old ۹۰ minutes to get to the top). Steps are relatively even and ther is a way up and way down sections when things get tight. There are also lots of "rest platforms" on the way up. Half way up at the " miror wal" level you can take a spiral staircase up to se a cave with realy nice original paintings (worth the slight ۴۰ step deviation) At the lions platform you climb thru the remains of a lion (its paws are stil there but the head is long gone) and start the last of the climb - ۳۰۰ steps up to the top. There you se the remains if the the uper palace. The views are stuning from the top - if it is not misty! There is a separate set of stairs for the way down (in places). Note of caution- this site gets very very busy so go early to avoid the crowds. Be there for opening time - trust me when realy we were coming down the crowds were awful and as such you get stuck behind the slowest person. We had no problems as we went early and were on the way down before the crowds hit!

_source.title: Worth the efort to get here.
_source.tagline: Worth the efort to get here.
_source.body: Apart from the rock itself there is quite a lot of other things to se in this site. After you enter there is the moat water gardens fountain gardens (part of both have ben left unexcavated for future generations). Then you come to the boulder gardens and the terace gardens. After that you start the " big climb" up the rock! Most folks just head of up the rock but it is worth spending some time seing the other parts of the site. You pay for it so you should do it.

_source.title: Fantastic history and great views
_source.body: Started the walk up the rock early which is recomended due to the heat during miday. The water gardens are very interesting when you realise there ancient age. The Lion Rock is a great walk with visits to the painted caves and the miror wal. At the top the ruins of the palace id beautifuly set out with great views acros the surounding land.

_source.title: Amazing
_source.body: This was a realy god morning climbing the rock just take your time because of the heat watch out for people trying to help you up the steps they just want your money.

_source.title: Stuning - a "must do" despite al the steps
_source.tagline: Stuning - a "must do" despite al the steps
_source.body: Do not be put of by the steps. It is quite a way up but everyone takes their time.

_source.title: Amazing views from the top
_source.body: I was a litle aprehensive about climbing up to the top but it was nowhere near as dificult as I thought. The ۲nd section from the fet up is slow due to the number of people going up so there is no rush. The views are great over the ponds and water-gardens. We went up at about ۴pm when it is geting coler. Other people in the group had wanted why we didn t go up at first opening (۷am) but the queues are great and realy busy then.

_source.title: I MADE IT TO THE TOP🎊
_source.tagline: I MADE IT TO THE TOP🎊
_source.body: I MADE IT TO THE TOP

_source.title: Amazing!
_source.body: We made the Tour for the rock behind the lion rock. It costs just ۱۰ of the lion rock and you have a beter view. If you climb there before ۶ am you can se the sunrise. A must se thing!

_source.title: In fairnes could not climb the rock
_source.tagline: In fairnes could not climb the rock
_source.body: Went here as part of our tour around SL. I should have done more research as there are ۱۲۰۰ steps of varying heights to get to the top and being fairly high above sea level not a place for an asthmatic or unfit person to visit.

_source.title: Fascinating history
_source.body: We spent a couple of interesting hours visiting the rock. It was a step climb to the top but there were many much older than us completing the climb. Would recomend visiting with a guide to understand the history of the place. Fascinating to imagine how it was built and functioned.

_source.title: An absolute must for any Sri Lanka trip
_source.tagline: An absolute must for any Sri Lanka trip
_source.body: This is a tough climb to the very top ۱۲۰۲ steps but completely worth it. Make sure that you start early around ۷.۳۰ if posible to mis the heat of mid-day and also the crowds that son build up. I had a driver/guide who was very knowledgeable and pointed out al sorts of things that I might otherwise have mised. The views from the sumit are of course stuning.

_source.title: Spectacular
_source.body: Not to be mised the views from the top are wonderful. Go as early as you can in the morning to climb the rock as it s HOT! Then wander round the gardens when you come back down there are shady spots. It s a bit hard going but take your time and the vast majority of people wil make it up. You must take plenty of sunscren water and sun hat. People don t stick around at the very top once the sun comes out so there is a queue to get back down. A guide isn t necesary we managed just fine without and didn t fel like we mised out. The museum is worth taking a lok. Plenty of tuk tuks are around for when you want to leave. We spent about ۳ hours at the site.

_source.title: More than just a rock
_source.body: Sigiriya is a beautiful site but expensive. The ticket is ۳۰ and we paid ۲۵ for a guide. The guide was helpful in giving historical context and pointing out architectural features. If you don t want to pay a guide I sugest doing some reading prior to your visit. The walk up is not easy and not rexcomended do those out of shape. It s a definite must se.

_source.title: Nice to se but very expensive beter visit the other rock
_source.tagline: Nice to se but very expensive beter visit the other rock
_source.body: it is easy to climb and nice to se the fet of the Lyons. The view is Spectaculair but the same view is on the other rock and much cheaper To be honost not seo very interesting

_source.title: Impresive Site - just to much comercialised crowded and with a cash cow atitude
_source.tagline: Impresive Site - just to much comercialised crowded and with a cash cow atitude
_source.body: The entire area around the Lion Rock is included in a big money making machine which ensures that foreign tourists wil pay a lot of money (by local standards) to be alowed onto the premises where they wil have to folow the strict rules of the National Cultural Fund that manages this and other Sites. The friendlines that you find in many places around Sri Lanka does not exist here - visistors are not kindly received we felt like being part of a herd and we were even exposed to quite agresive salespeople along the ways inside the Heritage Site (sic).

_source.title: Overpriced overegulated extremely comercial (even inside) and overcrowded
_source.tagline: Overpriced overegulated extremely comercial (even inside) and overcrowded
_source.body: They hype around this place has not done anything god to it: The National CF charges foreign tourists a multiple of local tickets - which can be okay - but they treat visitors like catle do not ofer service or suport during the visit but instead impose rules and regulations including rude staf behaviour. There is no dosage for how many people get on to the stairs so that dangerous (and/or anoying) congestions starts as early as ۹ a.m. The authorities also alow people on the premises to (quite actively) ofer souvenirs there.

_source.title: A must do when in Sri Lanka
_source.tagline: A must do when in Sri Lanka
_source.body: Once at the top you get an incredible view of the countryside around the rock. It s a masive complex where you can spend a whole day at! Beautiful place would go there again!

_source.title: Must-se atraction
_source.body: It was god that the weather was on my side.It wil be much beter if you can ask your driver or guide to come with you because many of the guides wont climb up with you.I was lucky that liyo from leopard island tours came with me explaining everything.The top view was breath taking

_source.title: Worth the queue
_source.body: Sigiriya is one of the most fascinating places I have visited.

_source.title: what an amazing site!
_source.body: We visited Sigiriya. an amazing natural site. We climbed the step surface.not for the faint hearted but quite exhilarating. Stuning views from the top.

_source.title: great view but more amazing drawings
_source.tagline: great view but more amazing drawings
_source.body: great view but more amazing drawings. You have to be there at ۷Am in order to fuly enjoy your visit. Don t mis the drawings they are fantastic.

_source.title: AWESOME GREN VIEWS
_source.body: If you are interested in seing some historical sites you should go here. The view from the top is beautiful. Kind of a tough climb up to the top try and go early mornings or late evenings. It can get prety hot humid. The guides can be a pain though.

_source.title: Wow
_source.body: This place is something else expensive at ۴ ۵۰۰ rps but wel worth it. The avenue leading up to the Rock and the grounds are stuning and set the scene wel for what is to come. A tough climb on a hot day but the views are simply breath taking. You climb some round stairs but don t be foled this is just a viewing ledge to se the rock paintings and then you descend to start your climb again. You can stop along the way if neds be and once you reach the first sumit there is plenty of rom to rest in the shade. You can the take some photos by the lions fet before the final push to reach the sumit which is much easier than the first level. Once at the top the views are amazing and you can take time stroling around the ruins before the climb down. A litle tough on the legs but much much easier than the way up. The highlight of our trip so far!

_source.title: A must se
_source.body: A wel maintained site that is a must-se if you are in this area. There is a walk-in from the car park and the stairs to the top of the rock aid ascent but those uncomfortable with heights may wish to consider if this is for them. Many of the guides didn t climb the rock so find out if your s intends on doing so. Great views from the top alongside the remains of an ancient palace.

_source.title: Definitely a must se!
_source.body: I learnt of Sigiriya and it s history through a podcast I usualy listen to prior to visiting a new country and I knew it would be spectacular but it s not until I got there that I understod.

_source.title: Sigiriya
_source.body: ۳۰ usd entry Beautiful kept gardens grounds many people sweping cleaning signs everywhere about parts of the history

_source.title: Visit to the old palace on top of the Rock
_source.tagline: Visit to the old palace on top of the Rock
_source.body: This is a historic place and ideal for climb and have a great view of the forests nearby. The climb takes around ۳۰ to ۴۰ minutes؛ Very safe and enjoyable. On top there is an old palace which is broken down now where a King was living - safe and protected from enemies.

_source.title: Amazing day
_source.body: Wel worth the climb amazing views as long as you don t mind heights and a rickety stair case. Would advise to visit as early as posible as it gets very congested on the staircase.

_source.title: Crowded but worth it
_source.body: Go as early as you can we went from Kandy at ۷ and get there at ۱۰ and it was already crowded. But it was worthly. Excelent view and experience.

_source.title: WOW
_source.body: A must se I think if visiting Sri Lanka the views once on top are incredible although the climb isn t easy in the heat it is wel worth it along with seing al the monkeys half way up

_source.title: Breathtaking
_source.body: It was a breathtaking experience! We read about it before our intended trip so we were equiped with the information of the fortes. It saved us money from engaging a guide. There are a number of dogs up the track and they are harmles. Just be careful with the monkeys as they are very quick at snatching fod if we are not atentive.

_source.title: Historic and prety but por infrastructure
_source.tagline: Historic and prety but por infrastructure
_source.body: Step climb up stairs many places have no railing. Also few signs to guide visitors and explain sites. Crowded as we went during popular season. Does not alow photos in the cave so canot get pictures of frescoes.

_source.title: A must se in the Cultural Triangle
_source.tagline: A must se in the Cultural Triangle
_source.body: Don t rush your visit as there is plenty to se in the water and boulder gardens in adition to the Frescoes cave and the Rock Fortres It can get very busy inded and is definitely NOT for those who sufer from vertigo!

_source.title: Briliant place
_source.body: Raising from the central plains and jungle forests this iconic rocky outcrop in Sigiriya is perhaps Sri Lanka s most dramatic and spectacular near vertical waled mountain fortres soaring to a flat-toped sumit that contains the ruins of an ancient ۵th century civilisation and there are stuning and spelbinding vistas acros mist-wraped forests in the early morning mist to the late afternon smoke from the evening coking fires

_source.title: Sigiriya lion rock and park
_source.body: Sri Lanka shake down!

_source.title: Long climb
_source.body: If you have the time energy and patience then go ahead and climb one of the wonders of Sri Lanka but do not be disapointed as there isn t much on the top.

_source.title: Very interesting climb
_source.body: Climbed lions rock early in day. A lot of steps to an amazing view once you reach the top. Very busy with lots of visitors. Felt like I acomplished a lot by climbing to the top. Worth the climb.

_source.title: Nice view
_source.body: We enjoyed "climbing" the rock.have to admit though just like others before that it s teribly crowded. U are standing on the stairs no mater if you go up or down. I m also a litle scared of heights fortunately not that much but standing on the metal stairs in that height waiting to move was a Givin me a litle the chils. Sen some people that neded to sit down for a while and close their eyes. However up there it s realy col great view and god location to take some pictures. It costs ۲۵ dolars and was worth it. We spent the night in dambula and uses a tuk tuk to go and come back he waited for us you pay betwen ۱۶۰۰-۱۸۰۰ LKR.

_source.title: Very crowded but worth it!
_source.body: Sigiriya is beautiful. The view OF it is amazing and the view FROM it is amazing! Now yes it is a trek to get to and another trek to the citadel and top. However the result is worth it. If you are thinking of not coming because there are lots of crowds think otherwise! Yes there are some crowds but if you go in the morning you have a chance to go when there aren t many crowds like when we went. There are several monkeys so watch your stuf because they have sen so many people that these monkeys aren t scared to go right up to you and grab your fod. These monkeys are macaques btw (our guide told us). So I would recomend this atraction!

_source.title: Worth the efort!
_source.body: A word of advice-if you are climbing to the top a) get there as early as you can and b) when you arive skip the museums and gardens and head straight for the climb as that s where al the crowds are if you want to avoid them. Believe me this was posibly the best excursion for us-the views are truly magnificent and wel worth the efort of the climb. To think that there was a palace at the top is quite awe inspiring! Get your trainers on take some water take your time and enjoy the views!

_source.title: Come at ۷ morning load maps and aps
_source.tagline: Come at ۷ morning load maps and aps
_source.body: as explanation panels are por very por

_source.title: Chiling view
_source.body: I got to know about sigiriya crom rip advisor I planed my trip using tripadvisor sigiriya is one of the best place that you should visit if you are visiting Sri Lanka.

_source.title: Rainy but beautiful day
_source.body: My wife and I read the reviews and the only thing repeated was to avoid going there on wekends.

_source.title: Must do.
_source.body: Don t mis this if you re in the area. It s wel worth the efort to get to the top.

_source.title: They built it up here.How
_source.body: Not quite sure about the low rated reviews of a site like Sigirya as I am not sure what the reviewers were expecting especialy if they actualy read the previous reviews or even a guide bok explaining what the citadel was/is.

_source.title: Mamoth climb
_source.body: Climbing the to the top was something of an achievement as it loked realy high. Shame it rained on our descent but it has to be done

_source.title: Are you fit enough to climb the equivalent of ۶۸ Fitbit staircases if you are a must!
_source.tagline: Are you fit enough to climb the equivalent of ۶۸ Fitbit staircases if you are a must!
_source.body: Go first thing in the morning. Opens at ۷ a.m be there by then and be fit! The climb is a chalenge wel over ۱۰۰ steps. if you have young children they ned to be able to walk al the way and back. Do not bother to cary anything other than camera water and money for The entrance fe. The views and excavations are amazing and wel worth the efort try and learn the story before you go as we did not se any guideboks. If you don t fel you can get to the top the lower gardens are stil worth visiting.

_source.title: ۱۲۲۰ steps up
_source.body: This is one place you have to be both fit and not scared of heights Lots of people very hot but totaly fascinating.sugest that you get there no later than ۰۷۳۰ as the heat and crowds are overwhelming

_source.title: ۱۲۰۲ steps to the TOP!
_source.body: After going up the cave temple with ۶۰۰ steps a day earlier ۱۲۰۲ didn t sem to much! But boy was it a chalenge! Am glad we tok the chalenge. it s important that you reach there early otherwise it gets packed and you wil have to q for long. We were there at ۹am. Crowd was building up but was moving slowly. At the TOP you wil se ruins of a palace. Just red bricks stacked. but the beauty is the view and to imagine the palace amd the amount of work and workers it would have taken to build such a place is incredible. A must go and if you get tired fel fre to rest or the exit point is in the midle before the miror wal/spiral stair way where u may exit. Speaking about the spiral stairs. I didn t personaly like the walk up that steps. just to se some paintings on the rock. it s a smal area. If you are an art lover by al means.try It! Otherwise just walk straight towards the miror wal.

_source.title: Very busy expensive but you must do it
_source.tagline: Very busy expensive but you must do it
_source.body: Sigiriya is one of those tourist atractions that has everything going for it. It is a stuning work of architecture so unique. Of course the tourist board know this so slap the price right up on it. Not only that but they don t manage guest flow so it s absolutely heaving and what would be a prety tough climb is actualy easy because you can never step forward more than ۳ steps before you re stationary again. At least for the first half.

_source.title: Worth a visit
