_source.body: Visited Sigiriya recently in the early morning and it was very very busy. If you are loking for a quiet place don t go there because it s crowded. More than an hour up to the rock due to hundred of people. If you are on top you have a nice view nothing more.

_source.title: Worth the climb
_source.body: We read a wealth of reviews before chosing what time of day to visit. Our guide had us penciled in for ۴.۰۰pm which we dismised as it would be to hot. He was spot on. We arived at a totaly empty visitor centre and bought our tickets just before ۵.۰۰.

_source.title: Lots of monkeys!
_source.body: The citadel of Sigiriya is great. There are great scenic views but the very top ofers the best ۳۶۰ views over al the land. There are tons of monkeys runing around and they are so built on the tourist industry they wil rush up to you for fod and make cute sounds (even when you don t have or are eating quietly). Our tour guide identified these monkeys as Toque Macaques just as an FYI. There is first aid here and one of the members of our party neded it after sliping earlier (on flat ground). The steps from here on out are metal and les step. They stil are dangerous and the slits betwen each are big enough to drop a phone through.The top is great and lots of photos WIL be taken. There are plenty of stray dogs there.Worth whatever journey you just tok whether its gradual or an early morning drive to. I would recomend!

_source.title: Interesting but step walk
_source.body: This was an interesting place to visit and the views are amazing. However it is a step climb to the top so we actualy only made it up to the miror wal. You then have a choice of continuing up or taking a diferent route down so you do not retrace your steps

_source.title: Expensive crowded but beautiful views
_source.body: Sigiriya was awesome however it was very expensive and there were so many people there. If I went again I would definately go to Pidurangala rock instead. You canot help but be inspired by the enormity of Sigiriya but I m not realy to much of a people person - and there were just to many people here for my liking. Make sure you take a botle of water. The climb itself was not nearly as bad as I was expecting the views from the top are breathtaking.

_source.title: Why bother Go to Pidurangala Rock
_source.tagline: Why bother Go to Pidurangala Rock
_source.body: Nice view on entry however the rock was very busy long waiting times geting up to the top. I canot recomend the rock adjacent Pidurangala enough. Much beter les crowded and genuinely a beter view.

_source.title: Interesting place
_source.body: Could do with a litle more info being available to explain what you can se but wel worth a visit. Try to visit early to avoid the crowds and the heat

_source.title: A place to se
_source.body: If you are traveling Srilanka this is number one sight. it is very crowdy expensive entrance fe (۳۰) if you compare it to p.i. Angkor Wat complex in Cambodia. But apart from that it is a nice climb on top there are monkeys and some ruinsand some frescoes on the midle. Also it is posible to take a picture betwen lion paws (fast one). But view from the top- wel it is realy magnificent. With ticket you also get fre entrance to museum. If you are buying suvernirs i recomend that you buy them elsewhere because they have inflated prices for that.

_source.title: A ۱۲۰۲ steps chalenge
_source.body: The entrance ticket price for a foreigner was Rs ۴۶۲۰ for Indians I think half of that. You can rent the service of a guide for more insight about the history at an extra Rs ۵۰۰. Avoid climbing in the afternon because it can be realy hot. My friends and I had a guide acompanying us so he would tel us about some realy interesting stories about the kingdom at the time and the history. It was nice hike but quite tiring especialy with the heat. Total number of steps is ۱۲۰۰ plus the extra two at the topmost. There were not many people when I went so we could make most of the view and could go at our own pace. Overal the Lion Rock deserves its title of a world heritage site because it is one of a kind.

_source.title: Nearly there
_source.body: When you reach this point you are about thre quarters the way to the sumit. The carved paws are magnificent and it is a great shame that the head no longer exists.

_source.title: Top site in cultural triangle
_source.body: Highlight of our visit to the cultural triangle. Very important site and wel worth the climb to the top if you are able.

_source.title: Overcrowded! But stil very interesting
_source.body: If it wasn t for the huge crowd (۸۰ Chinese tourists) it would have ben a excelent experience. We hired a local guide and learnt things we would not have know if not. Interesting to se how advanced the civilization was. The view on the top is very god of course.

_source.title: Amazing hotel
_source.body: What a beautiful hotel. After ariving in Colombo from Male we were driven to this paradise.

_source.title: Lions in Sri Lanka
_source.body: If you are visiting sri lanaka you must visit this citadel of lion rock in sri lanka It s amazing place with amazing view And historical place I love this place For sure I wil visit again

_source.title: Most beautiful site I ever visited
_source.tagline: Most beautiful site I ever visited
_source.body: My husband and I visited Sigirya World Heritage as part of our tour in Sri Lanka. The Lion Rock is the most beautiful site we have visited. Although the climb to the top tok longer than ۲ hours because it was packed with visitors kids on schol trips and monks reaching the top was most rewarding. The views are breath taking!

_source.title: Not a "must se" overpriced!AVOID on wekend
_source.tagline: Not a "must se" overpriced!AVOID on wekend
_source.body: In my personal opinion this is not a must-se in Sri Lanka. Unfortunately we ended up here on a Sunday. When it comes to tickets you have to pay ۱۰۰ times more than a local (۵۰۰ LKR vs ۵۰ LkR) and although there s ۹۰ times more locals than tourists you l al end up in the same queue to walk up the stairs. It was a nightmare. The queue moved a few stairs every ۵-۱۰ minutes. When you get to the caves with paintings it takes les than ۵ minutes because you only se them and you have to kep moving no photography! The citadel itself was unimpresive. We wish we d skiped this and went up the Pigurangala rock. It s for fre (I think) and you get a nice view of Sigiriya.

_source.title: beautiful place nice hike
_source.body: come early in the morning beat the heat and the buses of chinese tourists. quite a walk but wel worth it wear comfy shoes

_source.title: Great view but expensive
_source.body: There were excelent views from the top of the rock. It was also interesting to se the ruins of what was suposedly there (palace or momentary it is debated).

_source.title: loved the hike
_source.body: the rock loks beautiful the hike is tiring but worthy upthere nothing much to se except views and the pol at the ruins of the kings palace loks nice.

_source.title: Awe-inspiring
_source.body: Reach the base early (by ۷ am) to beat the crowds slowing you down along the narow stairs up. We boked a hotel very close to the site for this very reason. If you can climb a few flight of stairs in one go you can climb this awesome monolith to. There are guard rails or parapet wals al along the way so even though some stretches are intimidating it never fels unsafe. Nevertheles caution is advised al along (especialy if you have kids or elderly with you). Wil take you ۴۵-۶۰ mins to the top. My father turned ۸۰ last year he scaled it in ۴۵ mins:) Alow a average time of ۳ hours to visit this site from base to base. Do not skip the walk up the spiral staircase to the fresco cave along the way. Do read about the history of the place before you go so there is no ned for a guide. Cary enough drinking water to last you the climb up back. If you have an Indian pasport (other SARC nation citizens please check eligibility to) show it at the counter to get a ۵۰ discount on the US ۳۰ ticket. Tickets are sold at the museum ticket counter which is a few meters from the standalone ticket counter at the aproach to the rock. Visit this marvel for a memorable experience.

_source.title: Awesome - worth a visit
_source.body: It s a big climb and best tackled early before the crowds. The last bit is up the rock side on basicaly stel laders.

_source.title: Pay online much cheaper
_source.body: Amazing experience great views and historicaly very interesting. We luckily could not withdraw any money from their ATM and ended up boking online. It cost us ۱۰.۵۰ for two tickets instead of ۳۰ each!

_source.title: The earlier the beter!
_source.body: We visited Citadel of Sigiriya from Kandy by bus (taking bus to Dambula - cost LKR۱۰۰/pax from bus terminal behind Kandy railway station the conductor wil let you know when to get of and take another bus at Dambula - cost LKR ۴۰/pax straight to the Sigiriya). We tok ۵:۴۵ am bus and got to Sigiriya just before ۹am and the crowd was quite big already! The climb is not as hard as it sems but maybe wil be quite chalenging for kids and elderly especialy during the hot weather. The reward is when you are at the top! Amazing view! The painting on the mid trip is a nice break up of climbing to!

_source.title: Starving dogs at the top
_source.body: It is quite an impresive sight but very overpriced. Especialy when you reach the top to se starving dogs. We gave them water because it was so hot and there was nothing around for them. Some loked like they were about to die very upseting. Surely with the amount everyone is paying they can aford to fed the dogs. The dogs at the botom lok fed and healthy I m not sure why the dogs are on the top and why they aren t being loked after. We spoke to someone when we got down so hopefuly something wil be done to help. If you go take some water and fod up for them.

_source.title: Great View on Top Crowded Climb around ۱۰-۱۱am
_source.tagline: Great View on Top Crowded Climb around ۱۰-۱۱am
_source.body: Enjoyed the view after a long climb to the top. Visited by monks and locals to. The guide made it easier to get there and buy our tickets and met us at the guide parking lot. Skiped the museum. Interesting many dogs and pupies live on the top of the Lion Rock Monkeys to. Big pond on top. Don t lose your ticket or pay twice is what our guide told us.

_source.title: Exciting but quite crowded.
_source.body: The experience of climbing the rock was thriling and incredible views from the top of the rock are worth the sweat. And sweat you wil as some parts of the climb may be quite demanding for the unprepared. Be sure to go in early morning if you want to avoid the heat and crowds upon crowds of tourists.

_source.title: Climb not as bad as imagined
_source.tagline: Climb not as bad as imagined
_source.body: We arived here around miday and I believe that every schol in Sri Lanka was having a schol trip - literaly hundreds and hundreds of children! Our guide managed to get them to move to one side to let us pas in some points which semed to be what al the smaler tourist groups were doing. The only god thing about it being so busy was it slowed us down so we weren t climbing continualy as I think this would have ben exhausting. My husband doesn t like heights but he did make it to the first level (but bypased the spiral staircase) and the only part he found dificult was the metal stairs imediately before the spiral stairs. I climbed to the top and didn t think the last section was to hard and I do have a bad kne. There are several friendly but hungry dogs living on the top which was quite upseting. Take a litle fod for them as they do have pupies. We were told by our guide that the gardeners lok after them but there wasn t much evidence of this - they were quite desperate

_source.title: Must-se but before rush hours!
_source.body: Many people say this place is overated and should be skiped or maybe at best sen from another rock nearby. WRONG. As long as you get there before ۰۹.۰۰am it s an amazing evidence of the past. The ruins on top are of course the main point but don t forget to step of the main path every once in a while to se les popular parts of the gardens caves and teraces. If you arive to late you l end up in an enormous line waiting to climb the rock in incredible heat and moist - no wonder people hate that.

_source.title: Worth seing but only before rush hours!
_source.tagline: Worth seing but only before rush hours!
_source.body: Many people say this place is overated and should be skiped or maybe at best sen from another rock nearby. WRONG. As long as you get there before ۰۹.۰۰am it s an amazing evidence of the past. The ruins on top are of course the main point but don t forget to step of the main path every once in a while to se les popular parts of the gardens caves and teraces. If you arive to late you l end up in an enormous line waiting to climb the rock in incredible heat and moist - no wonder people hate that.

_source.title: Stuning views
_source.body: It s a bit of a climb to the top of the rock but once you reach the top it s totaly worth it! The view from there is stuning! We went in the evening and watched the sun set from the top which was beautiful.

_source.title: Get there early
_source.body: Thesis a remarkable place and a must se. But at al costs get there as it opens and avoid the crowds and queues which build up later.

_source.title: Big Rock with awesome view
_source.body: This program ned god knes because you have to climb up to the ۳۵۰ m high on steps. There is two place to se- one of them is in the cave - beautiful wal pantings- the miror wal canot be touch during the way- years ago people left sign on it but nowadays it is not alowed. Than on the other side of the rock you can climb up to the Citadel- it is heavy and if it s raining maybe a litle slipery to. But on the top you can se a wonderful view- and a very interesting ruin of the citadel.

_source.title: Nice Climb Amazing Experience
_source.body: First of al go early at ۷am when they open. There were very few people when we went and when we were coming down a couple of hours later the crowds going up were ridiculous.

_source.title: Go early!
_source.body: I know this is on everyone s must-do list but don t get to excited about the "ruins" you wil se because apart from the beautiful paintings of the "ladies" halfway up and a large lion paw there is not much else apart from crumbling wal remains. It s al about the chalenge and the view from the top.

_source.title: Review!
_source.body: Amazing site! There are some shortcut ways up to the top! Go as early as posible to avoid line! Museum ofers great example of artwork and artifacts (which can not be photographed) Not to be mised

_source.title: Returning after ten years to find god restoration developments.
_source.tagline: Returning after ten years to find god restoration developments.
_source.body: One of the world s great monuments never fails to impres. The scale of it absorbs the crowds but given the sher scale of numbers of visitors it wil son be important to consider how to handle these at the frescoes and other tight points. Visitors should consider an early or late visit to avoid these isues.

_source.title: Go early
_source.body: Our travel company had us climbing the rock at ۷. And that was excelent idea as you had a chance to lok around and take time. Was amazed at size of fortres at the top! Cave paintings up spiral steps worth seing and you can photograph excelent replicas in Museum after. Definitely something you have to do!

_source.title: Worth every step
_source.body: The climb up to the top of Sigiriya is not for the faint-hearted. ۱۲۰۰ steps the lower ones up a winding path and the top section up a metal staircase. On the way you wil se the remains of some enchanting cave paintings sadly far fewer than there once were of delicate and demure scantily-clad maidens bringing oferings of flowers to the Lord Budha. This gives you a bit of a breather as wel as being a beautiful experience in its own right. When you get to the top of the rock the remains of this ancient civilisation are breathtaking as is the view. Alow about ۵۰ minutes for the climb slightly les to get back down and a god hour at the top. Go early in the morning before the heat is to intense and be prepared for an experience which wil blow your mind.

_source.title: Must do in Sigiriya
_source.body: It is the best to go early in the morning as it is a very popular site and the sun can be very strong and to hot for the hike later in the morning (or in the afternon).

_source.title: Fantastic view
_source.body: A beautiful and iconic place. We went at thre in the afternon and although a bit warm initialy it coled down nicely as we climbed the rock

_source.title: Iconic and Worth It!
_source.body: I would hate to have gone to Sri Lanka and not be able to say we visited climbed Lion Rock. That said - go early to avoid the heat and crowds. Our driver picked us up at ۶:۳۰ and we were there at ۷ am as son as the gates opened (we were ۳rd car in lot). It is not the hardest of hikes/climbs but it is probably to much for some. We tok our ۲۳ month old with us in our back carier and he did great.

_source.title: Get there early
_source.body: Great place and definitely worth a visit.

_source.title: Has to be done
_source.body: Visited here as per many other tourists have done with our guide. Arived about ۱۱am and found it very busy so either go early or late. The queue was unbelievable and many Asian people just pushed in front of us al the time.Couldn t understand that. Not polite at al. The steps up were easy enough as you couldn t go fast anyhow. Climbing up the metal spiral staircase was god and there were monkeys al around. Having reached the top we loked around and it was interesting with great views. Again very busy with tourists.

_source.title: It s completely non sense
_source.body: It s beter to take selfie clicks from down. No benefits to get up that ۲۰۰ meter rock. Narow staircase. Ticket cost for outsider is ۳۰ but don t forget to cary your pasport to get the ticket on ۳۰ otherwise it would be more costly. There s cafe are also near ticket counter. ۲۰۰+ steps ned to get on top.

_source.title: Loks daunting but so worth the efort to climb
_source.tagline: Loks daunting but so worth the efort to climb
_source.body: I was ready to back out as it loked prety dificult from the base.The entry fe was ۳۰us and if you have US it s probably worth paying in that curency.The first few steps are quite dificult but it gets easier.We did the acent in ۴۰ mins to the top stoping for drinks and photos.Dont get sidetracked at the spiral staircase that doesn t take you to the top but takes you to paintings on the rock wals and you are not alowed to take photos.You then have to walk back down again to get back on the path.Once at the top you have great views and can se al the ruins of the fort that was once there.Realy impresive and were very pleased we made it so easily.If you have fitnes isues maybe wait at the botom.We did se some Chinese tourists that obviously found it to hard and they stayed at the botom.They were totaly dresed inapropriately for the hike in platform shoes etc.One of the things in Sri Lankan that I would say is a must do.They recomend doing this in the morning and we were there at ۱۲.۴۵pm.I was very warm.Mornings would be beter

_source.title: Chalenging
_source.body: We only had time for a fleting visit to this site. The signposts ned to be more detailed for those who visit without a guide. The complex is huge and high. There is a ticket ofice for Indian Nationals clearly marked but the one for foreigners is shut you have to discover the ticket ofice a couple of hundred yards away inside the museum.

_source.title: Must se!
_source.body: Don t be put of by the reviews sugesting only the fit can make it to the top. Yes it s a fair walk and yes it can get hot during the day but there are a couple of things to consider. You don t ned to walk it al at once take breaks and enjoy the scenery along the way. Get early on and avoid the tours and the worst of the miday sun/ And like anywhere with this type of climate take plenty of fluids.

_source.title: Stuning
_source.body: Steped in history and intrigue. Its a bit of a climb to the top but the views are worth it. We d recomend going early in the morning or later in the afternon as it can get very hot.

_source.title: Lion rock climb - don t mis it
_source.tagline: Lion rock climb - don t mis it
_source.body: A great place to visit. The Gardens as one enters the park are interesting and col. The climb is energetic but incredibly worthwhile to se the caves painting and the view from the top. The kings pol on the top of the rock is amazing

_source.title: Rocky Mountain high!
_source.body: You ned to be reasonably fit to climb upto the top which is about ۲۰۰ steps. Narow and smoth steps don t help. ۱st stop during the climb is a terace garden which is ful of fearles monkeys. Take a seat under a tre and enjoy them entertain you. ۲nd stop is after almost ۸۰ climb ful of lovely paintings. Though very few remain now they are definitely worth the climb. We did not have the strength or inclination to climb the sumit but I am told the top has a beautiful garden and a huge reservoir which suplied water to the palaces down. A visit to dambula canot be complete without a visit to this rock fortres

_source.title: Must se but only if are fit
_source.tagline: Must se but only if are fit
_source.body: This site has four platforms with plenty of steps. First platform has geometrical gardens easily acesible to everybody. Second platform requires climbing couple of hundred steps in stairs some quite step. If you canot climb six flors this is not your place. If you can you l se some nice rocks and craftsmanship. The best platform there. Third platform shows paintings. It requires climbing narow staircase about ۵۰ meters. If your BMI is over ۳۰ or you are afraid of heights this is not your place. You canot take photos of paintings (two years in jail if you do so they say and there are guards). Paintings are beautiful and fresh (must have ben restored) but you can se them wel in boks. Then you come back to second platform and walk to the other end of the rock. There is lion s mouth and steps to the fourth platform. If you canot run for thre miles don t go. It s the toughest climb there. Over the top it s god view and few bricks but not much more. If you are in fit you should do it. Be there at ۷:۳۰ am or you l queue for ۲ hours.

_source.title: Worth if you can walk up the top
_source.tagline: Worth if you can walk up the top
_source.body: Those who can t walk can stay down near garden while others can go up. View from down itself is satisfying. Going up is tedious job. Up the rock there is only remains no palace or nothing. But the view was god. Take water botles or even litle snacks along. One thing is that foreigners please have your pasport with you while entry else you may end up paying more. Indian pasport ۱۵USD and for others ۳۰USD.

_source.title: A ۱۵۰۰ year old masterpiece
_source.body: The Sigiriya Rock is one of those things that you d have to se to believe. Everything about the place is incredible: The architecture the ecology the stuning views from atop the mountain and mural paintings that don the rock face. If you have time to kil do consider climbing the Pidurangala Rock to the views of Sigiriya from atop the rock are incredible to.

_source.title: Just beautiful!
_source.body: This monument is beautiful. The view from the top of the Lion Rock is amazing. The climbing of steps is a litle bit tough for young childrens

_source.title: Amazing
_source.body: We went to Sigiriya and was amazed by how beautiful it is. The climb itself is step at times but incredible views each step of the way and not to dificult as you can pace it. The view is incredible and there is lots of space at the top to take it in.

_source.title: Worth ading to your itinerary
_source.body: This is expensive but an interesting landscape feature of Sri Lanka and if you are able it s worth the climb for the views from the top. Be aware though that hand rails are in short suply on very uneven and step tracks which is why my husband couldn t face going al the way up. We were warned about locals there who ofer to help and sem genuine but then they demand a high price at the end. My husband was fleced of about ۳۵ by such a man who told me he didn t want money when I refused his help giving me the impresion when I went to climb higher that he was part of the staf. He was unpleasant when my husband ofered about ۱۰ initialy for the litle help he gave him and made him fel guilty. A pity I was not with him for I m sure he wouldn t have tried that with two of us. There are monkeys and dogs of course and I was woried when tourists were going up to them quite closely to photograph. A scratch or bite from a these could leave you with rabies a rush to hospital and a ۴۰۰ injection to save your life. This hapened recently to a young girl so our taxi guide reported - she died.

_source.title: A must-se while in Sri Lanka
_source.tagline: A must-se while in Sri Lanka
_source.body: The rock is imposing and beautiful. I can t emphasise enough how much you should GET THERE FOR ۷.۳۰AM! We were one of the first ۲۰ people up there and it was a lovely and relaxed walk up. On the way down by about ۹am people were queuing it was realy busy and you don t want to be knocked about on those rickety stairs! It s a lot of steps but totaly worth it. Would recomend to everyone going to Sri Lanka!

_source.title: Beautiful Place
_source.body: Quite a breathtaking view and beautiful countryside with wild elephants. We did not climb the rock but many did. Instead we tok a walk around the rock which was beautiful. Most definitely should be on your visit list.

_source.title: Get there early and prepare for a hard climb.
_source.tagline: Get there early and prepare for a hard climb.
_source.body: We had ben advised to arive early and that is my one piece of advice to you.For as we were descending the coach loads were starting and there were queues even at the botom. However what an experience. My godnes is it a climb! with some very thin slipery walk ways along the rock and even a spiral staircase stuck to the outside. I certainly would not advise anyone with smal children or babes in arms to consider this and it might be chalenging for the more senior amongst you or those with mobility concerns. Half way up you enter the area with the Busty Beauties wal paintings. Whatever you do do not think about geting a photo do not even take the lens cap of for your camera wil be confiscated as hapened to the man in front of us. You can even be arested! But up you continue and at the top although there is not a lot to se or do you can mil about the ruins and take in the amazing views. I think it is more about doing the climb than what is up there to atract the crowds. A god half days activity to get the heart pounding!

_source.title: Manageable climb great history
_source.body: This is a must-go for anyone visiting Sigiriya with its dep history and significance.

_source.title: Kingdom of King Kashyapa
_source.body: A popular tourist atraction in Sri Lanka to witnes the skils and the technology of the ancient pedigre. Very famous for paintings on the wals.

_source.title: It s a long way to the top but worth it!
_source.tagline: It s a long way to the top but worth it!
_source.body: The climb to the top of Sigiriya Rock has over ۱۲۰۰ steps. A lot of those steps are uneven so a litle care is neded. But the views from on top are exceptional and the history and the culture is amazing.

_source.title: Stuning area to wander through geting a fel for the history.
_source.tagline: Stuning area to wander through geting a fel for the history.
_source.body: This area is on the flat before the very step climb of the Lion Rock itself. The partly restored pathway takes you past the ۴ huge water gardens - two of which are stil in god condition. You fel as if you are geting a glimpse of life in the past and a diferent culture and way of life. Paths are uneven and you ned reasonable shoes and a steady tread. If you venture to the sides of the main path there are caves that were inhabited and other structures and areas that most people semed to ignore - lovely areas to wander through to get a fel for the history and peace of the site. Everywhere there was an army of locals sweping the paths and gras of the droped leaves from the previous day - it is very wel loked after and wel worth a visit.

_source.title: Arive early and be prepared to climb!
_source.tagline: Arive early and be prepared to climb!
_source.body: This is wel worth a visit but you ned to be fit to make it up the hundreds of steps to get to the top where the view is stuning. There are crowds here so come as early as posible - that way it wil be coler to. Bring water to drink [there is nowhere to buy it!]. You begin by walking through the ancient water gardens where you marvel at how these were laid out when the only way was to do it by hard physical labour. Be careful of your step - health and safety counts for nothing here! There are groups of monkeys al around and you ned to be wary of eating or showing fod - a lady near us began eating a banana when it was cleverly snatched from her by a large monkey - not doing her any harm but giving her a shock. You then begin the climb around the base area. It gets steper and steper and there are no hand rails in many areas so you must be firm in your foting. A stel built lader ascends the rock face - out in the sun very step and hundreds of steps. Wel worth it when you get to the top and se where they used to live in the palace etc- cant imagine how they got up here - the views are amazing but there is no shelter from the sweltering sun - use god suntan protection. Then you have to descend - a diferent staircase for the most part. Very interesting.

_source.title: Lion Rock Sigiriya
_source.body: Chalenging climb save your energy and don t rush in the longish walk to base of rock. Worth spending ۳۰mins in Museum first to se copies of the rock paintings and artefacts so when you se the real thing you know what you re loking at. The climb up is long so take breaks and can be slightly hair raising in places but hold your nerve it s worth it!

_source.title: Extraordinary place
_source.body: This place should be visited while traveling in Sri Lanka. The climbing is not very easy and fast but it is a moment which should be experienced.

_source.title: What a fantastic place
_source.body: We climbed this rock early in the morning (۷am) to avoid the crowds and it was realy worth it. Although cloudy the day we visited the place is unbelievable

_source.title: Go early!
_source.body: One of the main reasons to visit this area is to climb up the rock fortres and to visit the ancient water gardens. Early is beter as les people on the climb. I suspect there s not realy an absolutely best time but since you must do it you must just queue! Big tip - take some medigloves for holding onto the handrails. Many thousands of people on the climb al holding on to the rail and not al the cleanest! also it s rusty and if you are unlucky enough for rain (we were) your hands get covered in orange rust - as do your clothes and everything else so don t wear anything god!

_source.title: It s a climb but the view is worth it.
_source.tagline: It s a climb but the view is worth it.
_source.body: This is a very popular place to visit so it can get crowded. There is only one way up but there is a second way down. It also can be very hot. Our guide sugested we get there when they opened for the morning to beat the heat and crowds. That is the way to do it! We were able to get many photos during our climb and at the sumit. I don t like heights so there were a few places I huged the rock but it s not bad because the stairs are sturdy. Worth doing if you visit the site.

_source.title: Beautiful rock
_source.body: Beautiful and impresive lion s rock! Opens at ۷ am and I recomend you get there early as from ۹ am crowds start to climb leaving people one behind the others.

_source.title: Amazing
_source.body: Sigiriya rock fortres is definitely a must visit place in Sri Lanka. Even though the entrance ticket was ۳۰ it was worth visiting it. Climbing wasn t hard at al instead easier than many other mountains.

_source.title: Oldies managed the climb
_source.body: We got to the top and we re pleased to have done it. It is amazing to think that they managed to build and live on top of the rock. Not a lot left of their buildings but felt the ned to do it.

_source.title: Wel worth it!
_source.body: I d recomend reading and understanding the history of this amazing rock before you go as we didn t se any information while we were there and it realy helped knowing why what and most importantly how they built the fortres on the top! Not recomended if you don t like heights as the metal steps are a litle rickety near the top. It is wel worth the climb however for the view and to witnes this feat of enginering / architecture.

_source.title: Go - early
_source.body: This is an easy one. Alow plenty of time as there is more to this place than straight up the path up the mountain and back.

_source.title: One of the great sights of Sri Lanka
_source.tagline: One of the great sights of Sri Lanka
_source.body: This extraordinary outcrop (with a ruined palace on top) is fascinating. A visit begins with the Museum and you then walk through the gardens to the base of the rock and begin to climb. This is not for the faint-hearted suferers from Vertigo or folk with heart and lung problems؛ there are ۱۲۰۰ steps to the top. About halfway up is a spiral staircase leading to the famous frescoes and then you ascent again to a terace about tw-thirds of the way up. Thereafter it s up a set of iron steps bolted to the rock. There are locals who wil steady you (tip sensible).

_source.title: An absolute must do!
_source.body: Spent a morning exploring the gardens before start the serious climb. First to view the ancient frescos and then onward and upward. Through the lions paws to start the climb to the top. The views are amazing and we lived learning about the history of the site. Although it s busy everyone was polite and you can take your time. It was mic to late morning when we went up the rock and it was a beautiful experience.

_source.title: Majestic!
_source.body: A must-visit site to witnes the grandeur of a civilization and the richnes of the SriLankan jungle. from above! Totaly worth it!

_source.title: Wel Worth a visit!
_source.body: The first chalenge of Sigiriya rock was geting here we arived in Kandy and started to lok at options reading trip advisor we son realised this wasn t going to be an easy trip by public transport so we opted for a smal private car which cost us about ۳۵ for the day. The trip each way was about ۳ hrs mainly due to trafic. When you arive there are guides touting but once inside you realy don t ned a guide as everything is clearly marked and laid out. Admision is step around ۲۵ each but we felt beter about this when we learned it helps to pay for the infrastructure of many other services such as cheap public transport. You walk through the gardens to get to the rock which are worth exploring. Once you re geting close to the rock it is quite a step climb we arived around ۲.۳۰ in the afternon and found it very quiet but hot. Contrary to what we read it gets much busier late afternon when it s coler. If you have vertigo seing the cave paintings is quite an experience climbing up a creaking spiral staircase high up.

_source.title: Beautiful suroundings to Lion Rock
_source.body: The ruins and gardens you pas on the way to Lion Rock are very atractive and ancient. Some god photo stops to se the rock.

_source.title: Nice climb and great views
_source.body: Sigiriya Lion Rock was a must stop for our family. Young boys ۶ and ۱۰ made it to the top just fine. The views and col breze at the top are wonderful. There are pedlers "asisting" you up the stairs. If you ned help please acept it but be aware they won t leave without a god tip.

_source.title: Breathtaking
_source.body: What a breath taking view (once you get tot he top)

_source.title: Tough climb but amazing views from the top
_source.tagline: Tough climb but amazing views from the top
_source.body: It s an amazing experience but with a ۳۰ usd entrance fe! Sri Lanka is stil learning about tourism and it s crazy entry prices to sights puting many people of.

_source.tagline: One of the most beautiful places to visit!
_source.body: The climb to the top is super exhausting but totaly worth it! The view from the top and the lion rock is stuning. A must visit UNESCO site in SriLanka.

_source.tagline: An exertion but wel worth it
_source.body: Okay so this is never going to pas health and safety in the UK but we re not in the UK. Some of the steps are uneven and even a bit lose. There are no toilets once you get past the car park. There is no cable car ride for the les able or les inclined.

_source.title: Great climb with children!
_source.body: The rock is not that hard to climb finaly - except for the last section that we did not! - with ۲ kids (۷ and ۴ years old). The view from the lion pawn was great. The metalic stairs loked scary and not secure enough so we tok the decision to stop the ascension there and go back.

_source.title: An interesting experience but to many bodies in to smal a space on the steps.
_source.tagline: An interesting experience but to many bodies in to smal a space on the steps.
_source.body: Yes it s a dramatic view from the top or even from the Lion s Paw where we decided to stop. Not through fatigue or vertigo we d just had enough of jostling in a column of sweaty bodies and the last section was two way and jam packed. This was early to mid morning the suposed quieter time.

_source.title: Incredible place
_source.body: It s a realy amazing place and the climb isn t as bad as it loks (if you re relatively fit!). Go early (it opens at ۷ a.m.) We did and it was relatively quiet but after spending about an hour up there when we were on our way down we came acros mases of people going up.

_source.body: World heritage site magnificently restored ruins. Museum for those who dare not climb the hundreds of steps upwards but for those that do be rewarded with views to die for and beautifuly maintained archeological ruins. Gardens wonderful monkeys and bird life abound. Wel worth the money.

_source.title: Amazing site
_source.body: Quite unique acros the world as a site. Be careful to manage though the heat. We went up towards the end of the afternon which was god but stil a bit hot going up. It was begining to clear out at the top though.

_source.title: Disapointing and overpriced

Aces to the frescoes miror wal (now nothing to se) lion paws and the top itself is by a hideous mixture of metal staircases of varying styles. Ariving in the first half of the day ensures you walk up the staircases to the very top in the blazing sun while a visit in the late afternon would result in being in the shade and jostling with far fewer people. Why this atraction is such an atraction in the first place is puzling given its ۳۰ per person entrance fe and why its World Heritage Site status hasn t prevented its ruination even more so.

No way I would have bothered then and the sun was scorching. Big tour groups with incredibly old people literaly being caried up by sri Lankan guides was ludicrous- so glad we only pased them on our way down!

_source.title: Worth the efort
_source.body: Hard work on the climb but worth it. Plenty oportunity to rest on the way up. Take water and enjoy.

_source.body: Lion Rock is truly an amazing experience. Lots of people go and the climb can be daunting but once you get to the top its al worth it.

_source.title: Beautiful natural phenomenon but touristical
_source.body: Lions Rock is an incredible natural phenomen and has significant Sri Lankian historical value. The climb and view is stuning and beautiful. Now the rating is due to the extreme overprice of ۳۰ USD per person and the fact they don t even acept credit card. Of course we do pay when we are there in SL but there is absolutely no reason for this price. Pure money machine. Locals pay les than ۵۰ dolar cent (which is fair but no reason for tourist exploitation). If you are on budget go to Pido mountain which is just as god.

An astonishing ruined palace on the top ofthe rock - but be warned the climb is not suitable for anyone without a head for heights or the stamina to climb the ۱۲۰۰ steps. Don t wory there s lots to se at the base including shady royal water gardens.

_source.tagline: Hiked up with family recomend water and sunscren!

There are a LOT of tourists which makes it crowded and tough to take some photos other areas are of-limits to any kind of photos (the frescos) and the lines are long because there are so many stairs. I stil felt it was worth the trip to the top but some members of our family couldn t take the pounding on their knes. I d stil recomend this place but only if you have healthy knes not much claustrophobia plenty of water and sunscren. I d pay to go back up again but I enjoy chalenging hikes! Don t go if that s not you!

_source.body: should visit the place if you visit Sri Lanka not for minors and aged for climbing the rock but if you are planing just to visit the heritage site at ground level every one can do that. the place is peaceful and garden is wel maintained. it is bit expensive

_source.title: Great Heritage Site! bit expensive

Take your own eateries and drink water when you climb. the view from the top is mesmerizing. If you are physicaly fit it wont take more than ۲-۳ hrs to complete. but ۳۰ is litle high.

_source.title: Must visit heritage site in Sri Lanka
_source.tagline: Must visit heritage site in Sri Lanka

There are also multiple lodges located nearby if one intends to stay overnight. The place has ben very wel maintained and is a UN world heritage site. Entire hike takes around ۶۰-۹۰ minutes depending on ones pace. To reach to the top one has to climb around ۴۰۰ stairs. We went for the option of guided tour and it was totaly worth it.

_source.title: Great place

You should climb the rock as early as posible to avoid the heat and the lines. When it is busy take the cobra entrance instead of the main entrance this way you wil enter the queue at the fresco s.

_source.title: Realy taken back to pre historic era

_source.title: Must se

_source.title: Sri Lanka s Citadel in the Sky
_source.tagline: Sri Lanka s Citadel in the Sky
_source.body: Sigiriya consists of an ancient citadel built by King Kashyapa during the ۵th century. It has ben listed as a UNESCO World Heritage Site and is one of Sri Lanka s most popular landmarks.

_source.body: A realy wel worthwhile trip. Very wel run and clean and tidy toilets. Go early it is exhausting! The efort is worth al the stairs and my godnes you climb! _source.body: It s an amazing rock fortres from above reveals the incredible enginering that wegnt into construction. The name refers to a site of historical and archaeological significance King kashyapa build his castle on this enormous rock and decorated wonderfuly. There represent ancient srilankan painting and writings Once you go there you l get the real experience how ancient srilankan royals spent their lifestyle. _source.title: Magnificent World Heritage Site in danger of turning into a "tourist trap"
_source.tagline: Magnificent World Heritage Site in danger of turning into a "tourist trap"
_source.body: This is an extraordinary place! A UNESCO World Heritage Site it is one of those "must se" places. The rock/citadel is an ancient monument with a fascinating history and it loks spectacular even from a distance. I visited with a friend during a short tour (we were atending a conference). She climbed the rock but because I have bad knes I felt I was not up to the climb. It was very step and a continuous line of people walking up. Observing the wel laid-out rather beautiful grounds with statues and lovely tres I also noticed the continuous flow of huge tourist buses (mostly Chinese). This concerned me؛ as a World Heritage Site it might become degraded if this continues؛ they should probably limit numbers. Instead of climbing I tok a lovely tour of the area via "tuk tuk" (it was raining on and of) and enjoyed the quiet beauty of the natural suroundings - many birds a huge lizard and monkeys! My friend said that she realy apreciated having her own guide as she was a litle nervous about the climb. She said he was realy god but of course she had to tip him extra. Stil this is one of those "must se" places in Sri Lanka. What I loved about it was the amazing views of the rock from diferent vantage points.

_source.title: Great visit but very(!) busy
_source.body: As per the title realy! A great visit I ve ben twice nice now in the past ۲۰ years. This time around it was packed. We had about ۵ mins of "fredom" while climbing then joined a masive queue and slowly walked to the top in single file. Al tours of Sri Lanka include this as a stop.

_source.title: Fabulous place steped in history.

_source.title: Wow! Worth the climb 👍🏻

_source.title: great place to visit

The climbing itself takes about an hour from botom to up and back but if you want to take pictures then reserve more time. We were there ۲ ۵hours and could ve spend more in the gardens.

_source.title: Don t mis it

_source.tagline: A highlight of our visit to Sri Lanka worth having a guide to apreciate it fuly

_source.title: Enjoy it

It is strenuous and not for anyone with any chronic conditions but the view once you get to the top are stupendous. The history of the Rock and the reasons for the fortifications are fascinating to.

_source.title: Worth the climb

_source.title: Awesome!
