You can get tickets from the building near the first lake.For elders do it only if you are fit enough. The view from up there is realy great. NEVER MIS THIS

_source.title: If you ve a head for heights then it s a must
_source.tagline: If you ve a head for heights then it s a must
_source.body: Gardens wel kept. Loads of steps to climb before you reach the start of the main climb. Ned to get there early as this realy is a tourist trap. Beware of the hawkers that ofer to asist you with the climb and then want to charge you extortionate amount. Our driver advised us what was a reasonable amount and ofered that. They weren t hapy but we told them " take it or leave it" just be aware!

_source.title: Amazing architectural monument
_source.body: To me this site rivals the ruins of Machu Pichu. Its amazing how a palace complex was build on a tal sher granite rock and it served as residence of a king and monks. This fortres complex ruins speak of amazing feat of planing enginering art and variety of skils.

_source.title: Absolutely stuning
_source.body: We left our hotel the Sigiriya at ۷am to climb the rock before the crowds arive - and the heat became to much.

_source.title: Very Nice
_source.body: Very nice! Beutiful nature beautiful views lot of animals. There is posibility of local guide. There are something about ۱۵۰۰ stairs but It s not that bad as it loks😁

_source.title: Loved this site
_source.body: I do not have a head for heights so was unsure if I was going to make it to the top. Lots of relaxing breathing and just concentrating on loking at the shoes of the person ahead of me got me up to the top. It is quite a hike but definitely worth it. Luckily it was a cloudy day so it wasn t to exhausting but on a very suny day I would start as early in the morning as posible. At the top there are lots of diferent areas the kings pol and throne I was not expecting! And of course the dogs and pupies that sem to live up there!

_source.title: Watch out for the helpers
_source.body: We went to Sigiriya early morning and it was already crowded. There were mases of coaches and people. The early morning meant the steps (and there are a lot or them) are very slipery. A local man aproach me ofering to asist me on the steps. Although I declined he was persistent. I told him again I was ok. Finaly I ofered him ۱۰۰ rupe to leave and he said it wasn t enough so gave him ۲۰۰. Again it was not enough and he got quite agresive so I gave him ۱۰۰ rupe. It would have turned ugly if I didn t turn my back and walk away with my traveling companions. Be warned! It does require a level of fitnes to climb this amazing site although I did se people on crutches being pushed and puled upwards. The history is amazing so make sure you go with a guide. The views also stuning. Definitely a highlight of our trip.

_source.title: Family trip with amazing views
_source.body: I have to say this one of my highlights in srilanka- amazing view of the site from the photo botom and epic views from the top Its a must se!

_source.title: Worth a visit
_source.body: It is a must go if visiting sigiriya or Dambula. There is an entry ticket of ۳۰ usd for foreign visitors (۱۵ usd for SARC nationals). Go early in the morning to avoid the afternon heat as you have to climb nearly ۵۰۰ mtr and walk at lest ۱km to reach the starting point of climb. Wear shoes and kep a water botle along. Do not get bog down by the climb the view from top of the rock is breath taking and it also makes you wonder how was it al built in that era.

_source.title: Hugely impresive rock fortres
_source.body: The Sigiriya World Heritage Site UNESCO listed is one of the major tourist atractions in Sri Lanka. It is to be located in the Matale District near to the town of Dambula in the Central Province. It is a masive rock some ۲۰۰ meters high and is of very important historical and archaeological interest. We strongly advise anyone planing to visit to read up on the history of the rock which legend asociates with the ancient Kingdom of the land. One can make the very chalenging ascent of the rock up over a thousand steps (which we first did many years ago before the ascent was improved) and guides are available to explain the route and the history asociated with it. Aside from the most incredible views one can enjoy the fantastic historical frescoes and gardens. In the heat of the sun the climb can be demanding. Water hat and sunscren are esential. My latest photo shows the rock from ground level. Other photos to folow. It is an amazing feling to have done this climb! Over the years tourism has significantly increased here and the route is very busy and you wil find many souvenir stals and drink outlets at the base.

_source.title: Great Experience
_source.body: Fabulous trip to the World Heritage site. It was first trip for my son and he realy enjoyed the hike. Lot of steps to get to the top. Beautiful ۳۶۰ degre view.

_source.title: Rare ruins on top of the rock and amazing views.
_source.tagline: Rare ruins on top of the rock and amazing views.
_source.body: Rare ruins on top of the rock and amazing views.

_source.title: Phenomenal!
_source.body: A must se and a must climb! ۱ ۲۰۲ steps. Views are spectacular. The frescoes are most amazing. The history behind this monument is wel worth the climb up the mountain.

_source.title: Hard climb
_source.body: It was an extremely hard climb up the rock as the railing was very shaky. When you got to the top the view was imaculate. Coming down was even harder as the rails were lose and it was very step. There were stone paintings in a part of the rock the were very wel maintained.

_source.title: Must Visit
_source.body: This is a must must visit site in Sri Lanka. First of al the rock itself is huge - protruding out of literaly nowhere. And I came to know that the rock itself is like milions of years old. It is just remarkable to imagine that they created a whole palace on the rock. The gardens the fresco painting the miror wal and the whole setup on the top of the rocks is worth seing. It get very hot though. I think they should have some arangement considering such hot climate.

_source.title: Lion rock
_source.body: The most tiring trip in my life. I have done it in ۳۵ degres and I m proud of my self. The view was breath taking but prices for tourist s tickets so expensive comparing with local people tickets.

_source.title: Excelent
_source.body: The climb is step to the top. Go on a slow pace and request the authorities to provide water botles on sale.

_source.title: Lovely
_source.body: The weding aniversary day and climb up was so heavenly. Would just ask for the authorities to provide water botles on sale. Climb is step and the view on the top was breathtakingly beautiful

_source.title: As beautiful as the photos
_source.body: This is a must se in Sri Lanka. From the moment you walk into the grounds it is breathtaking. The gardens are wel cared for and the site itself is magnificent. The climb loks high from the ground but as you ascend it is surprisingly not to hard - it is an enjoyable climb. The spiral stair case is a litle scary if you do not like heights as it is on the side of the rock face.

_source.title: A realy god experience
_source.body: I visited on a Thursday ariving at around ۱۴:۰۰. Perfect time as the last people were just leaving and when I left at ۱۵:۳۰ the tour groups started showing up. Tickets had to be bought in the museum (no queue) and I could park my bike right at the entrance. I made my way up the rock. The spiral staircase is prety crepy but you don t have to go up there (you l mis the wal paintings though). The rest of the path up to the sumit is doable but best bring some water and catch your breath from to time. Each of the sites has a litle plague with information which I realy apreciate (not wanting a guide and al). I arived on the sumit with the palace to gorgeous views of the grounds below. The only downsides were staf beging for cigaretes and the rather high admision price. Stil a solid experience.

_source.title: Must visit
_source.body: If you come to srilanka you must visit the sigiriya lion rock. Go wel prepared as you have to climb the rock. Go early in the morning as it wil become hot later. Prefer wearing shoes and take along with you a water botle glases and a hat. Once you reach the top the view is amazing.

_source.title: Hightlight in Sri Lanka
_source.body: The Sigiriya Rock (also caled Lion s Rock) is one of the major highlights in Sri Lanka and one of the most expensive places (۳۰ USD). Anyhow it s definitely worth going there. As there are many stairs it can take a bit longer when there are many groups with older people around (and I was suprised how many older tourists were trying to climp the rock).

_source.title: A hard climb but worth the efort. A must do if in the area.
_source.tagline: A hard climb but worth the efort. A must do if in the area.
_source.body: This was my second visit to Sigiriya and this time I was determined to get to the top of this rock fortres. Our guide said we would be starting at ۷am when the dors opened for two reasons. Firstly it gets very hot later in the day and secondly the crowds build up from ۹am onwards making the climb very slow and tedious. This was god advice.

_source.title: Amazing place
_source.body: What an amazing place. Wel worth a visit but make sure you go early in the day take plenty of water and wear a hat as there is litle shade on the climb to the top.

_source.title: Fantastic views but very expensive.
_source.body: We thought this to be overly expensive particularly as my wife also had to pay the ful admision price even though she was only going to wait in the gardens at the botom of the rock.

_source.title: Amazing and not that hard to climb
_source.tagline: Amazing and not that hard to climb
_source.body: Get there early morning and don t be intimidated by the number of steps everyone keps talking about. The steps are in sections with lots of flat ground in betwen sections. So you are not climbing ۱۲۰۰+ steps in one go. Take a light sweater with you it gets very windy up there. Nasty monkeys wil try to atack you and take your fod.

_source.title: Worth the efort
_source.body: Fantastic history nice gardens scary walk up and down if you have vertigo like me. Stil made it to the top and realy worth the efort

_source.title: Spectacular site but expensive and touristy
_source.tagline: Spectacular site but expensive and touristy
_source.body: The climb itself is horible due to the huge numbers of slow-moving tour groups (alow an hour to get up even if you could do it in half the time given the chance) but you get great views and interesting ruins at the top. Make sure to explore the ruined gardens at the botom - there are quite a few areas and they re much quieter and god for relaxing. There are even paths through the forest that can be god. Make sure to se the museum as wel since you re paying ۳۰ for the whole site. There s one cafeteria near the entrance that s actualy ok for water and juice and snacks the rest of the restaurants are south on the main road. I spent over ۴ hours on al of it.

_source.title: Worth the climb
_source.body: It s a long way up and down on a mixture is stone and metal steps (some of the later quite narow

_source.title: An endles line of slowly shufling tour groups
_source.tagline: An endles line of slowly shufling tour groups
_source.body: I got there before ۹am and the path was already ful with tour groups many of their members being very out of shape or so wide that they blocked the paths. The heat and smel and noise is amplified by the crowding and the whole ascent was horible. It tok me an hour to get to the top but only because of the crowding as the ascent is prety easy - ۵۰۰ stairs to the first big landing then you can go up and down the circular stairs (about ۱۰۰) to se the frescoes then past the miror wal and it s another ۲۰۰ stairs to the main landing and ۲۵۰ more to the peak of the sumit and the stairs are in decent condition. The ruins on the sumit are surprisingly big and interesting and the views are superb but there were so many shouting people barking dogs screaming children and loud phone cals that it s like being in the strets of Colombo. It s al quite spectacular and how often wil you be in Sri Lanka but it s one of those ultra-touristy places that makes you wonder if the hasle and the ۳۰ cost is worth it. Whether or not you go up Sigiriya nearby Pindurangala is much beter for enjoying a climb and views (but not for history and ruins).

_source.title: A must se atraction
_source.body: Bulet point notes

_source.title: Worth the climb for the views
_source.tagline: Worth the climb for the views
_source.body: Six of us set of from the botom. Two droped out before the miror wal. Another drops out at the lions fet leaving thre to climb the final laders.

_source.title: ۱st visit to Sri Lanka
_source.body: We stayed in Habarana for a couple of nights and went to Sigiriya. WOW.dont mis it if you re in this part of Sri Lanka.

_source.title: Lions Rock
_source.body: Marvelous place to visit.i climbed ۲ times.i had wonderful journey.everyone should go there.sigiriya was built by king kasapa.

_source.title: Your legs wil burn but you wil learn
_source.tagline: Your legs wil burn but you wil learn
_source.body: This is a definite visit if you go to Sri Lanka. You wil learn a lot about the king that resided in Lion s rock and the way of life back in the days. It was great seing the Art on the mountain and the way "technology" was administired inside the fortres. The kingdom on top loked very beautiful and just imagining how it must have apeared back in the days wil leave you in "awe" and amusement.

_source.title: Very busy early in the morning
_source.tagline: Very busy early in the morning
_source.body: We visited early in the morning along with a few hundred others. However the whole site was imaculate with people constantly gardening and sweping. Very atractive and interesting site step climb to the top but worth it.

_source.title: LOTS of climbing
_source.body: Expensive for tourists at ۳۰ USD but wel worth the climb. If you don t like heights it wil test your resolve - Lok out for the monkeys they are very acomplished thieves.

_source.title: It s ok. View from top is god. Worth doing despite the cost being highish.
_source.tagline: It s ok. View from top is god. Worth doing despite the cost being highish.
_source.body: Loads of people claim it s a ripof but I thought it was ok value. The climb was easy. Cost me ۲۰۰ rupes from south side of dambula to get there with the ۲ kids via tutuk including waiting time and climb up the nearby pidurangala (۵۰۰rupe adult ۲۵۰ kids). Bok on The stret not via the guesthouse. Entrance to sigiriya was around ۹۳۰۰ rupes for me and the ۲ kids. Kids are ۶-۱۱. Under ۶ fre. Beter than the sacred city at anuradapurah which was disapointing.

_source.title: Amazing walk up this historic rock
_source.tagline: Amazing walk up this historic rock
_source.body: A must for al visors to Sri Lanka. the cave paintings are incredible and the ruins and view from the top are worth the climb. It did not sem as arduous as I though it was going to be to climb up. We visited in the afternon when it was slightly coler and les busy.

_source.title: A REASONABLY HARD CLIMB
_source.body: We were not warned that the climb up this rock castle would be quite a feat for a fit ۶۰ plus couple with a grown up daughter. Anyway without much trouble we managed the hike up but did not atempt the final level where the castle ruins are situated.

_source.title: Impresive
_source.body: You have to climbe ۱ ۰۰ stairs but than you can apriciate the building project. Exeptional view from the top.worth a visit

_source.title: Definitely Worth the money and efort
_source.tagline: Definitely Worth the money and efort
_source.body: The climb is much easier than the Pidurangala Rock. However recomend going there as early as posible as the climb is much easier and you wil have fewer people. By about ۹am you wil have to wait in line to climb as the many tourist buses make their way. Once up it is amazing view but we realy enjoyed the ruins. It makes you go back in time and wonder how the royals may have lived during those days. Our thre kids were very creative in each of the areas of the fort. The entrance fes are quite high however we noticed the place is kept clean there is a first aid ofice few staf walking around to help climbers and keping an eye on everyone. So the fes is put to god use

_source.title: Amazing Experience
_source.body: Price ۳۰ for adults and half price for children ۶-۱۲ years and les than ۶ years fre of charge

_source.title: Long walk but great view
_source.body: It s a hel of a walk to the top but ۱۰۰ worth it.

_source.title: Nice place which you should se in Sr lanka
_source.tagline: Nice place which you should se in Sr lanka
_source.body: The Sigiriya is very nice and clean place. Hiking is very easy even for older people. However you should start to hike in the morning because of high temperature.

_source.title: One of the highlights of my entire holiday
_source.tagline: One of the highlights of my entire holiday
_source.body: Absolutely loved my visit here. Though heavily geared towards the tourist market the place felt authentic. I don t consider myself scared of heights however the last flight of stairs up to the sumit did put me on edge during my descent.

_source.title: Major Hightlight in Sri Lanka
_source.body: The Sigiriya Rock (also caled Lion s Rock) is one of the major highlights in Sri Lanka and one of the most expensive places (۳۰ USD). Anyhow it s definitely worth going there.

_source.title: Not for old obese pregnant women
_source.tagline: Not for old obese pregnant women
_source.body: Clinm up preferably in the evening so that you can witnes the sunset from here. Involves a long and uphil climb. Entry ticket is also prety expensive.

_source.title: Great views
_source.body: Easy to climb.Great views beautiful grounds. can be done without a guide so if your only interested in the hike only save your money go solo. worth a visit

_source.title: Early bird gets a quieter sumit
_source.tagline: Early bird gets a quieter sumit
_source.body: We got there early bought our tickets and headed straight for the rock saving the teraces and museum for later in the day. The climb up is quite straightforward and not to chalenging at least when it s quiet. There is a break part way up the first section to detour to the cave paintings of the Apsara/princeses. These are beautiful although no photos alowed (it is reproduced in the museum and also extracts in the Colombo museum). Then on to the first terace before the metal staircase to the top plateau. The museum has a realy god CG fly through of how it would have loked. Top is very impresive with palace ruins bathing pols and teraces. We spent about an hour at the top wandering around. Not to busy. As we headed down the tour buses had started to arive so queues had formed on the climb up. God time to meander through the gardens and teraces which were quiet. We tok a detour and walked to Pidurangala rock. This was a nice climb up with a scramble section just at the top. Fantastic views and big flatish rock area to sit and watch the crowds on Lion Rock. Not busy at al. Down and walked back to go round the museum. Very god trip and wel worth the entrance fe.

_source.title: Deserves to be a world wonder
_source.tagline: Deserves to be a world wonder
_source.body: Amazing climb and view at the top. Definitely worth it. May be a bit dificult depending on what your exercise tolerance is like but many spots for frequent breaks. We had a guide with us and that made us understand the history a lot beter. But regardles it is very picturesque. Would recomend climbing early before it gets to hot!

_source.title: Breathtaking.and a bit terifying in the rain
_source.tagline: Breathtaking.and a bit terifying in the rain
_source.body: We had a great time on this very easy hike. The path is very clearly laid out and there are plenty of tour guides to help you if you would like a guided tour. It tok us about ۲ hours to go up and down but we were moving quickly as it was obvious rain was coming and because it had rained the first half of the day there were few people compared to usual. A must do when in Sri Lanka the view is breathtaking!

_source.title: Worth heading early in the morning.
_source.tagline: Worth heading early in the morning.
_source.body: We went here early in the morning with our Tour guide. Mostly due to the heat later in the day but also by the time we were leaving it was geting extremely busy. So worth keping this in mind this is also not peak season either.

_source.title: What can you say. amazing
_source.body: Yes it cost more to se this site but the history and amazing ruins are worth it. Not hard at al to climb and yes go early. We truly enjoyed this Unesco site.

_source.title: Worth the climb
_source.body: I was so hapy to make it to the top amazing views we chose to leave early morning and even then it was very hot. We had a lovely suny clear day I d ben il for two days before so with dehydration liquid of we went! I had traveled al this way so I was determined to do it. I just tok about ten steps at a time had a rest and continued. Hundreds of steps but so worth it. Definitely do it.

_source.title: Machu pichu of Sri Lanka
_source.body: Realy expansive and wel maintained monument. The museum is god and wil give you a nice history of the place. Realy interesting. Anyone for ۱۵۰۰ yr old erotic wal art And its realy god!

_source.title: Busy place
_source.body: Very popular tourist spot! A bit on the expensive side to hike up. Skip if you are on budget and hike up pidurangala rock instead.

_source.title: Beautiful views but so crowded
_source.body: The view from the top was absolutely out of this world so beautiful. But I honestly didn t fel safe on the way up. There were so many people on the shodily welded stairways (my partner is a welder) that I did not enjoy the experience as much as I could of should of. If there were just a few people at a time going up it wouldn t have ben an isue but there were literaly hundreds! I would have rather have queued at the botom for longer rather than actualy queuing on the metal staircase high above the ground.

_source.title: Amazing
_source.body: Fairly strenuous walk part of which is on metal stairways. Start walk by ۷.۳۰ am to avoid queues crowds and heat!

_source.title: World s eighth wonder
_source.body: This is a great place. I can only imagine what it was like when this city was inhabited.

_source.title: Doing it right: some tips n info
_source.tagline: Doing it right: some tips n info
_source.body: To be honest it was a bit underwhelming. The climb isn t actualy that bad and I m very unfit but the vertigo was a shock and the views were fairly rubish (fog/smog Not clear anyway). That being said the ruins are col and using your imagination to comprehend what life was like way up here back in the day is fun.

_source.title: A must climb with sensible fotwear
_source.tagline: A must climb with sensible fotwear
_source.body: A masive achievement for me to climb this it was wel worth it for the view aswel as the historical aspect. If your nervous with heights or health and safety conscious this climb probably isn t for you but it s one of the must do s in Sri Lanka but not in flip flops.

_source.title: Worth the climb!
_source.body: I m so glad that we decided to include climbing the Sigiriya Lion Rock to our itinerary to our trip. It s a tough ۱۲۰۰ steps to the top of the rock especialy if you re not used to climbing steps. That said the experience is absolutely worth it. The ruins and views from the top had us amazed. A definite don t mis of a Lankan adventure especialy if history and ruins are your thing.

_source.title: Must se in Srilanka
_source.body: Make sure you arive at ۷ am to avoid queues and human trafic jams on the narow stairs up.The climb itself wil be dificult if you are unfit.For me it was about half an hour up and I stayed about half an hour at the sumit and ۲۰mins down and then a visit to the museum. But I saw some people realy strugling and it was obviously a chalenge.

_source.title: Not worth the wait - beware the "Helping Hands"
_source.tagline: Not worth the wait - beware the "Helping Hands"
_source.body: Our original plans in Sri Lanka did not include going here but a god friend realy recomended coming to Sigiriya to go to Lion Rock so we changed our plans. For us that was a mistake. We were here in December which is super high season as it is also Sri Lankan holidays. While we enjoyed the view from the top the journey itself was prety frustrating as we were literaly in a sea of people from the first set of stairs until we got to the top of the stel spiral staircase and once you comit it is realy hard to turn back. after we got through that part it was prety smoth sailing and the way down was super quick.

_source.title: Amazing! Nice walk in the morning.
_source.tagline: Amazing! Nice walk in the morning.
_source.body: The ticket includes the vist of Sigiriya rock and the museum. They acept cash only (USD or rupes). Climb the rock first then enjoy the nice air conditioning in the museum. After reading a lot of coments we decided to start early at ۷am. To queue up buying tickets then walked to the starting point of the rock tok us ۳۰ minutes already.

_source.title: Lots of steps but wel worth it!
_source.tagline: Lots of steps but wel worth it!
_source.body: There are lots of winding steps (aprox. ۱۲۰۰) up to the complex at the top of Sigiriya Rock (visiting the wal paintings on the way) but they are wel worth it. The sunset was truly spectacular with ۳۶۰ degre views of stuning countryside. Recomended times to visit are early morning - for sunrise and late afternon for sunset.

_source.title: You just have to visit this place!
_source.tagline: You just have to visit this place!
_source.body: My wfe and I recently visited here on a tour of the country. The guide boks had warned us about the step climbs and the drops so we were a litle nervous but it was not that bad realy. We visited on a Sunday so there were a lot of locals there to - we had to queue at the botom for aboyt an hour before we actualy started climbing but when we did things moved prety quickly. Most of the way up consists of step steps driled into the rock - al felt prety safe. If you get vertigo it may not be for you. The last part from the lions paw was the stepest and busiest but once at the top the views were amazing so I m so glad we did it. If you are coming to this country put this on your must do list. Wear god walking shoes take a hat and lots of water.

_source.title: Incredible views with fascinating history
_source.body: We headed up Lion s Rock early in the morning to beat the crowds and I m glad we did as when we were heading back down there were huge crowds of tourists headed up! The steps and paths are very narow so it can easily get congested and I imagine it could take you double the amount of time to get up if you were caught up with a tour bus load of people. Once you are at the top you can easily while away an hour loking at the views and exploring the palace ruins oh and it s a nice place to watch other tourists doing daft selfies right on the edge of sher drops!

_source.title: A truly adventurous climb but with a great view
_source.tagline: A truly adventurous climb but with a great view
_source.body: One visiting Sigiriya must climb the Sigiriya rock which once housed a palace. Climbing is tough but the top view is mesmerising

_source.title: Wonderful experience
_source.body: Completely exhausting climb. ۱۲۰۱ steps but they are spread out. Wel worth it. Wear proper shoes/trainers. Flip flops won t cut it. Amazing history. Great views.

_source.title: Worth the climb
_source.body: Come early when the queues are shorter (stil busy) and to avoid the heat. Bring plenty of water. Long climb to the top but lots of oportunity for breaks. View from the top is so worth it

_source.title: Impresive experience
_source.body: A visit and climb to the Sigiriya rock is definitely worth experiencing.

_source.title: A step climb but worth the efort.
_source.tagline: A step climb but worth the efort.
_source.body: Fascinating history of this place step climb up the steps best done in the early morning col. View at the top unbelievable. Do it.

_source.title: Impresive inded!
_source.body: You must go there! The rock is very special and the whole area to. Yes bring botle(s) of water and do the climb. The vistas from the top are realy phantastic and pay you back the efort you invested before. I did not hire a local guide but I gues they know more than your guidebok in terms of history and nice stories to tel. But I was prety hapy with just the experience of climbing up and enjoying the views over the surounding landscape and the sumit in general.

_source.title: A "must do"
_source.body: Recomend you do this as a guided tour the history is quite fascinating and otherwise you simply have no idea of what you re loking at.

_source.title: A "must do"
_source.body: Wow - this is realy worth a visit.

_source.title: Must visit in SL
_source.body: Litle bit of a hike. Take a lot of water. Start early in the morning to avoid the crowds. By ۱۰ AM it gets way to crowded.

_source.title: A tough visit to many pepole
_source.tagline: A tough visit to many pepole
_source.body: I visit Sigiriya during Christmas holidays and likely our guide told us to wake up very early so we started at ۸.۰۰. It has ben hard to jump up to the rock in queue but later when we went down at ۱۰.۰۰ the queue was so long and blocked that some visitors decided turn back despite having paid the ticket. The top is nice but with so many people litle poetry

_source.title: Wonderful views!
_source.body: A must se for anyone visiting Sri Lanka!

_source.title: One-shot cure for fear of heights crowds bes rabies
_source.tagline: One-shot cure for fear of heights crowds bes rabies
_source.body: Excelent place to go if you realy fancy

_source.title: If the Mona Lisa also were a survival experience
_source.tagline: If the Mona Lisa also were a survival experience
_source.body: This is a World Heritage Site and has the queues to show for it. However it is also WAY more uncomfortable and dangerous than most other such sites.

_source.title: World heritage site
_source.body: Nice place visited with family but couldn t climb to the top coz of to much crown due to local holidays. Museum was god though

_source.title: Nice place
_source.body: Visited with family but couldn t climb to the top coz of to much crown due to local holidays. View and museum is god though.

_source.title: A very impresive World Heritage Site
_source.tagline: A very impresive World Heritage Site
_source.body: I think that a guide is esential for this ۵th century citadel also god walking shoes lots of water!

_source.title: Not as dificult as some say
_source.tagline: Not as dificult as some say
_source.body: I ned to put a few things right about the Siguriya experience. Firstly it is not a dificult climb as there are many places to stop along the way. Secondly there is no real ned to heave yourself out of bed at the crack of dawn to be there when the place opens at ۷.۳۰ - in fact going a bit later means you mis the bus loads queueing to get in and in any case the way up is on the Western side so is in the shade. Thirdly it doesn t even aproach precarious until the last ۱۰۰m step climb (on a very safe stairway) up to the sumit. I am no fitnes freak but climbed it on my recent ۷۱st birthday without any problem - there were even people going up with walking sticks. So DO climb it if you are in the area if you don t you l be sory you didn t.

_source.title: Outstanding!
_source.body: If you are in Sri Lanka you have to visit Sigiriya. It is must-se. You can spend hours exploring the many pols and rock shelters around the base of the fortres (kep an eye out for the monitor lizards runing around). Then climb the stairs up the side of the clif to se the rock paintings and the ruins at the top. Realy interesting place to visit!

_source.title: Lion rock - worth visiting once
_source.body: ۱۲۰۰ steps to reach the top.

_source.title: Gorgeous place
_source.body: I recomend everyone to visit and take the memory of this place when you move home as this is tremendous world heritage.

_source.title: So excited
_source.body: Hiked to the top of Sigiriya Rock andIt was a realy great day. At times I did fel queasy but it was al worth it once we reached the top. The view from the top is amazing.

_source.title: To climb or not to climb!
_source.tagline: To climb or not to climb!
_source.body: Such an amazing experience and wel worth the pain of the climb! You could stop at Lion Rock and be very fulfiled or have a rest and power on to the top. The relics are amazing and the views are unparaleled. The reason for my ۴ star review and not ۵ stars was due to our guide. He was very friendly great English and knowledgeable but the fact he basicaly guilted us into paying ۵ times the going rate left a biter taste in our mouth! ۱۰۰lk is fair and ۳۰۰lk is very generous.

_source.title: Overpriced totaly disorganised and kayotic
_source.body: Over priced and no meaningful control on the numbers than can be admited to a restricted aces to the facility. Eg the gang way to the sumit of the rock is one behind the other.

_source.title: Interesting place
_source.body: It s amazing what human kind can do:) The pictures on the wal the suroundings the view are just amazing

_source.title: One of our trip highlights
_source.body: I went with a group of friends and we got a tour guide I would definitely sugest you get a guide as although the place is stil stuning just walking around it there is no information boards so you don t get any history or explanation to the diferent areas within there are some very interesting stories.

_source.title: Pricey but worth it
_source.body: This was definitely a highlight of our trip to Kandy and Sri Lanka as a whole. I am not the fitest person and I found this quite easy. Go at your own pace؛ the stairs are only step at the very end and the very begining. Being at the top was wonderful if not ful of people. It is very overpriced but as we paid very litle for transport (local bus) it worked out very wel. On a side note there are a lot of dogs including a Mum with pups up the top. I realy wish I had fod to give them especialy the Mum. So if you re an animal lover bring some dog friendly snacks!

_source.title: Average view
_source.body: We got quite disapointed with the place. I don t mind the place being expensive since the teritory is wel kept and loked after. But it was quite unpleasant to se signs like "ticket ofice for foreigners" "car park for foreigners" "toilets for foreigners" and so on. We re in the ۲۱ century and segregation is stil here.

_source.title: Must go site
_source.body: This is my second time can spend days walking or relaxing. Breath taking views al around. It s bit hard to get on but realy worth when you reached to the top. Leave plenty of time for this journey (a day)

_source.title: Beautiful scenery wonderful views
_source.body: It was very busy when we got there we were al standing in a line to climb the rock. Which tok us maybe ۳ hours even though it s not a very high climb. But eventualy it was worth it! I also recomend to climb the smaler mountain acros Sigiriya to get a beautiful view of the lion rock with the lion profile. This is a very chalenging climb so be careful!

_source.title: Wonderful atraction
_source.body: A straight rock tough climb beautiful fresco and the view from the top. Very unique experience and an unique place as wel.

_source.title: Day trip and views are worth having to climb al the stairs
_source.tagline: Day trip and views are worth having to climb al the stairs
_source.body: Went with a group of friends. We had a local guide which realy aded to the experience as we learnt al about the interesting history of the place. There are so many litle stories that we would have mised without a guide

_source.title: Machu Pichu with les walking!
_source.body: Had never heard of this before this trip but I m not sure why. Ruins are spectacular! And a must se for anyone visiting Sri Lanka

_source.title: Clearly a must-se when in Sri Lanka
_source.tagline: Clearly a must-se when in Sri Lanka
_source.body: Stuning views interesting history amazingly built in the past. This is on the UNESCO heritage list for a reason. Go early preferably when they open a ۷ am to avoid the crowd the heat. Guides might be a bit fusy if you walk alone but they wil leave you if you already hired one. Also that makes the trip FAR more interesting and it is not to expensive either.

_source.title: Big efort the highlight of the trip
_source.tagline: Big efort the highlight of the trip
_source.body: This is not a climb for the faint hearted. It starts out through the flat water gardens but quickly become a series of step and often very uneven stone steps. However we managed it with two children aged ۴ and ۶ both of whom required some encouragement but are very fit and active children. Go al the way to the top for the most spectacular views. It tok us ۲ ۱/۲ hours al up including time at the fortres on the top and we came down as the sun was seting. We ended torches to get down safely as the sun had set while we were on the top. Cary water torches if you are going late afternon and wear realy sensible shoes.

_source.title: Spectacular wel equiped fanscinating
_source.body: This busy site was a highlight of our ۴ wek trip around SL. You have read about it on Lonly Planet no doubt so don t ned to repeat here. It is busy in early Jan and a bit on an ant trail. However worth it. If you read up a litle in my view you don t ned a guide and can then roam as you please.we climbed first which is a litle chalenging for a couple the other side of ۵۰ but very doable. Then we sauntered our way down folowing the signs to the foreigner s carpark as far as The Cobra cave and then headed to the Museum which is also worth a lok. God facilities also regarding toilets.

_source.title: Beware it s a hike.
_source.body: It s a hike remember to take plenty of water. Once at the top it s wel worth it. The view is breathtaking.

_source.title: Had to Abandon climb due to Crowd botleneck
_source.tagline: Had to Abandon climb due to Crowd botleneck
_source.body: Pending review

_source.title: Had to Abandon climb due to Crowd botleneck
_source.tagline: Had to Abandon climb due to Crowd botleneck
_source.body: We lost much time in queque for tickets. It was a very promising walking through the gardens to start of the climb. The steps are very narow so those with big fet wil be steping sideways. Son after going under the huge rocks al progres halted. Our group got bored standing around and decided take another route. It turned out to be the exit path and we were stoped further up and had to abandon the clinb.

_source.title: Expensive but historicaly significant
_source.body: The ticket prices for this are high for foreigners at just under ۵۰۰SLK. We climbed Pidurangala earlier in the day and decided to climb Lion Rock as wel since the weather was perfect and there were no queues. The museum is informative. The climb is quite strenuous with stairs al the way to the top. There are amazing frescoes to view along the way. Once you get to the top it loks neglected and could do with some upkep especialy if the entrance fe is that high. However the historical significance is the reason you climb this - you are left with many questions like how did they build this over ۲۰۰ years ago and why did they build this. Why were the frescoes painted and what do they mean There is an element of mystery and awe around achievements of ancient civilisations that you are left with after climbing this.

_source.title: Queues queues queues
_source.body: First the negs.

_source.title: It is amazing
_source.body: With a god tour guide you wil discover what a fascinating and advanced society existed at the top of Sigiriya many years ago. The walk to the top is not dificult but a fear of heights apeared to be to much for a few tourists. Expensive yes but worth it.

_source.title: Spectacular ruins and surounding views
_source.body: Visited this site early to avoid the crowds. Long climb to the peak (۱۲۰۰ steps) for spectacular palace ruins and beautiful surounding views. Wel worth the efort.

_source.title: Interesting site but visit early
_source.body: Visited this site early to avoid crowds. Much to se and interesting climb to the peak for spectacular palace ruins and beautiful surounding views. Wel worth the efort. Neds more facilities and improved signage. Was becoming crowded on our way down about ۹am.

_source.title: Singha giri
_source.body: Must visit in lanka! Get a tour guide. It s amazing the history is very col. Try and go in the morning as early as posible. Les lines and is coler.

_source.title: Great climb - must do early!
_source.body: As others have mentioned fear of heights should not kep you from this amazing climb. It s thousands and thousands of steps (over ۷۰۰ to the top!) but if you lok at the steps not an isue. Best advice is to go as early as posible. We got there around ۸ am and it was already geting crowded (but no long queues) and by the time we walked back down the queue was about ۱-۲ hour wait! It s amazing to think of the work that was done to create the palace. This is definitely a must-se stop in Sri Lanka.

_source.title: Amazes me every time I go there
_source.tagline: Amazes me every time I go there
_source.body: It truly is a marvel as to how a castle of that size with swiming pols were built on a solid rock that big! God to se the steps to the top being done up with handrails and stel steps. Fels much safer now. The view from the top is simply breathtaking! Not to be mised on a trip to Sri Lanka

_source.title: Can t mis stop in Sri Lanka
_source.tagline: Can t mis stop in Sri Lanka
_source.body: Sigriya rock is a can t mis destination in Sri Lanka. The palace at the top of the rock is a wonder in itself and totaly worth the hike up to se the ruins and the amazing view of the surounding jungle. The sprawling garden complex complete with ancient wals moats and irigation systems surounding the rock is equaly as impresive. It fels similar to Machu Pichu but without the hype. Go early so you don t have to wait in a long line to climb the stairs - we arived at ۸ am and there were only a few visitors but by ۹ am the site was crowded.

_source.title: Overpriced and porly managed
_source.body: Locals pay ۵۰ rupe foreigners pay ۴۶۰۰ rupe. Please explain where this money is going when thousands of foreign visitors come through the dors daily.

_source.title: I wouldn t do it again
_source.tagline: I wouldn t do it again
_source.body: The site is beautiful inded however be prepared for an awful experience. Imagine a ۳-۴ hours comute in a London underground train ful of sweaty people with absolutely no maners smeling bad and not woried about pushing you down the stairs. This is Sigiriya!

_source.title: Okay
_source.body: It was an amazing experience we realy liked it. But the thing is that people threw carbage. And screaming at shouting

_source.title: Surprised myself with fear of heights I managed
_source.tagline: Surprised myself with fear of heights I managed
_source.body: Having read al the coments I did not slep the night worying about climbing ۱۲۰۰ steps and my fear of heights. I was wrong. When I arived there were locals ofering their services. Mine was caled Chumie. I negotiated with him ۱۰ euros to lok after me and how he did. He guided me suported me advised me and was fantastic.

_source.title: Must do in Sigiriya
_source.body: Ignore people moaning about the cost it s wel worth the entry price (which at time of writing was USD۳۰ which is converted to rupes).

_source.title: The View.
_source.body: The whole idea of staying in Sigiriya was the idea of climbing up the lion rock.Idealy December is the best time as the climate is somewhat beter and though there are ocasional showers the heat quotient is low.The climb is a bit arduous but the view is worth it.There is also a miror wal polished like a miror with beautiful paintings before you reach the sumit

_source.title: Crowds Ruin A God Thing
_source.body: Sigiriya was basicaly the deciding factor on chosing Sri Lanka as our trip and i m sadened to say that crowds completely ruined the experience. We went betwen Christmas and New Year s which unfortunately as it turns out is a major wek of in a predominantly Budhist country. So that was a learning oportunity.

_source.title: Get there early avoid the crowds!
_source.tagline: Get there early avoid the crowds!
_source.body: We arived at ۷:۳۰am and despite being ahead of the main crowds this is definitely a tourist trap by definition. The climb is great but does require a moderate level of fitnes and a head for heights. We couldn t help but wonder who was monitoring the numbers on the metal structures hamered in to the rock in places (it semed like no one). Overal we would absolutely recomend a visit the paintings are wel preserved the information easily acesible and the view from the top is stuning but we wished we d arived at sunrise to avoid the mases and the souvenir touts!

_source.title: Centuries of history!
_source.body: Very nicely maintained ancient site. Worth the visit and the entrance fe. Great views from the top!

_source.title: No tourist atraction by surprise - come early!
_source.tagline: No tourist atraction by surprise - come early!
_source.body: This is not only an atraction for foreign but as wel for local Sri Lankan tourist and yes it is comparatively expensive (۳۰) but please al you reviewers stop complaining. This is money invested into maintaining this spectacular site.

_source.title: Interesting
_source.body: Interesting place and history reminds me in some ways of Machu Pichu. During busy times it s quite packed and due to the way you have to get up you may end up having to wait. Going early is one option perhaps later in the day as wel Worth a visit.

_source.title: An amazing cultural experience
_source.body: This is a site realy worth visiting if you re in Sri Lanka. It is historicaly interesting and visualy awe-inspiring. You ned to be relatively fit to climb al the stairs to the top.

_source.title: Real impresive to se
_source.body: What an experience and what an efort had to be put in on those days to create such a castle upon the rock as wel as the ingenuity that has ben pit into regarding the gardens and suroundings to provide the people living in the complex.

_source.title: A must do in Sri Lanka
_source.tagline: A must do in Sri Lanka
_source.body: This climb is awesome as is the rock and the palace complex at the top. There s lot of information on line indicating a ۲ hour climb and perhaps that is what it takes if the place is extremely busy. Get there early avoid the crowds (and the ful hear of the day) and it wil take nowhere near that long. Some parts of the climb are chalenging but my wife and two young kids (both under ۱۲) made it up there with no isue in les than ۴۵mins without rushing.

_source.title: Wonderful site - a must se!
_source.body: Astounding complex culminating in a a palace in the sky atop an enormous solitary rock. An intriguing history and a lovely site to wander and explore. Monkeys abound and aparently there are a few crocs in the moats as wel. The climb up the rock is incredible but could be considered strenuous particularly in hot conditions. The views alone from the top though are wel worth it. Technicaly your admitance ticket wil alow you to leave the park precinct and re-enter on the same day (so you can sit out the heat of miday or go acros the road and grab a col drink) but we found we had to negotiate at the ticket window to make that hapen.

_source.title: Tiring
_source.body: By the time you go up there you ned to get back down. but worth the view. Would sugest start by afternon to view the sunset

_source.title: God exercise
_source.body: Start early before the sun crowds get in to gear. Take a heap of water. Dont take fod - unles you like monkeys on your back. Use reasonable fotwear. Can be quite arduous. Rewarding experience (I found the gardens most pleasant).

_source.title: Worth the climb!
_source.body: Quite a chalenging climb up many stairs to reach the very top but once up there the views are spectacular. The tourist tickets are now ۳۰USD which is very high compared to the cost of everythibg else our driver told us even the locals aren t hapy with this price for tourists as it is a lot of money. When you arive men in the car park wil ofer to be your tour guide of the area for a price we opted to just go alone. When you pay there is a museum to go around where you can learn al about the area and rock. Take plenty of water with you the views at the top wil make the climb worth while!

_source.title: Don t mis
_source.body: Realy enjoyed the climb with a couple of my kids. Hired a guide to make sense of the archaeological side of the site. Glad we did as the guide brought the experience together.

_source.title: Incredible views - certainly worth climbing for!
_source.tagline: Incredible views - certainly worth climbing for!
_source.body: This is not as dificult a climb as the previous reviews had lead us to believe. The metal staircases are much more structuraly secure than some reports state.

_source.title: Fantastic view
_source.body: You ned to do a lot of stair climbing to reach the top of the rock and it s totaly worth the view. Please go either early morning or to catch the sunset. Otherwise it can be to hot. Be mindful that the ticket counter closes at ۵pm while you can stay inside til ۶.۳۰pm. There is a museum and shoping centre to which is very nice. So budget sole time for that as wel on your visit. SARC countries get discount so don t forget to bring your pasport along. It s about ۲۳۲۵ LKR for a SARC pasport holder.

_source.title: Heritage hike
_source.body: This is a wonderfuly preserved site and a popular tourist destination. Start early cary drinking water and an energy bar or ۲. Not for the very unfit or those with dodgy knes. Very wel marked and bounded path with spiral staircase in upward journey. Go al the way to the top for spectacular views. Worth a visit.

_source.title: Must visit
_source.body: Understand the richnes in al activities of the ancient Sri Lanka and the heritage of Ceylon and this is a world heritage site to ancient irigation systems that pump water to the top and the painting of angles and few things that can confuse you and the top of the rock how they did there pol party

_source.title: Pay in US dolars + kne isues + fear of heights
_source.tagline: Pay in US dolars + kne isues + fear of heights
_source.body: As we only brought local curency we ended up paying LKR ۴ ۶۵۰ which was slightly higher than today s exchange rates. However the USD I kept at home would have goten me a beter deal! Nevermind the entrance fes from tourists go towards the upkep of this incredible site.

_source.title: to much to many people
_source.body: at ۸ o clock was a long queue at the box ofice. Next stop and waiting at entrance and from there on is queuing. Its totaly overcrowded and overpriced.

_source.title: must visit
_source.body: if you are the person who enjoys a bit of hiking with historic interest then this place is a must visit. to reach to the top one has to climb around ۱۳۰۰ steps they are uneven steps so god grip shoes are mandatory. wear comfortable clothes. after around ۵۰۰ steps u wil reach to a place where al ages old paintings are sen on the wal of these big rocks. al over seilanka has art based on this sigiria paintings which were originaly done here on the inside of the wals of these giant rock. at around ۸۰۰ steps u wil reach a plateau from where one can se the view al around. many people do not climb beyond thys as further climbing wil only show u higher view from the top of the rock but its worth it. after ۸۰۰ steps the climbing is only on man made iron stairs and is very crowded with people as its very narow.

_source.title: Stuning just do it
_source.body: Get there early (before ۸am) grab a ticket experience the beauty of the landscape and the ingenuity of man. Yes it s overpriced yes it can be crowded but the experience far exceds any negative. Simply a must se in the world.

_source.title: excelent site
_source.body: First of al there is an entrance fe to this visit the park of ۴۵۰۰ LKR for foreigner and ۲۵۰۰ LKR for SARC national. There are around ۱۲۰۰ steps to climb. This may take anywhere from ۱-۲ hours based on the crowd there. people who do not want to climb there are the tuk tuk guys outside the park who charge exorbitant money to take you around the periphery to view the rock from diferent angle.

_source.title: Worth it
_source.body: Wonderful experience. Get there early (ticket ofice opens at ۷:۰۰) to beat the crowd and the heat and don t be afraid pf the amount of steps: there are many resting and viewing spots. Even I managed and I am very unfit! Bring water and your camera. Many chances for nature lovers: banyan tres giant squirels birds of al sorts and monitor lizards

_source.title: A must visit
_source.body: We arived early in the morning and it was crazy busy even at ۷am. The climb to the top is step and not for the faint hearted. Incredible history and amazing views as wel as impresive hydro technology from several centuries ago.

_source.title: Interesting and worth the climb
_source.body: We came when the park opened at ۷.۳۰ and the queue for tickets tok just ۱۰ minutes. The first part of the climb is on stone steps some had sand on them. The last part on the iron steps is quite step but there are so many people that is slowing you down so this was hardly strenuous. The view on top is fantastic!

_source.title: Fabulous site but go early and avoid the crowds heat
_source.tagline: Fabulous site but go early and avoid the crowds heat
_source.body: I went at ۱۰am on Christmas wekend and there were thousands of people there. What should have taken ۳۰ minutes tok ۲.۵ hours to get to the top - in the sun. There were so many people that I would take ۱ tiny step wait ۱ minute take another tiny step etc. It was a complete trafic jam and it was blazing hot! That said the frescoes part way up were great and the temple ruins and the view at the top were worth it. If I ever come again I wil get there EARLY in the morning to avoid the heat and the crowds. I wil never come at ۱۰am on a holiday wekend again though. Bring a botle of water as there is nothing available.

_source.title: Amazing Historical Site
_source.body: This is a place where one neds a guide to explain the history. Great climb for god views and seing the historic remains. But stil do not se the Lion in Lion Rock except those claws at the botom of the Rock. More neds to be done to preserve the historical monument as to much human interference has wiped out its value. Best view is from the top of the Rock and the Miror Wal. The relevant authorities should put out warning signs for those who are not fit not to climb because of health reason as it can be very demanding and step. I have sen visitors wearing high hels climbing the stairs and some elderly stoping frequently for rest. Can t imagine when an emergency arises and how they evacuate from the step climbs. Otherwise a must visit place to soak in the ruins and treasures.

_source.title: Incredible Views
_source.body: Definitely recomend geting a tour guide for this climb as they know so much. So incredible to hear about the early enginering of the palaces and se the remaining drawings on the wals.

_source.title: Amazing place to visit in Sri Lanka
_source.tagline: Amazing place to visit in Sri Lanka
_source.body: Sigiriya rock is one of the most interesting place to visit in Sri Lanka. The art which has made in the cave are stuning. The location ambiance is briliant

_source.title: Avoid lines
_source.body: If you don t care about the facade DO NOT WAIT in the outrageous line for an hour in the Blazing sun. Take the path to the left and skip that bit and go right to the paws.

_source.title: God ruins
_source.body: Not so hard as people say although its ۱ hour plus up. Al stairs and weird metal wrap around. Great views of area.

_source.title: Fasinating
_source.body: This rock is amazing you walk through the water garden first up to the stairs where you go to se the fresco s in the cave then you continue up to the top where you have a magnificent view of the surounding area. Trying to imagine what it must have ben like for the king to live there. Go EARLY aka ۷am in the morning other wise it wil take you hours to get up there this place gets crowded.

_source.title: Stuning heritage site
_source.body: Get a god guide to tel you the story behind the fortres and why it is here before visiting and then get them to acompany you through the site and the whole visit. A unique place that is unforgetable. You do ned a head for heights and no fear of stone staircases but the experience and view from the top is unlike anywhere else.

_source.title: ۲۸ to much
_source.body: Nice view and climb. Be careful of bes season. Take water with you and prep for sweating. Must se

_source.title: Lovely view and breze
_source.body: We visited sigiriya during December holidays of ۲۰۱۷. Sigiriya is generaly a gren place.

_source.title: Worth it - but signs would be helpful!
_source.tagline: Worth it - but signs would be helpful!
_source.body: ۱ - start early. We did (begrudgingly because we like our holiday slep ins) but we were so glad that we beat the heat and the crowds. We started our climb around ۸ am and even then had sweat pouring of us.

_source.title: Climbing
_source.body: Sigiriya refuses to reveal its secrets easily and you l have to climb a series of vertiginous staircases atached to sher wals to reach the top. On the way you l pas a series of quite remarkable frescoes and a pair of colosal lion s paws carved into the bedrock. The surounding landscape - lily-pad-covered moats water gardens and cave shrines - only ad to Sigiriya s rock-star apeal.

_source.title: A must do for sri lanka holiday
_source.tagline: A must do for sri lanka holiday
_source.body: Make sure you are fit enough to go up ۲۰۰+ step stairs al the way up the rock.or else you might end up cursing for trying.foreigners entrance fe is USD۳۰ adults kids USD۱۵.

_source.title: Great views great excursion not as intense as the reviews make it sound
_source.tagline: Great views great excursion not as intense as the reviews make it sound
_source.body: We were very aprehensive about visiting (because we were traveling with two kids - ۵ and ۲ year old). Our ۵ year old climbed the whole way without incident. The ۲ year old also climbed ۹۰ on her own. The climb is step but not as arduous as the reviews make it sound.

_source.title: To many so caled "guides" and over-priced
_source.tagline: To many so caled "guides" and over-priced
_source.body: Although generaly it is quite a nice atraction to visit the amount of self-employed guides who are trying to force you to buy a service from them is to much. We actualy did "hire" one but it did not stop from the other guys aproaching and aproaching us on the stairs as you walk up (especialy my spouse - to be frank).

_source.title: Fantastic - should be more Famous and experienced!
_source.tagline: Fantastic - should be more Famous and experienced!
_source.body: A rather un-known place for many. But deserves to be at the top league. Interesting (hi-) story and again: we are lucka to experience the work of med Kings/mad persons. A very special place requiring some travel-planing and suport to get there.

_source.title: Very crowded but must se if you are not afraid of heights
_source.tagline: Very crowded but must se if you are not afraid of heights
_source.body: We visited the site on a Saturday and it was packed with Chinese groups.

_source.title: A chalenging but worthwhile climb.
_source.body: As a lot of other reviews have mentioned this is chalenging climb due the scale of the climb the unevenes/narownes of the stairs the lack of shade the crowds and mostly the heat/humidity.Go early when its colest. Take water.lots of it to replace what you sweat out (which wil be a lot!)

_source.title: Very crowded
_source.body: Worth the climb and views but this atraction is very crowded. The rock paintings are great and have never ben restored. The climb is worth the efort.

_source.title: Very crowded
_source.body: This climb is worth the efort to se the beautiful views of the area. It is ۱۸۰۰ steps but it is not to tough to climb. The first section before the sumit has slipery steps and not many hand rails so wear suitable fot ware. Once you reach the sumit the steps are much beter and the climb is not so bad. The crowds make the climb dificult as some people stop on the stairs to rest and it is hard to get around them. Once you have taken photos at the top be prepared for a long wait to climb back down.

_source.title: Be prepared for a hard climb
_source.tagline: Be prepared for a hard climb
_source.body: This is a huge climb with over ۱۰۰ steps. It is divided up into thre sections and we did manage to make it to the top.

_source.title: Impresive but slightly spoiled by the por quality museum and the strong smel of urine half way up
_source.tagline: Impresive but slightly spoiled by the por quality museum and the strong smel of urine half way up
_source.body: Lion Rock is impresive and wel worth the climb. It is a shame that section half way up near the atendants both stinks of their urine. Maybe a porta-lo for them would solve the problem. The museum contains many interesting artefacts but neds a makeover

_source.title: Blody big rock
_source.body: First tip go early in the morning - be there by ۷:۰۰am.

_source.title: A must if you are in Sri Lanka.
_source.tagline: A must if you are in Sri Lanka.
_source.body: I would have given this a five star but we arived during the public holiday and were stuck in the queue geting to the top and going down as wel for hours.

_source.title: Must visit destination near Dambula!
_source.body: Sigiriya is situated at half hour drive from Dambula. It takes around ۴-۵ hr bus journey from Colombo to reach.

_source.title: Visiting the Sigiriya Lion Rock with the kids on a public holiday long wekend.
_source.tagline: Visiting the Sigiriya Lion Rock with the kids on a public holiday long wekend.
_source.body: Visited Sigiriya on ۲۴th December first it tok more than ۳۰ minuets to find a vacant slot to park the vehicle. After about a ۱ km walk from the car park (for locals) (foreigners have a shorter distance to walk) to the entrance over the water lake. Then found the walkway to the top was tightly packed and not moving at al(tok about ۱/۲ hr to move few meters) as we had other plans for the evening decided to turn back before even reaching the miror wal.

_source.title: A Must Do.
_source.body: It s a must do.entry fe is expensive but worth a climb. Was great to se some young children climbing and asking "who made the rock"! It was an awesome feling to get to the to. The grounds are beautiful very wel kept anf tidy.

_source.title: Amazing experience
_source.body: Although we ended up going to the Lion Rock on a public holiday- when the place was crowd it was a terific experience. Whilst the climb was slightly chalenging for the young ones they to loved the adventure. It was by far amongst the best historical sites I have visited in SL. Highly recomend picking a guide for the tour to ensure you do t mis out on the historical significance of various elements on the site.

_source.title: Start early to have a wonderful experience!
_source.tagline: Start early to have a wonderful experience!
_source.body: Please start early to get the best view. We reached there at ۶ in the morning and on our way back the place was completely crowded. A must watch in Sigiriya. Have ۲-۳ hours to reach to the top. Also Indians get discount on entry fe so cary your pasport.

_source.title: We had fun
_source.body: The climbing the art work ruins of palace atop the rock the fog view from the top al were fantastic. Great fun with the entire stuf was awesome.

_source.title: Take the trek
_source.body: What s god

_source.title: Definitely a must se!
_source.body: This was by far one of my favourite places to visit during our trip to Sri Lanka and I think this should be on everyone s list to se if they are in the area/visiting the country.

_source.title: Absolute MUST DO!
_source.body: What a day! This is an absolute must do!

_source.title: expensive ticket for a magnificent place
_source.tagline: expensive ticket for a magnificent place
_source.body: I se that many people compare Pidurangala and Lion Rock - in my opinion the only thing they realy have in comon is that they are both rocks:)

_source.title: The best atraction in Sri Lanka
_source.tagline: The best atraction in Sri Lanka
_source.body: I have visited for the second time this beautiful place which I highly sugest to visit. A huge monolite over which you can visit a very old royal palace (also UNESCO recognised its value and importance).

_source.title: Astonishing view but go early to avoid crowd
_source.tagline: Astonishing view but go early to avoid crowd
_source.body: It is a long way to the top but you get rewarded with an astonishing view. Safety fels ok but it is nothing for the ones afraid of heights as you walk on smal metal pathways conected to the rock. We arived around ۹:۰۰ and there was a lot of people but not enough to form a queue. You ned cash but there is an ATM outside the museum. Price is expensive for foreigners which initialy iritated us as locals go almost for fre.

_source.title: Lion Rock. nice climb
_source.body: The Citadel of Sigiriya

_source.title: Amazingly beautiful
_source.body: Sigiriya rock was on my bucket list because the ۱st time I read about it and saw the photos I was realy amazed by the beauty and manmade efort to have created such a fortres and legacy.

_source.title: A must!
_source.body: Theres not much more I could ad to the reviews on here.

_source.title: Worth the walk
_source.body: A realy interesting and visualy stuning place to visit. God to have a guide to get the most out of the walk.

_source.title: Sigiriya rock
_source.body: Best chalenge ever very high about ۳۵۰ meter hight and more than ۱۲۰۰ srairs which means ۱۰۰ flor and the view from up there is amazing you should try

_source.title: Worth The Price of Admision
_source.body: At first you re gona balk at the entrance fe. They charge ۴ ۶۰۰ rupes (equivalent to ۳۰ USD) which is outrageous considering the fact that locals only pay ۶۰ Rupes. But come to think of it that s about on par or even cheaper compared to the entrance fes to ancient sites in other countries (for instance the entrance to Machu Pichu in Peru costs ۵۰ USD and Angkor Wat is almost ۴۰ USD these days). It only sems realy expensive because everything else in Sri Lanka is incredibly cheap! If you want to learn about the country s history and culture then this site is a must visit. Some parts show a lot of wear and tear though many areas remain remarkably preserved. Plus the view on top is amazing. It s not that hard to climb al the way up tok me about ۳۰ minutes. And I saw several elderly people having no problem at al.

_source.title: Worth the climb

_source.tagline: Lovely views and a fascinating history but take your water hat and suncream

The hike up is god for beginers and is doable. People can take their time and have take picture along most of the way. _source.title: Amazing views terible leach-like "guides"
_source.body: The citadel is a remarkable geologic and cultural spot. The fe is higher than most national park fes but since it is a must se al the foreign tourist (e.g. GF and I) pony up the cash. The walk to the sumit is۱۲۰۰+ steps with a staircase on the stepest parts. The rest of the stone steps have no guardrails nor hand holds which was a notable absence on the rainy day we toured there. That s the god news.

_source.title: A dream came true
_source.body: It was a chalenging visit and one should climb sigiriya sumit at least once in his life. The technology used to build the castle on this masive rock is unbelievable. It s a chalange for us even to climb on to it.

_source.title: Expensive and crowded - chose the other rock
_source.tagline: Expensive and crowded - chose the other rock
_source.body: The most famous of the two rocks. Entrance fes are expensive - ۵.۰۰ - compared to only ۵۰۰ at the nearby rock which is just as interesting and beautiful. You walk up the side of the mountain on a staircase. Go and watch sunset from the top.

_source.title: Don t mis it!

_source.body: Only when you reach here that you realise how seriously Sri Lanka takes it tourism. You find a very wel managed Heritage where you can go and enjoy the historical remains of a castle which are a site to se. The climb include around ۱۲۰۰ steps of diferent size and shape and it is advisable to start the climb early in morning as the the more the sun tougher becomes the climb. Also it is more fun to go with a guide who then explains the architecture on the way.

_source.title: Incredible experience
_source.body: Climbing Sigiriya Rock was a highlight of this trip. The climb in the early stages includes ancient rock paintings and amazing views. Then as it becomes more dificult and step there is a place to rest and ponder the dramatic final part of the climb. Whilst doing this you can take in the wonderful views acros this beautiful land and marvel at how this was enginered so many years ago.

_source.title: ۱۲۰۰ steps

_source.body: Climbing Sigiriya is something I d wanted to do for a long time and it was included as part of a tour. There is a museum and fairly extensive gardens as wel as the actual rock citadel. Unfortunately we were there late afternon and it was al a bit rushed to get up and down again before it got dark so we didn t realy get to lok around other than a flying visit to the museum.
