_source.body: There are ۲ rocks next to each other to climb: Lion rock and Pidurangala rock. The entrance fe for the Lion rock costs ۴۶۵۰ rupes (۳۰ USD) while the other one costs ۵۰۰ rupes (۳ USD). Is this a joke

_source.title: Magical journey to miracle Isle
_source.body: Early morning trasfer to Sigiriya visit the ۲۵۰۰ year old ancient fortres ruins on top oft he Lions Rock. In the afternon climb up Pidurangala rock on a litle hiking trail. On top enjoy the breathtaking view over the country and at Sigiriya rock

_source.title: You Have To Go x Everyone Does. Find Out Why
_source.tagline: You Have To Go x Everyone Does. Find Out Why
_source.body: I would be surprised if you visit SL for the ۱st time and don t have this on your agenda. The climb is surprisingly easy and before you re ready you re at the top. It s almost al stairs with a spiral staircase up the the Miror Wal.

_source.title: Worth the efort thoroughly enjoyed
_source.body: Best to start as son as the ticket both opens as it gets hot with litle shade while climbing.

_source.title: Don t mis climbing the rock
_source.tagline: Don t mis climbing the rock
_source.body: Only atempt if you are fuly mobile and healthy and not afraid of heights. The climb is hard but so very worthwhile when you reach the top.

_source.title: Wonderful experience
_source.body: This historical site has a wonderful view and not that dificult to climb to the top although carying my ۱-year-old daughter is stil a bit chalenging. It is worth al the efort after seing the wal paintings and reaching the top.

_source.title: Not for the faint hearted!
_source.body: It s a beautiful site. I couldn t make it to the top - no head for heights - but I could stil apreciate the beauty and wonder of the place.

_source.title: An awesome experience wel worth the efort.
_source.tagline: An awesome experience wel worth the efort.
_source.body: This was my ۲nd visit to Sigiriya as the first time in ۲۰۰۸ I had a bad kne so couldn t reach the top. This time I did and it was spectacular! First you have to go to the museum to buy a ticket which costs a shocking price of US ۳۵ while local people pay about ۱۰ of that. Next there is a huge area of gardens very wel-kept with lakes and pols. This leads up to the Boulder Garden where huge boulders and several caves are close to the base of the rock itself. From here you start to climb mases of flights of step steps at first and then an iron spiral staircase which goes up to the Miror Wal and the paintings of beautiful women. The paintings are gorgeous but unfortunately you re not alowed to take photos. The miror wal has lost its shine so it s hard to imagine what it loked like when it was first made hundreds of years ago. From here you have to walk along a narow path atached to the rock which is quite scary. Then it s more flights of steps up to the Lion Platform a flat area where you can buy water etc. and have a rest before the final climb. I spent about half an hour here as there were tourists from so many diferent countries al taking photos and it was realy interesting to talk and share experiences. From here there are stone steps which rise up betwen the mighty lion s paws and beyond the stone steps you reach a horible iron staircase right up to the top which is very scary inded and even worse on the way down! But it s realy worth the efort as the view from the very top is amazing. I was told that there s not much to se but that isn t true. Although the actual palace and other buildings have long gone there is so much impresive brickwork and so many staircases as diferent levels as wel as an enormous tank which loks like a large swiming pol. I spent about ۲ hours climbing around the whole area of the top and taking photos of the wonderful views to mountains lakes and forest. It rained on and of so the cloud and light efects were superb. The climb down the iron staircase was terifying but after reaching the lion platform you can walk down to the botom by a much quicker and easier route. I hoped to spend more time exploring the gardens but there was a masive rainstorm and it was geting dark so I had to hury away.

_source.title: Worth the climb
_source.body: Only ۲۰۰m high but this rock requires a bit of stamina to climb - plenty of steps (which in parts is perhaps not for the faint-hearted with no head for heights!). Great views fro the top. Very touristy and the crowds can impede progres on some of the narow steps to the top.

_source.title: Impresive Complex
_source.body: An incredible feat of ancient enginering and building. Some of the structures have ben left as discovered in ruined state but others have ben restored to show their true original quality and craftsmanship in construction. Wel worth a strol thorough this site to aproach Lion Lock.

_source.title: Great Views Wonderful History
_source.body: We visited Citadel of Sigiriya - Lion Rock on a rainy day and it was stil wonderful. I can t imagine how god the views would have ben on a suny day!

_source.title: Must do!
_source.body: It is a must-do when you re in Sri Lanka. We enjoyed the climb and stoping in betwen for rests/photos! The view from the top was priceles. Also we enjoyed the fresco paintings and the miror wal. It is also worth knowing the history behind this place. Highly recomended place to visit.

_source.title: Nice views
_source.body: The tour guides and the staf were horible and very rude but the climb was nice. There s a lot to se and take in the view from the top is pleasant. There are a lot of people who visit so it gets rather busy.

_source.title: amazing views
_source.body: amazing views from the top of lion rock you ned to be fairly fit to climb as it can be very step and not afraid of highs as you wil be climbing stairs atached to the side of the mountain but worth the climb

_source.title: Must se
_source.body: This is something you must se if you have the chance! Be aware that it is many steps to the top so have god shoes and be there early to avoid the sun.

_source.title: Incredible
_source.body: Excelent atraction. The site is beautiful and wel preserved. Started with museum/galery to give background. Climb isn t for the faint hearted as step and on rickety iron walkway! But the views going up and at the top are spectacular. I ve sen others moaning about the price (۳۰) but it s wel worth it. Spent about ۴۰mins to get up and around ۲.۵hours at the site totaly. There were children and a bus load of ۷۰+ walking up so anyone can do it though.

_source.title: Must be sen if you can
_source.tagline: Must be sen if you can
_source.body: This is a prominent rock that can be sen for miles. It is a world heritage site dating back to ۴۷۷-۴۹۵AD and it rises ۲۰۰m from the ground.

_source.title: Amazing views from top quite a climb but wel worth it!
_source.tagline: Amazing views from top quite a climb but wel worth it!
_source.body: Wel worth the climb for the views from the top! Quite step steps and I though I wouldn t make it as am a fairly unfit ۵۹ year old but my daughter persuaded me and was so worth it! Views were amazing but so was the history of the place.

_source.title: Truely a must to se
_source.body: Fantastic architecture gardens and the fortres rock with ۱۲۰۰ steps to the top i unfortunately had to decline the ascent but it loked fantastic the other went and it was great it was very crowded as it was a Sunday but stil a great experience not to be mised

_source.title: Awesome!
_source.body: The Lion Rock - Citadel of Sigiriya has a realy special shape which dominates the skyline once you re in the centre of Matale. It s nearly ۲۰۰ meters high ۱۲۰۲ to be exact steps to get up to the top with the view you wil never forget. The name of Lion Rock comes from the giant lion claws that function as an entry gate about halfway up the rock.

_source.title: Astounding
_source.body: An unbelievable place saturated in history and beautiful. I was realy woried about the climb as I don t do heights but it goes up in levels so although it s a bit of a kicker for your ticker (a chance to work of the Lion ber) it doesn t sem to hard at al. You l be surprised at how high you get without realising it. The final climb after the lions entrance is the one I woried about. Have to be honest it did make me nervous going up but coming down was surprisingly easier (I thought down would be the problem for me). Once you re at the top it s very big so you don t wory about the height but just enjoy the panoramic stuning amazing views. Don t mis the chance to experience this beautiful world heritage site. Tip: take water and wear trainers the guides were skiping up in flip flops like gazeles but you wil want to fel a god grip. The wild monkeys are a bonus!

_source.title: The great Rock
_source.body: The most powerful fortres i have ever sen in my life. This fortres have a very powerful security system. The water gardens are most fascinating atraction of this trip

_source.title: Amazing
_source.body: If you go to one place in Sri Lanka as an atraction - go here for sure. It is a litle climb. Mainly stairs. There are people who ofer to help you - if you ned some suport - an elderly person on our tour acepted the help. As always negotiate the deal first. God walkers won t ned any help. The walk itself is never boring. First you have the awesome gardens and pols. Then the stairs leading up to the ancient paintings then you tackle the sumit - to an amazing gren outlok of ancient structures and a ۳۶۰ degre view. They even have an ancient pol on the rock. We did it on a wet day with moderate clouds - but was stil amazing. Definetly a highlight of the trip!

_source.title: So much history!
_source.body: Wel worth taking the efort and walking to the top. The fact that a palace was built on and into the rock is just incredible.

_source.title: .fabulous hike.
_source.body: I m very pleased we went on this trip.the route the history and the view at the top made it al very interesting.Take some water with you.

_source.title: Sigiriya yes but don t mis out on Pidurulanga
_source.tagline: Sigiriya yes but don t mis out on Pidurulanga
_source.body: Base was Habarana for both Sigiriya and Polonaruwa and Sigirya was about ۲۰mins drive. We got a great tip from another traveler to climb both Sigirya and Pidurulanga and so glad we did so. We started at ۱۰:۳۰am sure there a god few tourist but not to busy at al.

We climbed Pidurangala rock the day after and that was way beter. From that rock you can have a great view on Sigiriya rock. I recomend Pidurangala if you only want to do one.

_source.title: Sigiriya rock fortres
_source.body: Visited Sigiriya with friends an ancient city built on a rock that towers ۲۰۰meters. Sigiriya is most famous for the period begining in the ۵th century when it was transformed into a palace fortres and pleasure garden by king Kashyapa also known as lion Rock the name of the monument indicates the way in which visitors used to begin their final ascent to the top through the jaws throat of a lion as we started climbing up we came acros many rock shelters there were some breathtaking frescos and a miror wal with fine inscriptions it tok us around ۴۵ minutes to reach the top it was a very suny day with temperatures around ۳۲degres Celsius which was a litle tiring but the breathtaking views and col breze kept us going the descent was a lot

_source.title: Amazing Climb
_source.body: Significant history of Sri Lankan kingdom behind this place. One of the Capitals in ancient times during King Kashyapa s dynasty. Entry fes for SARC countries is les than other tourists. Worth Walk/climb.

_source.title: Amazing

_source.title: Wel worth the walk
_source.body: Beautiful place to work of breakfast and climb high to enjoy the views as wel as the history and heritage of Sri Lanka.

_source.body: Chalenging hike up al the steps and stairs.take your time.but once on the top it s totaly worth it. The view of the surounding is wondering and the landscape is fascinating. There s a lot of history to this place.enjoy.it s worth the hike.

_source.title: wonderful architectural site

Not sure why ladies climb the thing with their high hels on or why elderly people chose peak hours and put themselves under a risk however it realy influences the overal impresion. Next time we would chose a mountain right next to this one which is aparently not known and we would enjoy it beter.

_source.title: Astonishing
_source.body: It s a must se if you are in Sri Lanka. There are some recomendations to folow if you want to enjoy it:

_source.title: A tremendously gorgeous monument!
_source.body: Another must visit monument and historical location surounded by nature at its best the Lion Rock is impresive and gargantuan and expensive. The entry fe is US ۳۰ and worth every peny if you climb to the top or explore the base for a few hours. Hopefuly most of that money goes to the upkep and the salaries of the many people involved in keping this mountain safe and gorgeous. The view from the top is stuning and the history of Lion Rock is colorful and variable depending on research and time.

_source.title: View is worth the climb and monkey dodging!
_source.tagline: View is worth the climb and monkey dodging!
_source.body: Fantastic views. Go very early. ۷ -۷.۳۰ if you can to avoid lots of other visitors. This wil make your pictures beter but also make for a more comfortable climb on the couple of slightly hairy parts. Takes about ۲ hour round trip. Be careful not to cary fod as monkeys can be agresive and always a risk of rabies. A must do and the ruins at the top and view are incredible.

_source.title: Stuning.
_source.body: This is such an incredible place to visit when you are in Sri Lanka. It s not for people who may strugle with heights or even those who are les mobile. The best time go is early morning before the morning sun realy starts to become fierce. make sure you get a guide and they can realy ensure you se al the best things. have water with you and pace yourself climbing the steps are there are over ۱۵۰۰ of them. But when you are at the top it s worth everything. Simply stuning!

_source.title: A proud SriLankan legacy
_source.body: This was one of the best trips I ever had.It showed the ancient heritage of Sri Lanka. A must visit for everyone.

It is a quite easy walk with a lot of steps but no ned to climb. Honestly one of the most impresive historical sites I ve sen. _source.title: Simply stuning and amazing view!
_source.body: Visited Sigiriya s Lion Rock as part of my visit to Sri Lanka in August. My experience can be sumarized below:

_source.title: Historic site with increbile views
_source.body: The walk wil come to life if you arange a guide to explain al of the features of Sigiriya otherwise known as Lion Rock. Our driver aranged a great guide (multilingual) who brought the ancient kingdom to life. Don t just listen to an electronic version of the history. The guides know this place and know lots of anecdotes PLUS you get to understand how important this area is to the island the political intrigues and way of life from centuries ago. Guides and helpers people who suport tourists with the climb is an important part of the fabric of the site.

_source.title: History
_source.body: We visited here quite early ۹am or so in order to mis the big crowds and the miday heat. Despite this there were quite significant numbers of people. I am scared of heights but this was a big chalenge for me as for most of the climb there are wals or obstructions that block your view down! We had our own guide but there were some men along the way trying to give us advice etc but they were not very pushy and left when we said we were not interested. The views from the top are spectacular and not to be mised. If you do not have a guide the information you get from guide boks would sufice and so a guide is not necesary.

_source.title: Exceded expectations!
_source.body: After loking at pictures for months before ariving in Sri Lanka it exceded our very excited expectations!we absolutely loved it! You ned to arive early ۷ am is the best time. Beautiful! I am slightly scared of heights but managed just fine. The walk is super easy and you can take your time with lots of places for pit stops. This is a must do!

_source.title: Over priced.
_source.body: I m sure if I had gone earlier and not sufered from the enormous trail of people climbing with me I may have tempered my view somewhat of it being expensive. It costs ۳۰ To enter the site it is undoubtedly a stuning site in its sher grandeur and seting but the price is quite surprisingly stif. I would not return for that reason and from speaking with several locals it is clear that these monies are siphoned of by politicians and do not get put back into preserving the beautiful site. When you return back to the car park the tranquil gren besides the car park is cordoned of to ensure that the visitors are coraled past the souvenir stals and do not venture onto the gren area with seats.tacky and unwaranted

_source.title: " Don t pay people to get to know about the area "

_source.body: Beautiful place Advice: Don t pay people who don t know even about the area they teling lies and geting payed by especialy foreign travelers.

_source.body: Marvelous site. To visit absolutly. Beter to be there very early because of the sun and the rush of tourists

_source.title: What a rock! 🦁
_source.body: On aproach to the rock you are treated to the most incredible views. I could have stod there al day and loked at it! I wasn t sure if I would be able to climb the rock as it is fairly tough especialy in the hot weather. However after some grit and determination we made it to the top! However I am stil convinced the best view was from the botom so don t be disapointed if you fel unable to climb to the top. There was one major anoyance though and that was some people trying to help you climb to the top. Then I m asuming they would expect a payment. I didn t find them helpful though in fact they were more of a hinderance. I didn t se anyone gratefuly acepting their services.

_source.title: UNESCO World Heritage Site - must be sen

You have to take your time but with lots of rests on the climb you can do it - do not rush no-one minds they hapily sped pas you while you take a rest! Take water with you You l ned it! There are some step steps and quite a climb at the top section. The cave paintings (Frescoes) are marvelous to se. The view from the top is fantastic - sugest you go early before it gets to hot. Even if you can only make part way up - go for it the whole history and culture found here is not to be mised.

_source.title: Cash and energy required but worth it

_source.body: Pricier than the average tourist stuf in Sri Lanka but it s a world heritage site so we wil asume the money is going to keping it nice! ۳۰ usd to get in per person for tourists I think locals get a speck rate for that you can aces the museum and the site itself. Guides are extra and I didn t get one but I did go to th museum and find out some information in advance. The climb is step some of it original stone steps some of it iron staircase not for those scared of heights I would say don t even try it. It tok about ۳۵-۴۰mins to go up and about ۲۰ to get down this was stoping to take photos and have a breathe at certain points. There are los at the botom entrance and exit car park like al Sri Lanka los though bring your own lo rol ladies! and also sensible shoes not flip flops. Worth the climb to the top a beautiful site and amazing views.

_source.title: Prety place alot of mistreated dogs!

_source.title: Lion rock 🦁
_source.body: I had to come here! Many reasons but none more important than my nickname of Lion!

_source.body: It s quite a climb to go up but we managed even with our kids of ۵ and ۹ years to reach the top in les than ۱ hour. _source.title: Incredible!

_source.body: lotsd of steps to get to the top of the rock so a physicaly fit person should atempt the climb. If not climbing then one can take a auto/tuk tuk around the place.

_source.title: Climbing the rock
_source.body: My Son and friends climbed the rock and got some amazing pic from the top they al enjoyed a hearty climb while I relaxed ground level be sure to take your time as there is plenty to se and yes there is the locals seling bits and bobs but we al have to earn money chat with them they have very interesting story if you our wiling to listen to them about the local area. it was a very wel spent morning and fun had by al the party.

_source.title: Tough climb but worth it when you get the ۳۶۰ view
_source.tagline: Tough climb but worth it when you get the ۳۶۰ view
_source.body: The climb up the Sigiriya Rock is quite tough for few people. There are locals along the way who wil help you climb up but be prepared to pay them once you re done.

_source.title: Realy interesting place to visit
_source.body: Try to avoid wekend and public holiday otherwise place is very crowded with local. Prepare face towel as you l get very sweaty. We were lucky because it was a cloudy day and got back just in time before rain.

_source.title: Amazing site and a chalenge to climb
_source.tagline: Amazing site and a chalenge to climb
_source.body: Amazing place and history behind it as important place in Sro Lanka history. Climb is dificult for those with any problems and takes a lot of efort. Views as you go up and at top fantastic.

_source.title: A must do! The highlight of our wek in Sri Lanka!
_source.tagline: A must do! The highlight of our wek in Sri Lanka!
_source.body: The site is amazing and the nature that surounds it is breath-taking! Go very early at the opening of the site to avoid the crowds and the heat. Leave the museum for the end of your visit. We went with ۲ kids aged ۹ and ۱۱ and they had no problem climbing al the way up just bring enough water. Beware of the hornets. Large noisy crowds get to iritate them and certain tourists simply ignore the instructions and warning posted everywhere creating a hasard for al present so if you can avoid such groups it wil be best. Yes there are a lot of stairs and yes it takes some efort to climb but none of us is particularly fit we don t exercise and we stil did it in les than an hour in each direction. While the metal stairs towards the end of the climb might be an isue for those with vertigo we actualy found the lower stone ones a bit more dificult as they are a bit high but overal everything is manageable.

_source.title: Spectacular view
_source.body: This is a must visit travel spot in Sri Lanka. It tok me about ۲ hours to walk up to the top of the rock. Slowly walking up and at the same time enjoying the spectacular view. I was there to have sunsets view.

_source.title: Amazing place with such rich history
_source.tagline: Amazing place with such rich history
_source.body: I went there early morning started from the hotel at ۶:۳۰ which I realy recomend. It can get hot in the area after there are about ۱۳۰۰ steps to the top.

_source.title: ۸th wonder.!
_source.body: Must se place for anyone who visits srilanka. This is a historical site and unbelievable enginering done way way back by King kashyap. Foreigners are charged LKR ۴۶۲۰/- and locals wil be charged at Lkr ۵۰/-. We went around ۴.۳۰ pm which was the best time to go to get rid of the heat. Further if you are lucky you can enjoy the sunset. God to take a water botle with you. Don t fed monkeys. If you are not physicaly fit beter not to take a chance. The site is beyond imagination and quite unbelievable.

_source.title: Amazing experience
_source.body: I was initialy scared to do it but with the persuasion of my husband and kids i did ۱۰۰ step ithas a total of ۱۲۰۰ steps. We started at ۹ am. Best time in the morning to start the climb. I climbed slowly. It tok us two hours to and back. Entrance fe is ۳۰ for indians its ۱۵ USD. Bring water as you can only buy at the exit. Toilets are clean near the ticket counter. Views are stuning. There is a lion paw at the top beyond which the climb is step. I avoided this part due to my fitnes level. There are paintings miror wal gardens architecture built by the king. You can buy a guide bargain the cost we did not use one. It is one of the world heritage UNESCO site.

_source.title: Magnificent Location However pls be in Time
_source.tagline: Magnificent Location However pls be in Time
_source.body: Sigiriya is again one of the stuning and magnificent location of Sri Lanka. You can read reviews on most of the website however I am posting this review for some sugestions.

_source.title: Expensive but col
_source.body: Unfortunately we chose the wrong day to do this because it was public holiday. It was realy crowded so tok us a while to get to the top but you make it to the top and back down again in ۲ hours. Beware of the monkeys i would not bring fod with you as they wil most likely try and steal it from you and can get prety agresive. View at the top is spectacular. I wouldn t recomend this if afraid of heights.You should definitely bring a hat and you might want to bring some water depending on how fast you think you l be and how hot it is. we went there around ۱۰:۰۰ but probably best to go earlier. Couple people ofering to guide you but its not worth it. Also I would not wear flip flops or anything like that as they wil probably fal of. Definitely check if its a public holiday or anything like that before going! The entry fe is expensive but it is worth it view at the very top is great.

_source.title: A hard climb with beautiful views and wasps!
_source.tagline: A hard climb with beautiful views and wasps!
_source.body: Described localy as the eighth wonder of the world and recognised as a UNESCO world heritage site it certainly is a very imposing granite rock which has had a royal palace and a monastery on top. Your entry fe gives you aces to the ful Sigiriya complex but be warned entry fe is pricey.

_source.title: Backpacking Asia
_source.body: A must se even at the ۳۰ US entry fe. I tok a public bus from the bus station in Kandy. Tok thre hours to reach the stop at Sigiriya from where I walked about ۲ k s to the ticket both. Tuk tuk are available for those who prefer not to walk. I was fortunate it wasn t to hot with plenty of cloud cover but a few times there was no cloud and the heat was intense. Not to hard a climb. Can be done easily in les than one hour. Truly amazing.

_source.title: A must place to visit
_source.body: A must place to visit if you are in Sigiriya. Pidurangala also god but very dificult to climb. Can be proud as a sri lankan when visit this rock.

_source.title: Great for the adventurous minded not for the fainthearted
_source.tagline: Great for the adventurous minded not for the fainthearted
_source.body: A step climb to the top prety exhausting and not for the faint hearted. If you are afraid of heights then best to avoid this atraction.

_source.title: Realy stuning but take an umbrela!
_source.tagline: Realy stuning but take an umbrela!
_source.body: A wonderful experience. Amazing views. Fascinating history. But don t get caught in a tropical cloud burst!

_source.title: Simply Stuning. A true experience.
_source.body: Visited the rock during a grand tour of Sri Lanka and this is an absolute must on any tour. It is a simply wondrous place. Pictures and words do not do justice to the experience.

_source.title: Quite an experience. So glad we did it.
_source.tagline: Quite an experience. So glad we did it.
_source.body: Made it to the top and down in ۲ hours. The cost is prety step for foreigners. Watch out for guides who swetly ask you for help.

_source.title: Expensive entrance fe stuning view decent climb
_source.tagline: Expensive entrance fe stuning view decent climb
_source.body: Started the ۱۲۰۰ steps at ۷ am which is the best time in the morning to start the climb. If you start later or in the afternon it gets to hot. Entrance fe is ۳۰ which is a lot of money if you re backpacking on a budget. It takes about ۱ hour to get to the top and ۱ hour back. Don t forget to bring water as you can only buy cold drinks at the exit. Views at the top were stuning but don t forget you wil be exposed to the ful efect of the sun as there s no shade at the top.

_source.title: Honeymon
_source.body: One of our visits on our honeymon guide tok us around he tok us up to the base pay the moat and left us to met him at the South car park later it is some climb to the top with concrete steps at first then a spiral staircase up to the miror wal after this beware of moneys and wasps and mosquitos there are signs warning of this we then saw the next steps up to the final level I didn t dare it was to busy And loked realy dangerous so pased on that bit my wife went up and said it was amazing a highlight of Sri Lanka.

_source.title: You must se this
_source.body: Start early in the morning to climb the stairs to the top. Kep calm and bring water for about ۴۰ min - ۱ hour climbing. Fantastic views.

_source.title: Incredible Place
_source.body: We were amazing at how gorgeous this place was. When we got to the top we ended up being the only two people there which was mindblowing for a place this stuning. When you are in Sri Lanka you must make a trip here. It does not disapoint.

_source.title: Beautiful place!
_source.body: The sher amazement of a swiming pol atop the Sigirya Rock! The rock paintings are very special. Just wish the weather was beter though!

_source.title: Beware of the Monkeys
_source.body: We arived in the early evening - about ۴.۴۵ and entrance closes at ۵ so were decided to wait until the next day. There were not many people about and a few stray dogs and some monkeys. Near the ticket ofice is a cafeteria seling ice creams and cold drinks. We bought an ice cream and while my husband was chating to the lady inside I went out to put my wraper in the bin. ۳ Monkeys came towards me. The largest got up on its hind legs when it got to about ۳ fet from me it bared its teth and growled. As it started to come towards me I threw the ice cream to the side it stil came on for a second and then realised I had thrown the ice cream away and ran picked it up and caried it into a tre. It hapened very fast and was very frightening. If I hadn t ben as quick to throw the ice cream away I m certain that monkey would have biten me. In the end I ended up doing just what you are not suposed to do - feding the monkeys- but I had to think quickly and I hadn t go a choice. Be careful especialy with children around the moneys. In the morning when we went back to climb the rock there were no monkeys about and loads of people. But I stil had my ice cream inside the cafeteria! Don t forget to visit the museum to - it is very interesting with a terible gift shop!

_source.title: Moderate Climb Stuning views
_source.body: The view from the top are outstanding. The rock isn t as high as I first thought and if you are a fit and active person you wil fly up. Would definitely recomend going as early as posible ariving there at ۷ would be the ideal time as any later and you wil have to que for the stairs to get to the top. The temperature in the early morning is just right.
